"I don't know, Jan." said Chris, finally. "Mom and dad are sure to put a number of safeguards into place to keep us from running off anywhere while they are gone."

"Then we will have to bypass them." you said, seriously. "We have to get to that school and, at least, offer our help." you grinned. "I could use my AGT (Anti Gravity Transport) and you could go on your broomstick, we'll slip in and talk directly to the dean of the school."

"Boys are not allowed inside, Jan." said Chris, just as seriously. "It's a girls' school, remember?" she shook her head. "Sneaking in is a bad idea, especially for a boy like you."

"Becoming a girl is child's play." you said, lightly. "I'll fit right in and reveal myself once we gain an audience with the dean of the school."

"Still a bad idea." said Chris. "I say we do it the right way and talk to the front gate guard and request an audience."

"Oh yeah?" you asked, crossing your arms, annoyed. "What if they say no, what then?"

Chris shook her head, becoming annoyed herself. "Jan..."

Like most siblings, you and Chris fell into an argument over which way to gain entry into the witch school....

Who won?
1112112122122111.title: I know something...

choices: Sneak out, watch for the attack.
11121121221221112.content:
Chris eventually won the argument and you helped her bypass three spells and four events, allowing you and her to leave the house, after mom and dad had left to search for Hank's missing parents. You could not help wonder, as you flew your AGT into the air, if they were doing something other than going on adventures. Unknown to all, except mom and dad, Hank's parents were mediators, immune to both magic and mad science. They were off to different parts of the world, desperately trying to keep the peace between the two powers.You shook your head, dropping the thought for the moment and focused on your mission.

"How far is it to this witch school?" you asked Chris, flying near you.

"About fifty miles from here." replied Chris. "We should get there just before they lock down for the night."

You nodded and punched your forward drive with Chris following suit. Twenty minutes later, you and Chris arrived at the witch school, which looked like any other boarding school from the air. Chris signaled you to follow, you nodded and you both came down in front of the school to a pair of very surprised young women, you knew were witches, standing guard behind the closed front gate.

"Do you see what I see, Eliza?" asked the first witch.

"I do indeed, Lucy." replied Eliza. she turned to you and Chris as you dismounted. "We were just about to lock up for the night, young lady, you are lucky your brother got you back here in time."

"I am not a..." Chris began to say but the second woman cut her off as she opened the gate inward.

"No excuses, young lady." said Lucy, sternly. "All students here know that curfew is strictly enforced."

She moved to grab Chris' hand, to pull her inside, but found herself facing you. "Incompetence!" you hissed. "Every witch who attends here is given a magical marker in order to locate them should they ever go missing!" you frowned. "Do you sense such a marker on my sister or I?"

Eliza smiled. "You both have that marker... the second you sneaked out of your house, unauthorized." she replied.

You gasped, realizing that you and Chris had missed a failsafe that magically registered you both as students at the witch school. Before you could make a move, Lucy grabbed your hand, pulling you behind the gate while Eliza did the same to Chris.

"We were informed this morning that you two might pay us a visit." explained Eliza as Lucy transformed you into a girl, despite your efforts to resist it. "Your parents will be given the choice weather to come for you upon their return or to leave you both here for a year of training."

"Noo!" whined Chris, seeing herself regressing to the age of ten. "I already went through training!"

"Then it should be easy for you." said Lucy, giving a giggle. "You can help your new twin sister adjust."

With that, your ATG and Chris' broomstick were both confiscated and you were escorted into one of the buildings, now wearing only pink nightgowns and undergarments. Inside, you and Chris were each ushered to a bed and ordered to get some sleep. Looking around, you noticed that there were four other girls in the room, all fast asleep. You released a low sigh and crawled into your bed as Chris reluctantly did the same.

"You will meet your teacher in the morning." said Eliza, kindly. "Oh, and kids," she smiled. "welcome to witch school."

With that said, they quietly left the room. Once they were gone, you turned to Chris. "I told you we should have sneaked in, sis." you whispered, sourly. "What do we do now?"
11121121221221112.title: Chris won, you both lose.

choices: waking up to your new schoolmates
111211212212211121.content:
"What can we do? They never gave us the chance to explain why we're here. All they did was give us these bodies, and nightgowns" you say sourly.

"Don't worry sis. I believe you" Chris says gently. You're too grateful to be annoyed with her calling you 'sis'. "Lets hope the school doesn't get attacked" Chris says.

"He'd be and idiot if he tries. Good thing we're not having anymore stupid ideas, like escaping. Look, someone is patrolling outside" you whisper, pointing to a flashlight beam. "Yeah. What are we going to do tomorrow, Jan? We have to call you something else."

"Deal with it in the morning" you say, yawning slightly. Somehow you feel tired, plus you've got more on your mind than a girly name. You're a mad scientist in the heart of the witch's school. You have no idea what would happen if you're discovered, assuming the witches think you was just an ordinary boy, that has a witch sister, or what would happen to you if you start learning and practicing magic. Eventually you drift into a troubled sleep.

Little do you and Chris know, Zed had planned to attack the school that night, but thanks to you and Chris's arrival, the school has been spared. Even more fortunately he doesn't know your or Chris's true identity, only that the two new 10 year old girls foiled his attack plan. Unfortunately he is plotting to deal with you and your sister...
111211212212211121.title: Postponing trouble, and you don't know it

1112112122122111211.content:
Due to a spell you and Chis were unaware of, you and she slept slightly longer than the others. You woke up to a gentle shaking and found yourself facing Lucy, one of the witches who had dragged you into the school.

"Good morning... Janna." said Lucy with a giggle. "Go shower and change into your school uniform. Chris is already dressed and ready for class, get moving."

You moaned, eying Lucy with an air of annoyance, then got up and showered before getting into the school uniform. It was a short dark blue skirt with a white blouse and a dark blue jacket with a light blue bow around the blouse collar. It came with knee high socks and black mary jane shoes. In all, it was embarrassing for you to wear, having the mind of not only a teen boy but a mad scientist.

"This is humiliating!" you thought, walking out of the bathroom. "I hope that Zed does attack, just so I can vent my anger for this outrage!"

As you were fuming inside, you failed to realize that you were brightly blushing which brought all of the girls to the same conclusion, you were a boy on the inside.

"As you have already guessed from Janna's blushing." said Lucy, smiling at you. "She is actually a transformed boy, all classes at witch school have at least one in their group."

You blushed more brightly at that as Chris giggled. "So much for going unnoticed, sis." she said.

The other girls giggled with her and you turned away to go back to bed but one of the girls caught your arm. "Don't take it so hard, Janna." she said, kindly, releasing you. "I have a twin brother too, none of us care if you were once a boy. My name is Melanie Harrison, my friends call me Mel."

You looked around at the other girls, who nodded in agreement and sighed. You were relieved that the girls did not see you as a threat, most likely because they did not know of your true talents. "My real name is Juan Smith." you replied. "My friends call me Jan."

Mel shrugged. "Jan is short for Janna." she said. "I see no harm calling you Jan."

"That would make me more comfortable." you agreed. "Is your bother here as well?"

Mel shook her head. "He is at Roughneck boot camp, learning to be a police officer of sorts." she said. "We really don't like the idea but his talents are strong, he needs proper training."

You nodded, knowing that the Roughnecks were a select number of witch boys who exhibit limited magical power as a boy, namely energy blasts and defensive shields. The only problem is that their group had an 80% 'fatality' rate. That was to say, 40% of the entire number push their power too far and become girls and, thus, witches. Another 20% actually die in the line of duty. An additional 20% fall in love and fake their deaths and live in isolation to raise a family. The final 20% make it to retirement and die of old age...

"Hello, I'm Erica." said a second girl, pulling you out of your thoughts. "I know how you feel, being here. I was originally a boy as well. My older sister fell into tears, no knowing how to tell me she was a witch." she paused, shedding a tear. "Mom misunderstood it and permanently changed me into a girl as a punishment."

"That's a bit harsh." said Chris, wincing. "Didn't the witch court do anything?"

Erica nodded. "Two women in police uniforms, I learned they were called rogue hunters, came for her a few hours later." she said. "Only I had forgiven her by then and told them that I had found a vial in front of a closet door and slipped on the wet kitchen floor, trying to ask her about it." she grinned. "The vial flew from my hand and broke on my head."

"A magical mishap." said Chris, smiling. "Clever."

You shuddered at such a thing happening to you then turned to the third girl as she spoke. "I'm Natasha Wealth." she said, smiling. "My family comes from a long line of healer witches, I'm here to learn magic so I can learn the trade."

"I am Patti Garrison, daughter of the dean to this school." said the last girl. "Before you think anything, I do not take advantage of that title so please do not ask for any favors." she then grinned. "My mom does not believe in taking the 'easy' way so I'm going to have it just as rough as all of you."

"What's your story, Jan, Chris?" asked Mel. "Spill it."

You and Chris looked at each other, uncertain...
1112112122122111211.title: waking up to your new schoolmates

choices: Patti takes you to her mom.
11121121221221112111.content:
You were not too keen on telling them the truth about your abilities in fear of them wanting to 'convert' you into a full witch, not knowing that the two powers actually mirrored the other. Only, you knew that Chris would rather tell them the truth rather than risk losing trust and potential help down the road. Finally, you sighed to Chris' 'tell them' looks.

"I am a mad scientist, Chris is a witch." you explained. "We have been training each other over the past year through technological and magical pranks and practical jokes, forcing each other to build our resistance, reflexes, and skills to out do the other."

The girls looked at you, slowly grinning, now knowing that they had a mad scientist in their midst. "How did you two end up here at witch school?" asked Natasha, curious. "Did you decide to want to give magic a try?"

"Jan heard of an old war between witches and mad scientists." said Chris. "He showed me his evidence, its credible, but to the point, we have reason to believe that a mad scientist, named Zed Brawl and his witch sister, Elena Kruse are attempting to rekindle that war."

Gasps rose from your group as you then added. "We believe that Zed may plan to attack this school, we had come to try to stop him."
11121121221221112111.title: You tell them the truth.

111211212212211121112.content:
Patti, after a moment of thought, took your hand. "This had better not be a joke." she said, seriously. "My mom does not tolerate anyone wasting her time."

"This is not a joke, Patti." you said, equally as serious. "This Zed Brawl exists and my father is the one who calculated that he would attack this school."

Patti shivered at the thought of a fully trained mad scientist attacking the witch school as she had heard all the rumors about them, most of them stretched versions of the truth that came from war propaganda. Within minutes, you and Patti were standing in front of the deans office where she knocked politely.

"Ms Garrison?" she asked. "It's Patti, I need to speak with you... it's important."

"Enter." came a woman's response in a serious tone.

Patti sighed, hoping she was not making a mistake and opened the door, allowing you to enter first. "This is..."

"Juan Smith." finished Ms Garrison. "You are going by the name of Janna during your stay here, correct?"

"Correct, ma'am." you replied immediately. "My sister and I have come here because..."

"...you have reason to believe this school will soon be under attack." Garrison again finished. "We have already been warned, young lady, just as we were warned that you and your sister might take matters into your own hands." she sighed wearily. "You heart is in the right place but we can not allow you to interfere."

"Due to the constant, err, training I have had with my sister, she and I are more qualified to face this threat." you argued. "We are here to offer our assistance in this delicate matter."

"Your offer is declined." replied Garrison, flatly. "You have been training against a witch with powers equal to your own, not against a mad scientist who has fought in a war against witches who are both far more powerful and experienced."

You allowed your head to fall slightly. "I don't want this war to rekindle..."

"No one does, Janna." said Garrison, more gently. "I lived through the last war, I saw horrors from both sides that would bring you nightmares." she again sighed. "I am very pleased that a young mad scientist, such as yourself, is willing to fight for peace, it gives me hope for the future. However, you are out of your league... stay out of this."

With that, she pressed a button and your teacher, Lucy, stepped into the room. "You may take them back to class." said Garrison, politely. "I am finished with them."

Lucy nodded then turned to you and Patti. "Shall we?"

Reluctantly, you walked out the door with Patti and Lucy following. Before she left behind them, Garrison called Lucy back into the room. "Young Janna and Christina are determined to face Zed, should he attack." she told her. "Please see to it that they are both kept very busy, I do not wish them to be the first students sent home in body bags."

Lucy swallowed hard, seeing the seriousness of the situation. "I can not lean harder on them without doing the same to the entire class." she said. "What can I do?"

"Try incorporating Janna's true identity and powers into your lessons." suggested Garrison. "Do what you can to keep them out of this 'situation' and out of harms way."

"I will do what I can." promised Lucy.

With that, she quietly left as Garrison pulled out a small bottle of rum from a locked drawer and took a deep sip. "This is going to be an interesting year with us now accepting mad scientists as students." she said. "I wonder which discipline the 'girls' will like better, magic or mad science."

Minutes later, inside your dorm, Lucy, returning with you and Patti, gathered everyone around. "Class, it is time for..."
111211212212211121112.title: Patti takes you to her mom.

1112112122122111211121.content:
"It's time for your first magic lesson." said Lucy, smiling. "First, everything in life has a balance. In our case, we have magic endowed girls and mentally blessed boys. Thus giving us witches and mad scientists."

"But not all witch boys become mad scientists." argued Erica. "Mel's brother, for example."

"A very good observation, Erica." said Lucy. "No, not all witch boys become mad scientists, just as not all witch girls become talented in magic, there is a different balance at play here."

"Those witches whose magic powers are unstable, due to a boy twin who is not a mad scientist or do not have the desire to work magic or science become physically blessed." said Lucy. "In the case regarding Mel's brother, he quickly gained incredible strength and sharp reflexes, plus an ability to generate force waves of sheer will. In return, Mel's magic became more stable and will continue to grow in tune with his brother's gift." she smiled. "If it had not, the twin factor would have turned on her and 'he' would have been joining his brother at Roughneck boot camp."

Mel and Chris, you noticed, both shivered at the thought, causing you to chuckle. Unfortunately, Lucy had a rule about those who laughed at other's expense. "Thank you, Janna, for volunteering to be the first example for this lesson."

"What!?" you asked, surprised. "What did I do?"

Mel, having heard of her older sister's experiences at witch school turned to you, smiling. "You laughed at mine and your sister's expense, the teachers have a rule against that here."

"You can't be serious!" you said, irritated.

"I am always serious when it comes to teaching my class, Janna." said Lucy, smiling. "To give the class an example of the effects of the twin factor, you are to only use magic until I say otherwise." her smile flattened. "I can detect the subtle difference between the two energies so don't think about trying to deceive me."

You sighed, knowing you were not going to win. "Fine, but I don't have to like it."

Lucy shook her head, smiling again. She had dealt with a mad scientist, turned witch, in her class before. "You might be surprised, Janna." she said. "Don't tell me your 'superior' mind can't handle controlling magic."

All of the girls in the room smiled, tears forming as they struggled not to laugh, knowing the price. You turned to Lucy, annoyed. "I can handle anything you throw at me." you challenged.

"Big mistake!" thought Mel, smiling. "He's a nice boy, but... what an ego!"

"You might regret saying that, Janna." replied Lucy, amused. "Listen carefully, I am about to explain how to summon a magical test flame..."

Unknown to all, as you listened to Lucy explain how to produce a magical test flame, another student was learning a lesson of her own. Sarah Mitchel, originally Samuel, was taking advantage of some down time to call her mom in the front garden when a strong hand clamped over her mouth. She tried to scream but the sound never escaped as she and her unknown attack vanished from the school grounds. Moments later, Sarah woke to find herself tied and gagged inside a van in parts unknown. In front of her was a tall, muscular man in all black.

"Good morning, Samuel Mitchel." he said with a slight European accent. "I am Zed Brawl, bounty hunter. Your father is very anxious to see you again."

Sarah gasped and began to struggle against her bonds to which the man chuckled. "Relax, I have a deal to offer you and I suggest you take it."

Sarah swallowed hard, bounty hunters were the mad scientists' version of the witch police. Zed was not a bounty hunter by any stretch of the imagination but Sarah had no way of knowing otherwise. "What do you want of me?" she asked.

"I know you got yourself into witch school by very cleverly forging documents." said Zed, not knowing that 'her' mother had sent official documentation prior to Sarah's forgeries. "There is going to be an attack on the school by a rogue mad scientist, I need to get into the school undetected so I may protect the students when the attack occurs."

"Why not just inform the witch council?" asked Sarah, still shaken.

"Events have shaken the trust between the two powers." explained Zed. "The teachers and staff must not know I am there so they will act normally and I can catch this rogue in act."

Sarah slowly nodded. "I understand." she said. "I will get you in so long as you do not inform my father where I am, it is my desire to be a witch."

Zed frowned. "So be it." he said.

With that, he fired an energy blast at Sarah. She did not have the time to scream as the force of the hit rendered her unconscious while Zed transformed himself into an exact copy of her. "I'll just take your place." he said. "It makes me weep, knowing that a child mad scientist would rather be a witch... how weak you are."

Moments later, with Sarah tied and gagged inside an abandoned house down the street, Zed walked onto school campus with an evil smile on 'her' face. "Now then, to find those two interfering girls...."
1112112122122111211121.title: Some lessons more painful than others.

11121121221221112111211.content:
Zed walked onto school grounds with his DNA altered to make him an exact duplicate to the student, Sarah Mitchel, only with his original power and mind. 'Sarah' walked back into her dorm and looked about, she did not sense the two girls who had sent the school onto high alert with their sudden appearance.

"They must be in another class." she thought. "I'll have to search for them."

She turned to leave when a young woman caught her arm. "Were you able to get a hold of your mom, Sarah?" she asked.

'Sarah' turned to the woman and, fortunately recognized her. "The line was busy, Miss Thomas." she said. "I... I didn't want to try my dad's line." she forced a blush. "Not yet."

Thomas was a virtual Amazon, standing at six foot ten with the body of an athlete. She was also well developed in the chest but carried a humble personality. She smiled at Sarah, thinking she was the shy girl who had left minutes earlier before pulling her in for a friendly hug. "Don't worry, dear." she said, kindly. "Your father will come around eventually. Personally, I am proud that you chose to be a witch, just like your older sister, Joann."

'Sarah' smiled. "Thanks, Miss Thomas." she said. "Um... I heard a rumor that we have two last minute students."

Thomas giggled. "The rumor is true, they're parents are a part of the peace effort between witches and mad scientists." she said. "They are twins, one is a witch and the other is a mad scientist."

"They must have caught wind that I might attack the school and came here to stop me." thought 'Sarah'. "Only the school sensed them coming and enrolled them to keep them out of the way."

"See, Sarah?" asked Thomas. "You are not the only mad scientist learning to be a witch here." she giggled. "The only difference...that other mad scientist is not doing this quite as willingly as you."

'Sarah' giggled with her then reluctantly walked with Thomas back to her class. "I've got to sneak away and find those twins before they sense me." she thought. "If they are the Smith twins, as I suspect, they will be a threat to my plans if they decide to interfere."

On the other side of the school, you stared in wonder at your first produced magical flame test with a child like grin on your face. "Extraordinary!" you whispered to the girls' giggles.

"That is just the beginning of your magic potential, Janna." said Lucy. "Just bear in mind that magic does not mix well with science, the resulting power becomes too unstable to control."

You nodded then voiced your greatest fear. "Is there a chance that this magic will take root?"

Lucy smiled. "If that magic flame appears on its own with no concentration on your behalf, then you can worry." she said. "Otherwise, you have nothing to fear."

"In that case," you said, smiling, "what's the next step?"

Chris laughed with the others laughing. "You truly have a curious mind, sis." she said.

You and your class continued the lesson with Erica learning to summon her test flame next. "Just relax and visualize the blue flame harmlessly burning in your hand." instructed Lucy. "The magic within you will do the rest."

Eric took a deep breath to calm herself and did as Lucy asked. A moment later, a blue flame, slightly smaller than your own appeared and harmlessly burned in her hand. She smiled seeing it. "Cool..."

"Socially speaking, in the witch world, the fame is only purposely summoned to prove you are a witch to a friend or younger sibling or to challenge another witch or a mad scientist to a duel." said Lucy. "I urge you not to summon the test flame for any other purpose to avoid misunderstandings."

Later that day...
11121121221221112111211.title: continue (Zed's POV)

111211212212211121112112.content:
Through out the day, you and your class had learned to summon and control test flames so to not only show younger siblings that magic is real but to show your true intentions to a fellow witch and to warn others, allied to you, of danger without speaking. It was fascinating to you that a test flame could communicate so much and wondered if the same could be applied to a pyrokinetic flame. It was close to five in the afternoon and Lucy had finally allowed you and your class to relax and socialize for the remainder of the day.

"I was a fool to think I wouldn't learn anything here." you muttered.

Lucy turned to you, amused. "I'm surprised you did not discover the many uses of a magical test flame while competing with your sister for nearly a year." she said.

You chuckled. "I've hardly been here a day and I am already discovering what was right in front of me all along." you said. "Maybe I need glasses."

The other girls giggled. "Sometimes the hardest thing to see is right in front of you, Janna." replied Lucy, gently. "All you need to see it is to take a step back." she smiled. "I think I will add this to tomorrow's lesson so you can all benefit from Janna's realization."

Suddenly, you griped Chris's arm and pulled her behind you in an instinctive act of protection as you sensed the power of a mad scientist, other than yourself. Knowing you well, Chis became concerned and looked about, becoming nervous. Lucy recognized the look on your face as she had seen it on her own brother, Paul Connors, who was a Roughneck.

"Use the flame, Janna." she whispered. "Put my teachings to use."

Hearing her, you summoned a magical flame and made it dance in a way that indicated possible danger. Upon seeing it, Lucy began to sense the presence as well and could feel the anger within it. "Everyone stay here." she ordered. "I will go investigate this, it's probably nothing."

With that, she walked out of the dorm room, into the hall to find 'Sarah' from a class on the other side of the school, out wandering the halls. Lucy knew of the conflict Sarah had with her father and guessed that she had been in contact with him as she could sense anger and frustration within her.

"Miss Mitchel, what are you doing away from your class?" she asked.

"I... I heard that there was another mad scientist in school." replied 'Sarah'. "I thought he... err... she and I could..."

Lucy smiled, she could smell a lie from a mile away. That and the fact she had dealt with mad scientists before was one of the many reasons a fourteen year old witch was asked to become a 28 year old teacher at witch school. "There are a number of mad scientists learning the art of witchcraft here, Sarah." she said. "There are none in my class but, even if there were, we are forbidden to discuss their identities to students outside of our group."

"I know." said 'Sarah' trying to sound defensive. "I wasn't asking where 'she' was, I was just hoping to sense 'her' out."

"Well, you can sense your way back to your class, young lady." said Lucy, sternly. "Before your teacher reports you missing and that will bring you more trouble than you want."

Reluctantly, 'Sarah' turned around and walked back the way she had come, looking over her shoulder occasionally as Lucy watched her leave. After 'Sarah' was out of sight, Lucy grabbed a small radio. "Security, we have a breach." she said. "Sarah Mitchel is missing..."
111211212212211121112112.title: You sense a hostile presence.

1112112122122111211121121.content:
After a minute on the radio with school security, Lucy walked back into the room where she found you, still keeping Chis behind you, holding a defensive stance. "That was Sarah Mitchel, another young mad scientist, turned student, Jan." she said, gently. "She had sensed your power and curiosity got the best of her."

"I see..." you said, still doubtful. "Have you sent 'her' back to class?"

Lucy nodded. "I also called security to ensure she does not wander further." she replied. "We like to think we are lenient but we also have to think of the safety of our students."

You nodded then released Chris. "What is the next lesson on the agenda?" you asked.

Lucy sighed then smiled. "You are a curious one." she said. "The next lesson is a practice duel but without direct magic."

The girls turned to each other, curious as Lucy added, "There will be times when you must defend yourself without using your powers of magic directly." she then turned to you. "Or mad science."

"How can we do that?" asked Erica.

Lucy smiled. "Indirect magic, it's a bit trickier to use but it is fun." she replied. "Just remember, when you use this to toy with your male sibling or friend, make certain that your mischief does not go too far, there are consequences to that."

"So... we will be having practice indirect duels?" asked Patti, trying to understand.

"Private duels." corrected Chris. "My brother and I practiced them as we had one unspoken rule, mom and dad can not find out." she sighed. "That proved to be a futile effort."

"More experienced witches and mad scientist can sense private duels if they are within a certain range, Chris." explained Lucy, gently. "Only, as they are private duels, it is frowned upon to interfere unless exposure or serious injury may result. In your case, it was a matter of sibling rivalry, training, but nothing serious."

You and Chris nodded as the other girls looked at the two of you smiling, Lucy noticed this and smiled herself. "As you two have had some experience in private dueling, why don't you demonstrate to the class how it is done"

"Well, there are technically three different types of private duels." you said. "There is the phantom duel in which you physically and mentally fight each other but no one else sees, hears, or feels the fight happening."

"There is also the potion/serum duel." added Chris. "Basically a discrete 'got you last' mischief duel that can go on for weeks and even months, depending on how stubborn the two fighters are."

"Then there is the mind game in which the two participants battle it out in a form of telepathic arena." you said, finishing. "Everyone else will think they are having a pleasant conversation or sitting alone, away from each other, when in fact, they are actually fighting inside."

Lucy nodded. "correct." she said. "However, I would like the class to witness this duel so please show us either the potion/serum duel or the phantom duel, revealing yourselves every few seconds so we may get an understanding."

Which duel do you and Chris demonstrate?
1112112122122111211121121.title: continue.

11121121221221112111211212.content:
"The potion and serum duel is the most entertaining." said Lucy. "Why don't you two show us a brief demonstration on how this duel would be carried out."

"Well, just last week, we had such a duel." replied Chris. "It started with me discretely lacing Jan's morning tea with a babble potion, causing him to talk like a baby for an hour."

The girls giggled then turned to you, blushing. "I countered by quickly spraying the doorway of her room with an instant plastic serum that wrapped her like a burrito the second she ran into it." you said. "It dissolved about a minute later but it left her feeling sticky everywhere until she took a shower."

The girls giggled at your comment as well, not knowing that you and Chris were preparing your demonstration for the class. Lucy noticed but said nothing as she knew, from yours and Chris' case files, that you would never do anything to intentionally harm an innocent.

"How long did this private potion and serum duel last?" asked Paula.

"Oh, about three days." replied Chris. she then suddenly produced a small cup. "Drink?"

Taken off guard, Paula took the drink, thanking Chis, then took it down. A few seconds later, she blushed as she began to feel strange. "Em dekcirt uoy!" she said, eying Chris accusingly before letting out a strange scream. "Eciov ym!"

Lucy laughed. "The reverse speech potion." she said with a giggle. "It causes its victim to talk backwards for a few minutes."

"So that's how you play the duel." said Mel, impressed. "You won't catch me off guard like that, I know better."

Chris' eyes widened at that but she felt herself changing before she could resist. A scream echoed from her throat as she felt her chest fall flat while her rose up, becoming shorter. "No!" she yelled. "Please, Miss Lucy!"

Lucy replied with a silent smile as she and the class watched Chris wince, feeling something appear between her legs as her insides shifted, making her, now him, a teenage boy. Only, instead of crying, she merely pouted. "This is not funny!"

"I am sorry, Chris but all students here must learn what it is like to be transformed." explained Lucy, smiling. "I targeted you as I had a feeling Jan had already done this to you during your year of self training."

Chris nodded, now understanding. "Not all witch boys become mad scientists." she said. "Some remain what we call 'normal' so witches must have an understanding of how they would feel."

"That's exactly right, Chris." said Lucy. "You see, class, general science is just as powerful as magic. The only difference is a boy needs to know a lot of science for him to even be a match to a witch."

"What of mad science?" asked Erica.

"Mad science is different." you said, to Lucy's nod. "It crams all branches of science into one discipline, giving us a power equal to magic. However, with any great power comes great responsibility."

"Well said, Janna." said Lucy. "The point is, not all witch boys can fight back as Janna here can. However, they too become a witch when you turn them into a girl and their power will be augmented by their emotions."

"But they wouldn't have any training." said Natasha. "Their spells would be random, at best."

"Random and dangerous." said Lucy. "Though it can be fun to change your brother or non magical friend, you must be certain to watch their reactions and monitor them the entire time they are transformed."

"When they discover they have magic as a girl, they will try to strike back." Patti. "If they are patient enough, they will study and hit you with a nasty surprise for revenge. Also, the longer magic is used against a witch boy, the more resistant he becomes to its effects."

Again, Lucy nodded. "That is the lesson here, class. Never keep a witch boy transformed for too long." she said. "One of three things will happen. One, she will learn magic and strike back; Two, she will gain enough magical resistance and change back on her own, which means a pummeling for you; or three, her form will lock which means to loss of your powers as a punishment."

1112112122122111211121121211212121211121.content:
Lucy called you and Chris to her office and bid you both to take a seat. "As we had promised, we gave your parents the choice of taking you two home upon their return or to leave you here for a year of training." she said, motioning to a phone on her desk, it was set to speakerphone. "They are on the line as we speak."

"I can't say I'm proud of you two for sneaking out of the house when ordered to stay." said dad's voice, calmly. "However, it turned out to be the right choice to make."

You and Chris exchanged worried glances as mom took over the conversation. "We returned home to find our house completely ransacked." she said. "Both your lab and dad's lab are still secure but the entrances suffered some major damages, someone badly wanted to get to your two."

"What do you want us to do?" you asked, startled. "I've been charged by Elvira Strange to protect Melanie Harrison from a psychotic scientist. Also, there is a rogue witch after me. So far we've managed to watch each others backs."

"Then you must continue to do so, Jan." said mom, serious. "You have accepted a job from the head witch to protect her granddaughter, that is an honor, young man."

"Also, there is no safer place to be than where you are now." added dad. "You two will remain there for the year, learning magic while your mother and I relocate."

Chris teared up. "Don't abandon us!" she sobbed.

"You will be given the new address, sweetie." said mom with a sigh. "We merely must relocate to avoid a second attack to our home."

"We shall contact you near the end of the year." promised dad. "Do not make any attempts to leave witchbloom unless you wish to become Janna for life, Jan." said dad. "Do not forget, you two are twins."

With that, the call was ended and Lucy pressed a button, silencing the dial tone. "We have kept our word and your parents have spoken." she said, seriously. "You will remain here for the rest of the year, any attempts from either of you to 'drop out' and Jan will be wearing that skirt longer than she might think."

Elsewhere...

Like how I'd converted my body's heat into electricity? This is painful to a witch. Lets see how a regular person handles my shock treatment" Zed said, sneering

1112112122122111211121121211212121211121.title: The Shock Treatment

1112112122122111211121121211212121211121.content:
Sarah woke up slowly, feeling pain everywhere on her small body as she heard the soft beep beep beep of a vital signs monitor close by. She moaned weakly before her eyes fluttered open to find herself lying in a bed in the private hospital wing of Witchbloom boarding school. Sarah saw that she was practically mummified in bandages and casts, causing her to panic slightly. "What happened to me!?" she whispered. "I want mommy!"

"Easy, child. You've had a rough few days." said a soothing voice as a light hand touched her bandaged forehead. "Harry and Emily Patton are both experts in magical and high tech devices, they were contacted the moment you vanished and tracked you down."

"Are they the two who saved me?" you asked in a weak voice.

A young woman's face came into view. "I am Katrina Towers, a healer witch." she said, introducing herself. "Yes, Harry and Emily rescued you. Only they failed to spot a devious trap, set by Zed." she swallowed hard. "You were nearly burned alive, Harry had to break all four of your limbs to free you from your bonds before you died."

Sarah began to cry. "H-He ma-made him-himself look-look li-like me!" she sobbed. "Who-Who knows wha-what he-he's do-doing to m-my fri-firends!"

"We know, believe me, he will be made to suffer for what he did to you." said Katrina, running her hand through what was left of Sarah's hair. "We have ways of dealing with such people."

Sarah was silent for a moment. "Zed told me I must be very important to someone before he ran off." she said. "I know I'm important to mom..."

Katrina giggled. "You are important to your father as well." she said. "It was he who summoned our best trackers the instant he sensed you were no longer inside the school." she paused. "How did he put it...? No one kidnapps my little girl and lives to tell the tale!"

Sarah teared up. "He does care about me." she cried. "I thought he was upset that I...."

"You are his child, Sarah." said Katrina, gently. "No matter what path you decide to take, he still loves you." she giggled, adding, "It's ironic, since he was originally a girl."

Sarah's jaw dropped as a low giggle escaped her lips. "Daddy was a girl?...."
1112112122122111211121121211212121211121.title: A father's love.

1112112122122111211121121211212121211121.content:
Just then, a tall and muscular man with sand blond hair and hazel eyes, like Sarah, entered the room with a look of heavy concern on his face. "My little cherub!" he yelled, crying. "What has that psychotic madman done to you!?!"

"A trap, set to kill her should anyone try to rescue her, Sam." explained Katrina. "Harry had to break her limbs to save her life from being burned alive."

Sam, hearing that, hurried to Sarah's side and took her hand. "I swear Zed will suffer!" he whispered. "He will meet a such fate that will make all his darkest nightmares pale in comparison!"

"I'm scared, daddy!" cried Sarah, weakly holding her dad's hand. "I want to be a witch but..."

Sam hushed her quiet. "I was once a girl, as you are now." he said. "Only my love was for mad science." he smiled. "If you desire to have magic, I will not stand in your way."

The two shared a tearful embrace, though it hurt Sarah to move, before Sam beckoned Katrina to leave. "I feel that I need to show you there is a good side to mad science." he said, once they were alone. "I can heal you quickly, if you will trust me to do what I must."

Sarah, although nervous, slowly nodded. "I trust you, daddy." she said.

Sam smiled then summoned a flame before Sarah's body glowed with a dim light, her body rising off the bed. "First we shall heal your insides." said Sam. "Feel the single celled machines as they enter you and do their work, they will seal the breaks and shield your bones with a bio-metal stronger than any steel."

Sarah felt the tinging of the nanites or single celled machines moving inside of her and soon felt no pain in her limbs or any where else in her body. "They tickle." she said, smiling a little.

"They are being gentle, my dear." replied Sam. "Now for the outside."

He touched her charred scalp and her sand blond hair grew at a rapid rate, falling past her shoulders as it once did. Then he focused on her face and body, removing all bruises and cuts, restoring her to normal. "You are very beautiful, my daughter." he said, using a cutting tool to remove her casts and bandages. "Behold, you are whole again."

Sarah turned to fine that her dad had summoned a mirror for her to see and wept tears of joy as she saw herself completely healed. "Thank you, daddy." she said, hugging him. "Are you going after Zed now?"

Sam shook his head. "Unless you wish to have a little sister for the year, I can not step foot on witch school grounds" he said, somewhat bitterly. "Do not fear though, Zed will be dealt with. If there is one thing Mad scientist have in common with witches, its that neither of us will tolerate being trifled with."

Back to Witchbloom, Zed, knowing that Sarah had been rescued ran down a dark hall, looking for another girl to take the place of so to continue his mission. After a moment of waiting, he attacked...
1112112122122111211121121211212121211121.title: continue.

1112112122122111211121121211212121211121.content:
You saw Zed in the form of a girl just outside of your class as you were the last in the line with Lucy right in front of you. He threw the even off, returning to his adult male form. "You are mine, pup!"

In response, you pushed Lucy into the room and slammed the door before shaking off the spell keeping you a girl. "No... you are mine!"

Lucy could only watch helpless for the moment as you and Zed charged each other with your sparks lighting the dark hall. Your fists collided and you both fell into an insane series of high speed punches, kicks and chops, shaking the walls. Zed summoned twelve clones of himself who all attacked you at once only you had faced such an attack from Chris and beat them all in a short time before throwing Zed a dark look.

"Come... If you dare." Taunting, you said.

Zed roared more with frustration than anger and charged you again with a knife in hand. This only brought a mad laugh from you, waving him on with your middle finger. Zed slashed at you but only hit air as you easily dodged his attacks. Your year of training with Chis made you fast and quick to anticipate an opponent's moves. "I was going to possess you but now I'm going to kill you!" Angry, Zed screamed.

Again, you laughed madly. "Blah, blah, blah!" Still taunting, you sang.

Zed charged with his knife only to have it kicked out of his hand before you delivered a heavy blast to his gut with your telekinesis, throwing him the far side of the hall! He coughed up a mouthful of blood before screaming in fury. You were besting him with seemingly little to no effort and it angered him to no end.

"What is this boy?!" Frustrated, he muttered. "His talents are beyond any I had ever encountered before!" He wiped the blood from his mouth. "I have to kill him now!"

Inside the classroom, Lucy had reached Elvira Strange on the intercom. "Zed Brawl has attacked Jan Smith!" Worried, she reported. "They are having a duel in the hall just outside the room!"

"The prefects are in the two joining halls, waiting for their opening to move in." Serious, Elvira replied. "Only they can not intervene with the duel, it is too dangerous."

"What do you mean too dangerous?" Concerned for you, Lucy demanded. "Jan does not stand a chance against that psychotic madman!"

The girls around her, including Chris and Mel began to cry, worried for you only they paused as Elvira replied. "Jan Smith is not a just mad scientist. He is a pseudo witch."

Mel turned pale. "His science has become so advanced, it is like magic..."

"No, Melanie." Darkly, Elvira said. "Jan's mad science has reached such heights that it has become magic."

Inside the hall, Zed roared, summoning all of his power. You responded with a smile and transformed back into your female self. Zed raised a single eyebrow but turned pale as you summoned a powerful flame to your left hand.

"Last chance, you psycho novice." Grinning, you said. "Surrender or face humiliation by being beaten by a girl."

Calling a mad scientist a novice was a great insult. It was worse to be beaten by a girl, transformed or not. He roared in complete fury, forgetting the powerful mad science at his disposal and physically charged you. Seeing your opening, you fired a bolt of lightning, hitting Zed dead in the face! He flew backwards, hitting the floor twice before striking the wall, unmoving. It was then the prefects jumped in and placed Zed into glowing handcuffs.

The door to your class then opened and Lucy ran out before giving you a quick hug and pulled you in out of danger. "That was very foolish and dangerous of you, Janna!"
Hissing, she scolded. "You could have been killed!"

"Elvira ordered me to defend the class." Weakly, you replied. "Mission accomplished."

Lucy sighed before touching your head and looking into your slowly drooping eyes. After a moment, she took you into her arms as you had fallen unconscious." I am very sorry, Chris." Softly, she said. "However...."
1112112122122111211121121211212121211121.title: Your true power surfaces.

1112112122122111211121121211212121211121.content:
Chris gulped. "Locked...?"

"As I warned him, mixing magic with mad science is dangerous." Serious, Lucy said. "It was even more dangerous for him as his power had become magic." She sighed. "Now she must live with her decision and grow up as a girl and a witch."

"She is going to take this hard." Wincing, Mel said.

"It could have ended far worse." Calmly, Lucy said. "Even then, it was only a matter of time before Chris had a twin sister." She turned to Mel. "The same would have happened if your brother, John had taken on Zed. He may be a powerful Roughneck but he would have had to shatter the forces keeping him male to defeat him."

Mel nodded, giving you a sad look. "So what now?"

"Classes are cancelled for today." Calmly, Lucy said. "When Janna wakes up, we will all welcome her to the witching world."

Soon after, Elvira entered the room and sighed seeing you sleeping in your bunk. "This was unavoidable." Softly, she said. "Janna would have had an extremely rough transition had she changed slowly."

"You mean Jan would have fought the changes." Worried, Chris said.

Elvira nodded. "At least this way, he changed making a positive difference in protecting the peace." Kindly, she said. "That alone will give her comfort."

"Zed has been dealt with but Eva Morgana is still at large." Wincing, Chris said. "What can we do?"

"Yours and Janna's role has not changed." Serious, Elvira said. "Your powers are impressive and will be very helpful in protecting this class only..." She sighed. "Now it is Janna and Chris who will be needing the protection."

"Because Eva will be targeting her." Softly, Lucy said. "Only now she is a witch for life, what more could she want?"

Elvira's expression turned dark. "She wants her father to suffer." Gravely, she said. "She is after more than making Janna a girl, she wants what she cannot have."

Lucy's face turned pale. "A daughter... or daughters."

Elvira pulled Lucy out of earshot while her students were busy comforting Chris, worried for you. "Eva attacks from a distance, using a form of telepathy to break down her target's mental defenses." Serious, she warned. "Keep their minds busy while we work on capturing her."

Lucy nodded, knowing she would have to step up her lessons.

As he followed you into your room, Hank made a noise in his throat. "Jane.. Your clothes. Or are you trying to tell me something?"

You sighed. While its possible to change yourself back, it is likely that you'll expose Chris as the one who did this, hence exposing her powers, something that is unacceptable to you. "Time delay."

11123121.content:
"My parents wedding, I did some research on it and found it fascinating." you replied with a hint of embarrassment.

"How so?" asked Hank, curious.

"To put it mildly, their love for each other was considered taboo by both their families." you said smiling. "I wanted to see how they managed to pull it off."

"Why would anyone want to stop them from marrying?" asked Hank, confused. "Even I can see their still madly in love with each other." he then sighed. "I wish I could see that in my family."

"Well, my parents were... unique." you told Hank, reluctantly. "Dad was, and still is, a mad scientist."

"I get that part, bro." said Hank. "What about your mom?"

"It's okay, Jan." said Chris, standing in the doorway, grinning. "You can tell him."

Hank bushed his black hair aside, revealing his green eyes, looking at Chris confused. "Huh? Tell me what?" he asked.

Behind Chris, your other friend, Sarah Reed giggled. She was a petite young girl with waist length blond hair and blue eyes. You had a crush on her since kindergarten but you had not yet found the nerve to tell her.

"I'm a witch." replied Chris, igniting a test flame in her hand. "I'm the one who gave Jan that better body and fashion update to show him what he's missing."

Hank screamed, taking a jumping step back as Sarah laughed. Only you smirked, igniting a pyrokinetic flame in return, causing Sarah to scream, jumping back as well. "If its fine for Hank to know about you, then it would be logical that Sarah should know about me." you said, smiling. "I am a mad scientist."

"You- You're a witch!?" asked Hank, surprised.

"You- You are a mad scientist!?" asked Sarah, equally as surprised.

"I agreed not to reveal Chris' secret without her permission, Hank." you said, quickly. "I didn't tell Sarah because I had no clue how she would have reacted."

"The same is true for me, Sarah." added Chris, blushing. "We've been honing our skills through pranks and practical jokes, targeting each other only."

"So long as you were unaware of my powers..." you began.

"I would not be a target." finished Sarah, turning slightly pale.

"I guess the same applied to me." said Hank, turning to Chris. "I'm a tough guy, I would have been spooked but I would've handled it." he then sighed. "I handled Jan's secret just fine, I'll keep your secret safe too."

"Why didn't you tell me?" asked Sarah. "I was okay with Chris' secret."

"I didn't want you to fear me, I'm not evil." you said, blushing.

Sarah merely shook her head. "I'm also far from being a delicate flower, Mr. mad scientist!" she said, annoyed. "You so owe me a tour of your laboratory!"

Hank turned to Chris, more curious. "Do you have a cave and a cauldron you want to show me?" he asked.

Chris laughed. "If it were twenty years ago, maybe." she replied. "These days, we witches use magic in more subtle ways to remain secret from the outside world."

"The same goes for us mad scientists." you added before sighing. "We just didn't want to see you guys get hurt because of our 'fun'."

Sarah and Hank turned to each other and smiled before turning back to you and Chris. "Can you show us a duel?" they asked in unison.

You and Chris grinned, both happy that your friends were not completely freaked by your secrets. "I don't see any harm in showing you a simple duel." you replied. "Just let me take off..."

The rest of the sentence never left your mouth as you felt a spell from Chris hit you, shorting the wrist mounted controls for your temporal viewing device. "NO!" you screamed, seeing the entire room around you starting to slowly distort. "Chris, what have you done!?"

There was a bright flash that blinded you all then a thunder like boom that caused your ears to ring before finding yourselves in the living room of your house. Only everything seemed strange somehow. Then you spotted a small, doll like girl with mid back length blond hair and ocean blue eyes. She stared at you, your sister, and friends with panic clear in her eyes. "Whe- Where did you come from!?!" she asked, freaked by the sudden entrance of four teenagers.

You tried to speak to explain but the girl had already run off, screaming, "Natalie!! Help!! Natalie!!"

"Um... dude, I think your gadget needs work." said Hank, finding his voice.

You turned to the couch and found a newspaper, picking it up, your face turned pale. "Oh, it worked perfectly." you replied, shaking. "It just got overloaded by magic." You then showed Hank and the others the newspaper, the date was May 5, 1989. "We are now a part of history."

"You sent us 22 years back into the past!?" asked Chris, paling. "Jan, are you completely insane!?!"

"It was designed to view the past only!" you countered, angrily. "It was your spell that overloaded it, genius!"

"I told you messing around with time would cause trouble!" said Hank, clearly freaked.

"You stay out of this!!" came yours and Chris' response.

While you and Chris argued over your situation, the girl that had run away from you was cowering near a slightly older girl who was trying to comfort the one while whispering into the telephone. "Please hurry, mom!" she said, softly sobbing. "Little Elvira's scared... and so am I!"

"What are they doing right now, Natalie?" asked her mom on the other line.

"They seem to be arguing about something." replied Natalie, daring to take a peek at you and your group. "They appear to be brothers and sisters."

"Just stay hidden, then." said Natalie's mom. "I'm pulling into the driveway now with Catherine and Jack."
11123121.title: enter the girls

111231211.content:

Later on....

"These peace talks are crucial as the two families who had started this war, ages ago, have completely died out, they completely destroyed each other." said Elvira.
