Hours later, Elvira walked into a grand hall to meet her brother and the leader of the mad scientists, Devon Bizarre. He was practically a Juggernaut with huge muscles and a massive frame. Only his gentle green eyes, showing through his longish black hair gave away some of his true nature. You stood at his side and bowed respectively to the head witch and your sister. "The time has come to talk of the possibility of a better understanding between us." said Devon.

"This is a time long over due, my brother." said Elvira. "We must find a way to end the violence."

With that said, you stepped forward and offered your hand to Chris. "Walk away from these talks alive, Chris." you said. "I would be lost without you."

"The same to you, Juan." replied Chris. "Stay sharp and focused."

The two of you then parted ways, following your mentor to their perspective places as the peace talks began...
111231211222111122111111112121211.title: The peace talks begin.

1112312112221111221111111121212111.content:
Sitting next to the mighty Devon Bizarre, the leader of the collective was a great honor for any mad scientist. You fought the urge to smile at the older members of the mad science collective as they eyed you with a certain envy, not knowing your story. Also, you were certain that siting next to the great Elvira Strange, the head witch was a great honor for Chris. She too was receiving envious stares from other witches as both she and you discretely looked about for any trouble while Devon stood to begin the historic peace talks.

"We stand here today, families reunited, carrying our first hope of peace between those who practice mad science and those who practice sorcery." he said to all attending the peace talks. "We begin with the fact that magic is a form or science and that science is a form of magic." he paused, looking at the dozens of cameras, covering the event and added, "Through this fact, we realize our powers are related as they mirror each other."

Applause rose from witches and mad scientists alike as Elvira rose to speak as well. "For those who are curious, the boy with Devon Bizarre is Juan Markus Smith, a mad scientist.. ah... beyond his years." she said, motioning to you. "With me is his sister, Christina Anne Smith, a witch, also also beyond her years. They are here to help ensure no outside force disrupts this first hope of peace among us as we look towards the future, together!"

Another round of applause filled the hall as you and Chris were urged to stand. "Say something, boy." whispered Devon.

"Speak to them, girl." whispered Elvira.

You exchanged an uncertain glance with Chris, knowing that you and she were being made a part of history as witches and mad scientists turned to you and her, wondering what would be said. Finally, you smiled. "When a witch boy is turned into a girl, 'she' can learn to be a witch."

Chris, catching on to your idea, smiled as well. "When a witch is turned into a boy, 'he' can learn to be a mad scientist."

"Both powers lie within us!" you said, motioning to all within the grand hall. "To fight one another is to fight ourselves!"

"We must end this war and move forward to a time of peace and posterity!" said Chris.

Then, in unison, they declared, "Until we stand as one!"

The crowd repeated, "Until we stand as one!" before cheers and applause filled the grand hall with a deafening sound as both Devon and Elvira whispered, "Well done, child."

The peace talks had officially begun...
1112312112221111221111111121212111.title: continue.

11123121122211112211111111212121112.content:
However there are powerful forces, some completely insane that don't want the talks to succeed. Instead of a sucidal attack where some of the most powerful witches and mad scientists are meeting, they take a different approach.

"Are you sure this will work?" the witch said in the shadows around Elvira's house.

"Of course" the second witch said. "these mad scientist types are just that. Mad. It was so easy to use their own skills against them."

"Its just that tin can..."

"Has a reputation. Thats what I'm counting on. Nobody would suspect the mind control device" the first witch grinned knowing her accomplance is herslef mentally manipulated. Both looked at their unwilling help, the mad scientist known as Phobos, or as everyone else called him (behind his back) 'Tin can', since he always wore an armored suit, leaving none of himself exposed. "Tin can will kidnap the Strange girls, and Elvira will assume this is a trap. At the least the talks will be postphoned."

"Okay, we'll send Tin can in... Who's that?" the witch demanded, seeing a moving van approach. She waited and looked on, reading on of the boxes as some removalists unlocked stuff into the former unoccupied house next door. "Smith. Mmmm. Interesting....."
11123121122211112211111111212121112.title: Rogues attack!

111231211222111122111111112121211121.content:
Inside the Strange residence, Catherine and Natalie became uneasy as they sensed a great power nearby. Sarah sensed it as well, though she did not understand what was, and turned to her two hostesses, uncertain. "Do... Do you feel that?" she asked them. "A feeling like a bad storm coming?"

Catherine sighed. "I guess Elvira did sense something inside of her." "Yes, there is a powerful presence nearby and doubt its friendly." she replied. "You better take Hannah upstairs to the spare bedroom and lock the door."

Sarah nodded but, before she could move, the front door was reduced to splinters by some mild explosion and the four saw a massive seven foot robot enter the house, breaking the door frame in the process. Catherine and Natalie both turned pale, seeing him and slowly backed away in utter terror. "Phobos!"

"Who?" asked Sarah, just as terrified.

"The living machine." replied Hannah, pale as well. "Jan told me about him, he's known to be merciless and cruel."

"That's putting it mildly." said Catherine, pushing Sarah behind her. "RUN!!"

Sarah started to run but hesitated as a large flame appeared in her hand. She screamed in terror, not knowing what it was and shook her hand, unintentionally throwing an energy blast at Phobos. Only the blast was powerful, forcing the living robot back a few steps. Sarah looked on, completely stunned as Cathrine jumped in front of her. "Get out of here while you can!" she ordered, shaking in fear. "We'll hold him off!"

Suddenly, Hannah, getting an idea, pulled something out of her dress pocket. It was a smart phone she had with her when they jumped back in time. "Keep that tin can occupied for a minute!" she yelled, frantically pressing buttons on the phone's key pad. "I have a plan!"

"This better be one hell of plan!" yelled Natalie, throwing energy blasts at Phobos. "We won't last more than a minute against this thing!"

Sarah, focusing this time, managed to make the flame appear again and turned to Catherine. "How do I do that, I want to help!"

"Focus on throwing the flame at the tin can and it will fly from your hand!" explained Catherine, quickly. "Just be careful, his guy shows no mercy!"

Sarah tried and managed to fire one powerful blast after another, not having the training to control the amount of power she used, slowly pushing Phobos towards the front door. Only, she was getting exhausted fast and feared she would soon pass out. "Hurry up, Hannah!" she screamed, panting. "I-I'm getting tired!"

Hannah, after pulling a USB cable out of a slot in the side of the smart phone, turned to Phobos. She quickly searched him with her eyes then jumped onto his back, causing him to stumble about the room, trying to throw her. "Chew on this, you tin can!" screamed Hannah, shoving the USB plug home into the back of Phobos' head. "It's called a computer virus!"


With that, Hannah hit the send button onto her smart phone. The virus Hannah had pulled from her phone's virus vault was down loaded into Phobos just before he managed to trow her off and he began to scream, holding his head in agony. It was not long before the living machine lost all control and began to crash against everything in the room, desperately trying to yank the smart phone out of his outer access port. Inside of him, all of Phobos' systems were going haywire, causing his neural-net brain to overload, killing magical mind control but leaving Phobos in complete pain, confusion, and disorientation.

"He's not a mad scientist or witch boy, I would have sensed that." mussed Catherine, stunned by what Hannah had done. "Yet he's managed to really mess up that tin can!"

Sarah, seeing an opening, summoned all of her remaining strength and fired a powerful blast at Phobos, sending him literally flying out the destroyed front door. His robotic body hit the ground in front of a stunned 17 year old Eva and 18 year old Helena Kruse. "There is no possible way Catherine or Natalie Strange can be that powerful!" thought Eva, shocked. "Who else is in there!?"

Cautiously, Eva and Helena walked into the house to find Catherine and Natalie. They were slumped into chairs with a girl they did not recognize, exhausted from their fight with Phobos. The only one standing was Hannah, who they did not recognize either but knew she was the one who made the final blow.

"Such a powerful witch for someone so young." whispered Eva, impressed. "We should take her with us instead."

"Mother wants Natalie." whispered Helena, sternly. "I dare not test her patience."

What do the two witches decide.?
111231211222111122111111112121211121.title: presumed to be powerful.

1112312112221111221111111121212111212.content:
Eva and Helena both knew that after a fight with Phobos, any witch or mad scientist would be more than exhausted, if they had managed to survive. Hannah was the only one standing, though barely. "It won't take long for them to recover, we can only take one." said Eva. "I say we take this one, its obvious she is powerful, perhaps Bizarre's star student we keep hearing about over the collective broadcasts."

"Perhaps." agreed Helena. "I have heard rumors that the collective assigned a mad scientist to protect Elvira's family during these so called peace talks." she scoffed. "What a joke."

"We have to decide now, sister." said Eva. "You know what my vote is."

"You- You know I- I can he- hear you." said Hannah, barely conscious. "I may be- be weak b- but I can sti- still fight."

Helena sighed. "Sleep, young fool." she snapped, waving her hand.

Hannah, having experienced magic from Elvira, saw the spell coming and, even in her weakened state, managed to dodge it and charge the witches. Natalie, sensing their power, winced, knowing she could not help her. Hannah threw a fist full force, ending her reserves to fight. She missed but Eva felt the breeze from it, causing her to gasp. Helena's face hardened but only until Hannah spoke, knowing she had blown her one chance to stop them.

"Had I made contact, your sister would not be standing." said Hannah with a fake smile. "Had I cast a spell, neither of you would be standing."

"So you're a witch?" asked Helena, confused, not sensing any magic.

"Please let this work." "I was a witch." said Hannah. "My dear sisters removed my magic years ago, they were jealous of my power." she smiled, gambling on their womanly pride. "Any fool can work science but magic is an art, one only girls can truly appreciate. I turned to science as there was no other recourse but I will not become male to do it."

Helena and Eva turned to each other, surprised, then smiled. "She's the collective's star student."

Hannah tilted her head, slightly, confused but before she could react, both witches hit her with a sleep spell and she crumpled to the floor unconscious. Natale, Catherine, and Sarah could only watch in fear and concern as Hannah was carried out by the two girls. By the time Sarah managed to find the reserves to run to the door, she saw Hannah being thrown into a black van with tinted windows. She was impressed that Hannah still had some fight left in her but worried that it only made her look more powerful. With her reserves nearly spent from her fight with Phobos, she was helpless to stop Eva and Helena and watched as they drove off with her friend.

Fortunately, Catherine reached the door in time to throw a single spell, hitting the van with it as it drove off. "I put a tracking spell on the van." she said, weakly. "I'll know where they are until the spell wears off."

"We have to help her!" wailed Sarah. "She's powerless against a witch, let alone two!"

"I'm more worried about her running her mouth off." said Catherine. "Only, we can't help her until we first help ourselves. Come, mom has a potion that will restore our reserves."
1112312112221111221111111121212111212.title: They take Hannah instead.

choices: a bridal veil. I'm in the mood for a wedding
11123121122211112211111111212121112121.content:
Hannah watched trying to disguise her fear as the two witches continued to squabble about whether they made the right decision is taking her than Catherine.

"Mom will not be happy. You know what happens when someone displeases her. Her plan to force the war into the next phase can not allow any margin of error."

"But this girl disabled Phobos! You know how difficult it was to disable and bend that scum to our will. She will be more valuable." Before long, the van stopped, and Helena and Eva roughly dragged her out into another house. inside, despite her horror, she grinned at the cloaked figure; it reminded her of a Star Wars Sith lord. It was Elana.

"Who is this?! I told you to bring me one of the Strange girls! This is not one of them!"

"I told you she would be displeased."

"Shut up... Mother this girl was able to defeat Phobos, almost single handedly as the others was to weak in distracting that useless Tincan. She must be a powerful, and more important female Mad scientist.

Elena turned around, and Hannah's sense of amusement at using popular culture failed her due to pure terror. there was a reason why the witch wore a cloak. It was to hide the fact her face and most of her head looked like it had been melted. It was the most revolting sight she had seen.

"Fools! I can sense a gender spell. This is no girl" Elena snarled, before she telepathically flung Hannah into a corner, while reversing the spell. "This is who you're dealing with. Now, boy. I want to know who you are and how you defeated that useless bucket of bolts."

hank stared at the witch. Elena sighed. "I see you recognize me" mistaking Hank's horrified expression. "But your mistake has brought my need to deal with you quickly. I will torture you if you do not answer me."

After no answer, Elena grinned. "Very well. Eva. Bring me...
11123121122211112211111111212121112121.title: contine (Hannah's POV)

111231211222111122111111112121211121211.content:
Eva laughed, running of the room, and soon returned with a white wedding veil. "May I?" she asked.

Elena nodded. "Let's get this 'girl' ready for her new life." she said. "I know the perfect man for a woman like her."

As Hank watched Eva approach him, he came up with a desperate plan and suddenly smiled as Eva rose the veil to put it on him. "I have a better idea." he said, grabbing the veil from her. "Why don't I marry you instead!?"

With that, he placed the veil onto Eva and backed away so not to be effected as well. Eva screamed, seeing her clothing shift and change into that of a beautiful white wedding dress as Helena laughed at her discomfort and Elena smiled, shaking her head. Watching all of this, Hank knew the type of family he was dealing with. "No honor among thieves." he thought. "I just might get out of this with my jewels intact."

"You look radiant, sis!" said Helena, laughing. "Shall I put the boy into a tux?"

"I should go along with this, just to punish you for being so sloppy, Eva." said Elena with an amused smile. "You let a boy get the best of you when you had every advantage."

"Family doesn't keep secrets... mother." said Hank with a wink. "Only, I should not see the bride on the day of the wedding, its bad luck."

Elena's amused smile broadened. "You have a twisted sense of humor, I like that in a son in law." she said, to Eva's discomfort. "Why don't you tell me how you defeated that Tincan."

Hank shrugged. "With a computer virus." he replied. "They're out there now, believe me, and there are safeguards against them. My virus only effected that over-sized windup toy because he was weakened by a control spell."

Hank had overheard Eva and Helena squabbling and heard of the spell cast upon Phobos. As he talked to Elena, his eyes searched the room for objects he could use and found a number of smoke bomb pellets near Elena's purse behind her, which would provide cover for an escape. Hank knew he had to pull all of his tricks to get out of this mess and he intended to do so.

"You are not a witch or a mad scientist, boy!" said Elena, her eyes narrowing. "Who are you?"

Hank smiled, imitating one he had seen on your face when planning mischief. "I am a watcher."

Elena's eyes grew wide as she knew watchers were often used as spies by mad scientists, promising a cure to a disease or a problem they were facing in life as Hank then ran passed her. At first, Elena thought he was going after her purse and cast a spell to enchant it so he would become an infant upon touch it. Only Hank surprised her by grabbing the smoke bomb pellets instead, throwing them onto the floor. The entire room instantly filled with smoke and Hank dived through a window to freedom outside. "That was too close!" he whispered. "What a freaky family!"

Then the sound of a car horn reached Hank's ears and he ran towards it to find...
111231211222111122111111112121211121211.title: a bridal veil. I'm in the mood for a wedding

1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.content:
Not her. All my luck. Escape from those lunatics only to find myself with this witch Hank thought, see the person in the car is Samantha Forester.

"Get in" she urged.

"No way! I bet the price of 'rescuing' me is a fashion trip to the mall" Hank protested.

"Do you want to be rescued or not? My mother is less forgiving..."

"Your mother..." Hank gasped, stepping away.

"I'm the good witch. She's pure bitch as well has my two sisters that are with her. Look. I see you're afraid, and knowing my family, are hesitant to trust me. they tried the wedding veil on you, right?" Without waiting for an answer, she continued. "you're not the first one they've done that to. There are two others, both now married and a couple months pregnant. Before that, they turned guys into babies and dropped... I don't want to talk about it. Both me and my other sister live with my dad, even though he has problems of his own."

Hank turned and looked. Still no sign of pursuit. "Okay. But my friends will find out if this is a trap."

"Its not" Samantha said grimly.

Once she saw Hank get in, the engine cut off. "Crap" Samantha said, before saying, "They'll be any minute. Don't take this personally."

"What? Not again..." Hank wailed, seeing he once again was turning into a girl, though this time a four year old one. Elena, Helena, and Eva, who was still dressed as a bride came into view, and saw Samantha with a normal looking little girl.

"Who is this?" Elena demanded.

"Aren't you going to ask me why I'm here, mom?" Samantha said crossly. "And if you want to know, this is Donna. i'm babysitting her."
1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.title: Samantha.

1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.content:
Hank, now being called Donna, forced a shy smile. "Hi." she said.

Elena ignored her, fuming at Samantha. "A boy ran from our house, did you see him?" she hissed. "Answer me!"

"I no longer answer to you, mother." said Samantha, angrily. "If you must know, I did see a boy run off into the woods." she shrugged. "Good luck to him, if you ask me. No boy ever come out unchanged from there."

Elena smiled. "Or with any memory of who they were." she said. "So much the better. I sense that this 'girl' was effected by an age and gender spell, one of your projects?"

Samantha giggled. "Actually, I'm just watching over this one for a while." she said, smiling. "I sensed a high magical build up which means...."

"He has a stash of magical artifacts somewhere." finished Elena. "He could turn into a girl and a witch any moment."

Helena laughed. "What a lucky boy you are!" she said. "Embrace your new womanhood, learn magic!"

Eva smiled. "Once you taste magic, you won't want to be an 'icky' boy.

Donna, again, forced a shy smile. "I...I'll think about it." she said. "Um... are you getting married?"

Helena and Elena giggled as Eva blushed brightly. "Let's just say the 'groom' got cold feet." she replied before walking away, mumbling with Helena following, mocking her for letting a boy get the best of her.

"You didn't come here to show off your little friend, Samantha." said Elena. "Cut to chase, tell me what you want."

Samantha frowned. "Dad's been hurt, mom." she said. "A new young mad scientist appeared out of nowhere and jumped into a duel between dad and Deva Morgana, Robbert's sister. You know, the one Eva has a crush on."

"I know her." said Elena with a sigh. "She's sloppy, and that's being kind. Why was she after Charles?"

Samantha shrugged. "I'm not sure but he had it under control until that brat showed up." she said. "Just thought you might want to know."

Elena nodded before waving her hand, allowing the engine to start again and Samantha drove off. "That was too close." she breathed. "My mom is usually all to happy to torment a boy, I had to change you so to protect you."

"Why did you tell all that to her?" asked Donna, still a little girl.

"Elena can always tell if someone is lying, I dare not try it, even with as powerful as I had become." replied Samantha. "I'll return you to normal but I'm going to need a favor from you."

"What... a favor?" asked Donna, uncertain.

Samantha blushed slightly, looking annoyed. "Look, I don't like this either, Okay? I need your help to get my dad off my back. for a while My sister, Sarah is seeing Jack Strange, though I don't know why...."

"You want me to parade as your boyfriend!?" asked Hank, not liking the idea at all.

"Just long enough to get dad off my case." said Samantha. "If you agree, I'll change you back now. If not, ask Natalie or Catherine to do it because I won't."

What does Hank do?...
1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.title: continue

1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.content:
"I'm not going to be blackmailed by you. If you said that after you transformed me back to normal, I'd play along, but now forget it" 'Donna' said.

Samantha looked annoyed. "Very well. Hope you like playing with dollies, little girl. I'll help you out..."

Donna opened her mouth to protest, before she felt wierd. 'What did you do to me?"

"Just gave you the desires of a six year old girl" Samantha said. "Want me to stop off and get you a new doll?"

"Yes -I mean no" Donna sulked. It was quiet all the way back to Elvira's house. Samantha grabbed Sonna and led her inside, where they found the Strange girls, Sarah and a still disabled Phobos. The tincan though was tied up. As soon as Sarah saw donna, she freaked. "What did they do to you?"

"Eva and Helena didn't do this. Samantha did" Catherine said, frowning.

"I needed to disguise her" Samantha said.

"But you put a spell on her that makes her want to act like a little girl. She's eying one of my old dolls" Natalie said annoyed.

"I offered to change her back. She refused" Samantha shrugged.

"you can't keep doing this! Not after last year."

"What happened last year?" Sarah asked. She was still struggling with the fact she is now a witch, like the others.

"Samantha decided she would be 'helpful' by granting wishes, but in a manner of 'be careful what you wish for'" Catherine said. "First there was this guy that was moaning how being an adult was hard, and that he wished he was a kid again. Samantha gave him his wish, only not in the way he hoped. Then thre were these four college jocks would was bemoaning how there were not enough hot cheerleaders around. You guess the rest. Elvira was most displeased. The only thing that saved her was that one of those new cheerleaders had beaten up an important mad scientist in her previous life and it began this detente"
1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.title: He declines.

1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.content:
Inside the secret location, the peace talks were progressing very well with mad scientists and witches slowly but very certainly resolving their issues... "I insist that there be a universal set of rules, regarding the treatment of siblings within a household, regardless of what type power is dominant." said a man on the mad scientist panel. "I am Thomas Connors, discretion department. Witch boys have the same rights as witches due to the fact that, if turned into a girl, they become a witch as well."

"A witch without training." countered a woman on the witch council. "I am Wilma Hues, secrecy department. Witch boys gain resistance to magic as it is used against them. I agree that they have rights and they should be protected but to gain resistance, some of those rights must be... wavered." she paused. "The same should be done to young witches where mad science is dominant at exposure to chaotic power makes them resistant as well."

You smiled, watching the two talk, knowing that they would soon become a couple and give birth to a great girl, named Lucy Connors who you held in high regard as she saw mad science as a power to respect, not fear. Another witch from the council rose and you smiled, recognizing her as your grandmother, Viki Vulcan. "I suggest a safeguard be put in place in all households that will prevent magic and or science wars among relatives." she said. "A powerful spell that will reduce two or more squabbling relatives to three year olds until a trained witch or mad scientist can return them to normal or a twenty four cooling off period has passed."

Laughter rose from both witches and mad scientists alike but not due to the fact they did not like the idea. The suggestion was quickly passed and added to the peace treaty, slowly being forged through negotiation and compromise. "Go grandma!" you thought.

Then, in the back of your mind, you sensed trouble approaching and turned to Chris who had the same expression on her face. You gave her a solemn nod then turned to Devon. "We have hostile forces approaching, sir." you whispered. "Most likely rogues, wanting to stir up a ruckus, I suggest we move the peace talks to a new location."
As you spoke to Devon, Chris said the same thing to Elvira, who nodded at her then turned to Devon who nodded as well before rising his hand for silence. "Our prodigies have detected rogues of unknown discipline approaching this location." he announced. "With the permission of the witch council present, I will move us all to a new location where we may continue without interruption."

Both witches and mad scientists voiced their agreement and Devon worked a control panel in front of him. Seconds later, the entire room within the abandoned oil rig was empty... just as three witches burst inside, firing spells into the air as one teen girl shouted out, "We, the Bane family oppose these peace...." a dumbfounded look formed onto her face. "Where'd they go!?!"

"So much for your 'reliable' source, Darla." said the second witch, who seemed to be the teen's mother. "Be thankful no one saw this embarrassment otherwise I'd make you a boy for life."

Where did the peace talks move to?
1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.title: The peace talks are moved.

1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.content:
"Where are we?!" Wilma demanded. You nod in argreement, though you know it is some kind of scientific facility, abeit one that looks modern and if you had Hank here, he would say it looked futuristic. Of course 'modern' might mean several hundred years.

"Take a look outside, in the corridor" Devon offfered. You walked out, along with the others, and saw a wide view of stars. At first you thought it was decoration, until you saw a darkened grey object in the sky, followed by another blueish one further out.

"That grey thing is the dark side of the moon! We're in orbit" Chris said to you. "Did you know about this place?"

"No" you said, getting slightly worried. devon looking pleased with himself, turned to Elvira, who started frowning. It was obvious even her didn't know. "Bizzare! i thought this place was a myth!"

"it was orginally constructed as a superweapon after the loss of our base last century. however after WW2, we recognized this place might be detected and spread the war out of our control, so we increased our stealth tech and converted it into a place of last resort. If we felt we was going to get annililated, we'd retreat here. We have no offensive capabilites" Devon said, seeing that several witches looked uneasily.

"How many know this, Devon, because I didn't?" Thomas demanded, much to your surprise. It seemed to pacify some of the witches.

"Only me" Devon said. "Maybe we can continue the talks without any more distractions."

You look at Chris who had moved out of the way. Quickly you move next to her, so you can talk. You know what Hank would say. There is plenty of examples of a hostile force hitching a ride onto your surposedly secure, secret ship, someone from Earth sending up a force to storm it, or just as bad shooting it down with an ICBM.....

"Thinking of what Hank would say?" Chris asked. You nod.

"Yeah. But i'm troubled by something else. Why would we not hear about this place. Have we somehow altered history?"

"i hope not" Chris winced.
1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.title: An orbiting station.

1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.content:
Just as you were about to walk into a large hall to continue the talks, Devon pulled Elvira into the hall. There was a very serious look on his face as he looked her in the eye. "Look, sis." he said. "I know we have never really gotten along but I need you to listen to me."

You and Chris looked at each other, concerned. It was apparent that neither Elvira or Devon knew that you were there. "This can't be good." you thought.

"I'm listening, bro." said Elvira. "Talk to me."

Devon took a breath. "Those two kids could not have come from the future by accident." he said. "Something major happens in our future that makes peace a necessity." he said, quietly. "Only I fear, in their time, that peace came far too late to stop whatever had happened."

"What are you getting at, Devon?" asked Elvira, concerned. "Do you think some new force will soon threaten us all?"

"I was about to dismantle this station when I was approached by Charles Forester." replied Devon. "If there is a new threat on the horizon, we must both be ready for it."

Yours and Chris' eyes bugged out, now knowing why neither of you had heard of the space station. In your present, it had long ago been dismantled but, since your appearance in the past, fears of a future threat are forcing both sides to rebuild their forces. Making a decision, you cleared your throat. Devon and Elvira turned to you, surprised.

"There is no great threat on the horizon." you said, calmly. "The only threat is us inadvertently changing our history by allowing such unfounded fears to grow."

"We never heard of this station in our present because you had dismantled it." added Chris.

Devon sighed. "I am thankful that there is no threat on the horizon." he said.

"However, I must admit, this orbiting station would make a fine joint powers platform to maintain peace." said Elvira. "Perhaps we can suggest it to the others."

"A capital idea." said Devon. "That should ease any fears we all may have." he turned to you. "Come now."

With a sigh, you followed Devon into the large hall while Sarah followed Elvira....
1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.title: your concerns are valid

1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.content:
"Maybe i was a little hasty" the older woman, Victoria Bane, said. "I can detect traces of mass teleportation."

"i told you that i was right" Darla Bane said angrily. "Don't ever threaten me like that again. Can you tell me where they went?"

"No. these accursed boys are sneaky, but I can record the magic signiture" Victoria spat out. "we need help. Who was your contact?'

"A cloaked figure" Darla said. "Don't know who. Her information was good though."

Meanwhile on the station, Charles who was monitoring the rig turned to the meeting. "We have a problem. Victoria bane just burst into our former meeting place."

"Can she track us?" someone said.

"No. Even if she did, it won't do her any good. Any trace would show us moving to the moon, not here" Devon said. "However her presense is troubling. victoria is..."

"A feminist that makes radicals seem sane. She that thinks men are scum and fit only for nothing, and having magic has only made her worse" Elvira spat out. "I should had expelled her when I had the chance."

"We all know that" Charles said. "However someone like that is an obstacle to peace that must be removed." Little did anyone know, she was removed permanently in the orginal timeline; she was killed by Elvira when she stormed in. Since they moved to the station, that has been altered.

Victoria teleported near where the contact lived, and followed Darla. They saw that the contact was in cloaked figure, standing in front of some apartments. 'Your information was good, but who are you?' darla demanded
1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.title: Back on Earth...

1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.content:
"The name is Harrison." said the figure in a deep voice. "Garth Harrison."

Victoria's eyes widened in surprise then narrowed in hatred. "The last of the Scilocks." she said, a hiss to her voice. "You and your followers used magical artifacts with your mad science, making your group quite a thorn in our side for years!" pausing, she added, "I had thought you were 'finally' killed in New York last year."

"Nearly killed." corrected Garth. "I had hoped, I mean... feared Elvira had blown you and your family into oblivion."

"Someone sensed our approach and moved to a new location." said Victoria, ignoring Garth's comment. "Any idea where they may have gone. I have a new curse I wish to try."

Garth shook his head, inwardly cursing that his plan to destroy Victoria Bane had failed. "Pity. No, I do not know where they could have relocated to. Devon trusts no one, not even his own family."

Victoria grunted. "Come, girls!" she snapped. "We are leaving!"

"Where are we going?" asked Darla, whispering.

Victoria did not answer as she walked towards her car. Watching them, Garth rubbed his chin in thought. "They'll target Elvira's children." he mussed. "I had better get there first."
1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.title: Enter Mr. Harrison.

1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.content:
Unaware of the events that were unfolding, Natalie giggled as Catherine instructed Sarah in the use of magic to pass the time with a pouting six year old Hank being the test subject. "You should have just left me a little girl instead of making me a little boy!" protested Hank. "At least then I wouldn't look like a fool, wearing girl's clothing."

"That can be arranged, you're still cute." grinned Catherine. then she turned serious. "No, I promised to change you back and I will but Sarah needs to learn some control of her magic."

"Then why don't one of you be the test subject?" asked Hank. "Why me?"

"I have to instruct her and Natalie has to watch that pile of junk over there until the rogue hunter arrive." said Catherine. "You were lucky to take Phobos down the first time, he'll be ready for you if there's a round two." she then sighed. "I'd have Jack join you but his patience is already thin with us, I dare not evoke his rage right now."

Hank sighed then slowly nodded. "Fine."

Catherine grinned then turned to Sarah. "First, you need to picture what you want the face to look like then project it onto Hank's face." she said, instructing her. "Once you do that, look to see if it worked before showing him a mirror." she giggled. "You don't want him to look like a clown."

"Not that I already do." muttered Hank.

"Give it a try." said Catherine, ignoring Hank.

Sarah looked at Hank and cast her spell. She winced slightly as the colors she was hoping to put on him did not appear but she smiled, seeing the end result, Hank looked just like a little girl in a school uniform. "I did it!" she squealed in excitement, clapping her hands. "He looks so cute!"

Catherine giggled, conjuring a mirror. "Take a look at yourself, Hannah." she teased. "Did Sarah pass?"

Hank rolled his eyes and looked at the mirror. He was surprised by how he looked. The soft red color on his lips went well with the blush and eyeshadow. He looked just like a pretty little girl. "Wow." he said, his anger fading. "Not bad."

Sarah giggled. "It was my first makeup spell." she said, slightly proud of herself. "I'm glad it turned out well."

Natalie turned for a moment to look at Hank, done up as a little girl and giggled. "You're a good sport after all, Hank." she said, smiling. "Magic is not all about tormenting boys, it can be fun for them too... if they have an open mind."

Just then, a heavy knock came to the door and Catherine quickly answered only to gasp, her face turning pale...

Who was at the door?
1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.title: At the Strange residence...

1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.content:
"What do you want here!?" demanded Catherine, distrust in her voice. "Mom is not home and we have our hands full as it is with this boy and his friend!"

"Oh, you have no idea where your own mother is?" asked Victoria. "What a terrible parent she is."

Victoria was a tall and beautiful woman with nearly perfect features, all placed there by magic. She, Elena Kruse, and Elvira were all in the running for the position of head witch, Elvira won. The three had been bitter rivals ever since. It was Victoria who had 'melted' Elena's face, jealous of her natural beauty years ago.

"No, I have no idea where my mom is!" barked Catherine. "If you will excuse me, I have to return to my lessons."

She moved to slam the door in Victoria's face but she rushed passed before she could and looked down at the little boy in girls' clothing, grinning. "Who might you be?" she asked.

"A victim of magical mischief." replied Hank, grumpily. "She has to learn to change my clothes back to normal for me to get them back."

Darla, who had entered behind Victoria, laughed. "So, who are you then?" she asked Sarah.

Sarah blushed slightly. "I'm Sarah, they say I'm a first witch." she said. "This magic is harder than it looks."

Victoria smiled, having no real interest in her or Hank. "You'll get the hang of it." she said, reassuringly. "Welcome to the witching world, Sarah." she then turned back to Natalie and Catherine. "The sooner you tell us where your mother is the sooner we leave."

"We told you!" protested Natalie. "We have no idea where she is! Get out!"

Victoria suddenly grabbed Natalie's throat, causing her to struggle for air. "I don't appreciate your tone, young lady." she hissed, angrily. "Perhaps I should show you some respect." she pulled out a small blade and gently rubbed it against her face. "What do you miss more? An eye or an ear?"

"Get off her!" screamed Catherine, summoning a flame. only Darla and her twin sister, Carla stood in her way, producing flames of their own. "Out of my way, amateurs!"

"Let mom have her fun." said Carla, smiling. "You and we can have fun of our own."

Then Sarah jumped to Catherine's side. "I'll hold them, you help your sister!" she said, quickly.

"How touching." said Victoria, unimpressed. "The dog tries protects her master."

Sarah turned red with anger but before she could react, a low boom was heard and Hank was back to normal. He angrily took Victoria's knife hand and pulled it away before slamming his fist into her jaw. Victory was forced to release Natalie as she stumbled back, stunned. Only Hank was not done as he knew all it took was a wave of the hand for her to cast a spell, taking away his initiative. He continued to pummel Victoria with blow after blow as Natalie crumpled to the floor, coughing, catching her breath.

"No one hurts my friends!" screamed Hank, still beating on Victoria. "Get out!"

Darla and Carla, also stunned to see a boy beating their mom senseless, were taken of guard by Catherine and Sarah who sent them flying with energy blasts. As they stumbled towards the door, Hank grabbed Victoria by the waist and spun her once before physically throwing her to the floor, next to Phobos, startling her. She turned to counter attack, so to at least save face but froze as Hank had his smartphone pointed at her.

"I used this same technique to take down that bucket of bolts." he said, breathing heavily. "It works on organic lifeforms as well, care to test it?"

"I don't sense chaotic energy within you." hissed Victoria . "What are you!?"

Hank smiled, seeing a number of women in police uniforms. Having had magic used against him, he knew they were witches, more specifically the rogue hunters Catherine had mentioned. "I am Hank." he said as the rogue hunters entered the house. "That is all you need to know."

"This is not over, boy!" hissed Victoria.

She then vanished in a puff of smoke, along with her daughters. Once they were gone, Hank slumped over, breathing a sigh of relief. "For a second, I thought she would force my hand." he whispered.

"You are a brave boy... Hank." said one of the rogue hunters. "I am Grace Tanner, are you the one who took down the living machine, Phobos?"

Hank nodded. "Yeah, but I was lucky." he said. "Besides, I had to protect Natalie."

Natalie blushed brightly as the other policewomen giggled. "I see..." said Grace, smiling. "You have eyes for the daughter of the head witch?"

Hank paled slightly, realizing what he had said, then blushed himself before nodding. "Yeah, I... I guess I do." he said. "It's too bad she's an adult where I come from."

The rogue hunters smiled then went back to their work, taking the still rigid and unmoving Phobos out of the house.

Later...
1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.title: Victoria Bane.

1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.content:
Meanwhile, miles away, Elena Kruse looked to the slowly darkening sky as the sun began to set with a hand held telescope to her eye. The telescope was made of enchanted materials, making it much more powerful than it appeared. Seeing her looking through it at the sky, Eva walked out, free from her wedding dress. "What's wrong, mom?" she asked, genuinely concerned. "Did you sense something?"

Elena slowly nodded. "There's been a massive teleport event." she replied, sounding unnerved. "I sensed whoever had been teleported have rematerialized somewhere in orbit."

Eva gasped. "But that would mean the rumors of the orbiting platform are true!" she exclaimed. "If all the key mad scientists have teleported there..."

"It means they are getting ready to make a final push." said Elena. "I heard unconfirmed reports of them creating a boy version of the reset potion only they are calling it the 'boy maker'. "If they do have this serum, they could effectively wipe us out in one bold move."

"Not unless we shoot them down." said Helena, standing behind them. "The witching world has rockets. All we need but do is knock out its engines and their precious platform will burn to nothingness in orbit."

"The trick is obtaining one or more rockets." said Elena, lowering the telescope. "We don't have a lot of time."

With that said, Elena walked back into the house, pulling a cellphone from her pants pocket. "This is Elena." she said. We have serious trouble, hear me out..."
1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.title: Elena finds the orbiting station.

1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.content:
After things had calmed down slightly, Natalie pulled Hank out of the room before gently urged him to sit with her on the floor as she sat down with him. She could feel her own heart racing as she touched his hand and smiled. "I'm grateful for your gallant efforts to keep us safe, Hank." she said. "Only you come from a time where I am an adult to you." she sadly shook her head. "It won't work, I'm sorry."

Hank sighed, wanting to scream. "I- I have no family to go back to." he said, tears falling. "My mom and dad have not returned home in the passed six months."

Natalie looked at him sadly as he rubbed his eyes. "What are you going to do?" she asked.

"Sarah's mom is looking into adopting me as no one seems to be able to find my parents." replied Hank. "Only, until then, I might as well be an orphan."

Hank began to cry, moving Natalie to hug him. "It'll be okay." she said. "I'll remember this and look you up. If you're still an orphan... I'll adopt you."

Hank looked at Natalie, uncertain. "You- You'd do that?" he asked, surprised.

Natalie smiled. "Pinkie swear." she said.

Hank chuckled and took Natalie's pinkie into his own. "Done."
1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.title: Back to Hank and Natalie.

1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.content:
"Calm down young scientist" Charles said, noticing you're pacing uncomfortably. Now that the talks are over, you're eager to get out of here and back to Earth.

"You know why he is nervous" Chris said. "Every second we're here..."

"I know. Exactly who knows?" Charles said.

"Other than yourself, Elvira and her girls. She caught us in her study and lets say she has some powerful truth spells. Both Natalie and Catherine are looking after Hank and Sarah" Chris answered for you.

"I hope they have the sense to remain in their house" Charles mused.

"i know. I don't to find that we saved the talks to find that we have a completely different history. I don't this to be like... Damn it Hank! You and your movies!" you said. "How long are we stuck here?"

"I'm glad you stopped yourself. I must not discover anything about the future" Charles said with a slight smile. "We should be able to return to Earth within an hour and send you, sister and friends home. Is your device ready?"

"The device is unstable. I'm worried about its power source, but I imagine as a last resort, Elvira can give my device the shock treatment" you said. Beats waiting for a lightling storm.

Charles nodded. "Just stay here and wait for me or Elvira."
1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.title: Back to you.

1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.content:
As Jan and Chris worked with Elvira and Devon to save the peace talks after being forced to move to a location unknown to all but Devon, Elena and her two daughter appeared in eastern Europe at a small, seemingly abandoned military base. There, Elena entered with much caution with Eva and Helena walking nervously behind. "Do not make any sudden moves in here, kids." warned Elena. "Verina Banshee is a jumpy old hag."

"I heard that, Elena!" came an angry voice. "I may be an old hag to you but its better than being an ugly old hag!"

Eva and Helena winced, sensing a fight coming but Elena merely smiled as she turned to Verina, standing several feet away from her. Verina was a tall woman with light brown hair and brown eyes, wearing a gown that accented curves well. "You haven't changed a bit, princess." purred Elena. "Turning you into a girl was the best thing I could have done."

Verina grunted. "You could have divorced me first." she said, frowning. "Making me your third daughter and marrying me off was not what I had in mind for a second honeymoon."

"I picked you a good man with connections." argued Elena. "Besides, had I not defended you from that Bane bitch, it would have been you that looked as I do now."

"You said over the phone that we had a massive problem." said Verina, changing the subject. "Mind sharing the details?"

Elena told Verina what she had sensed and what she feared may be the result before stating, "All I wish to do is cripple the space platform. The last thing we need if for those mad scientist leaders to made into icons of valor."

Verina nodded. "I saw the platform being launched." she said. "The rumors of it existing came from me but no one takes the word of a 'rogue' witch." she shook her head. "I agree it must be taken down. I'll launch a missile as soon as I sense it overhead so it will reach its target before they can sense it coming."

Inside another room, Verina's twelve year old 'adopted' child, Daniel was listening. His face turned pale, hearing of their plot and quietly sneaked off to his room to send out a warning to his pen pal, Jack Strange. Verina had found Daniel, slowly freezing to death in the cold last winter. He had no memory of his past so she decided to take him as her own and slowly fashion him into his daughter once he reached the age of thirteen. Having known magic is real, Daniel wrote a quick message and teleported it via a magical device. "I hope it reaches Jack in time." he whispered, returning to watch his mom and her guests. "I don't want anyone to get hurt."

Minutes later...
1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.title: Got to destroy that station....

choices: The typewriter came to life again.
1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.content:
Minutes later, inside the Strange residence, Jack turned to the sound of a typewriter working on its own and smiled as he walked over to it. "Looks like Daniel is sending me a message." he said. "I haven't heard from him an a few days."

"Who's Daniel?" asked Sarah, curious.

"A witch boy in eastern Europe, somewhere in the Ukraine, I think." replied Catherine. "He and Jack have been chatting on and off for the passed few months."

Only, as the magic typewriter stopped, Jack's face turned pale. "Catherine!" he screamed. "You need to read this!"

Catherine hurried over to the typewriter and turned pale herself as the message read...

'My mom is going to launch a missile at some orbiting station! Sounds bad, tell your mom!'

"I heard rumors that the mad scientists had an orbiting station." she whispered. "The peace talks must have been moved there for some reason!"

Hearing this, Hank quickly pulled out his cellphone and dialed a number. "Please, Jan!" he whispered. "Have the sense to have your phone on!"

As Hank listened to the rings, he began to lose hope until...
1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.title: Jack recieves the warning.

1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.content:
Hank had forgotten that cellphones and the towers that supported them were vertually non-existant in 1989, and it was a source of amazement, even to the Strange girls. Fortuanately you detected a strange signal boucing off the ionosphere, and realized it was a cellphone call.

"What is it?" you asked impatiently, glad its was just you and Chris.

".... H...k, Jan" came a grabbled reply.

"Its 1989. Cellphones vertually don't exist" you said, unsure if Hank is getting the message. "I'm not getting the full message."

"A Rus... f...nd of Jack's says ...... rouges ......located............ion. Wi... launch ICBM........" the call siad before cutting out.

"You get that?" you asked Chris.

"Yes. All I can make out is that some rouges are going to launch a missile" Chris said wide eyed. She turned around and ran into an annoyed Elvira.

"What are you doing?" she said.

"Jan got a message from Hank...."

"i knew I should had turned him into an infant. He can't go around using future tech..."

"The message was broken up, but he thinks rouges are going to launch a missile, most likely at us."
1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.title: A grabbled message

1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.content:
"As much as I agree with you, sis, this Hank is right." said Devon. "I just sensed the launch of a missile directly below us, we have less than five minutes to evacuate."

"Can't we all just teleport, like we did the last time?" asked Elvira.

Devon shook his head. "The system needs twenty four hours to recharge for that kind of jump." he said. "We will need at least fifteen minutes to get everyone safely off the platform by shuttle."

You and Chris turned to each other and nodded. "You two have a plan?" asked Elvira. "I hope you do."

"No time to explain." said Chris quickly. "It's a desperation move that could kill one or both of us if anything goes wrong."

Without saying another word, you and Chris locked hands as Devon pulled Elvira back. "I have a feeling we are going to witness a union of powers." he whispered. "Both of us have thought it possible but never dared to try it ourselves."

Elvira nodded but remained silent as you and Chris recited an odd incantation. "Born under the union of moon and sun, allow these twins to act as one!" the two of you glowed, temporarily blinding those who turned your way before you and she became one person as you he/she continued. "Power of new and power of old, protect us all, stop this threat cold!"

With another blinding glow, a beam fired from the station, destroying the incoming ICBM. It was close enough for the explosion to rock the station but there was no significant damage. You and Chris had saved the peace talks but, as you fortunately managed to separate into your own selves, you discovered that it came with a price. The time return device was overloaded by the union you yours and Chris' power. Seeing the damage, Chris winced, asking, "Can you fix it?"

"It's still in working order." you said, after a quick examination. "Only its power has been drained. "I can only send back three of us, the other will have to remain or find another way." you paused. "I'll stay."

Then a tall, handsome mad scientist walked up with an attractive teenage witch. Behind them were the other witches and mad scientists with a variety of expressions from awe to fear. "That was the most amazing display I've ever seen!" said the mad scientist, excited. "I am Garth Harrison. You, young lady would make a powerful mad scientist!"

"Who knew such power could come from twins uniting!?" said the witch, pushing Garth aside. "I am Sarah Forester, here in place of my father, Charles Forester. You, Jan, would make a fine witch!"

Both you and Chris smiled then replied, "We already are."

"What?" asked Devon, confused.

"The incantation is both a spell and an event." you explained. "For it to work both twins need to have an understanding of magic and mad science."

"It's dangerous though." said Chris, jumping in. "If our powers are not perfectly aligned, Jan could permanently become a girl or I could permanently become a boy." pausing, she added, "It's known as the twin factor."

"If a witch's power is above her twin boy's physical prowess, he becomes a girl and a witch to make a balance." said Elvira, nodding. "We know of this as it also works in the opposite direction with mad science."

"Yes but we could also permanently become one person, a powerful witch who is neither Jan or Chris but a union of the two individuals." said Jan, sadly. "We would both 'die' and a single person would be born from the two."

"The price of power." said Devon, softly. "We should make note to ban this desperate ritual."

Elvira agreed, as did the other witches and mad scientists as yours and Chris' desperate move was explained, dubbing the spell/event as 'the union of twins' ritual. Moments later, the agreement to peace talks was signed and word was quickly spread as Elvira sent the rogue hunters elite, witch commandos, to the sight of the missile launch.

"Do not fear, young mad scientist." said Garth, boldly. "I will adopt whoever chooses to stay behind."

"We'll talk." said Elvira and Devon in unison.

With that said, witches and mad scientists began the process of leaving the station with Devon's promise to dismantle it as a gesture of good will. "This is just the beginning." said Devon, hours later in the Strange residence. "It could take years for the peace talks to end this war."

"It's a step in the right direction." said Elvira with a sigh. "For the moment, we have other concerns."

"Ah, yes. The time traveling quartet." said Devon, eying you. "I can not punish any of you as your efforts saved the peace talks but I hear one must remain behind."

"Yes, sir." you replied. "I nominate myself as it was my invention that caused this."

"You must go." said Elvira. "The consequences of two twins, being separated by time are greater than you might think."

"I- I have no family in our time." said Hank. "Time will not be effected as much if I stay."

"Very well." said Elvira. "Only I must confiscate your future tech and block your memories of your future life." she smiled, adding, "You talk too much."

Hank blushed as Devon added, "I will reward you for your sacrifice with a power of your own. You will discover it in your own time, all I ask is that you use it wisely."

Hank nodded then turned to you, Chris and Sarah. "I guess this is good bye, then."

"Not good bye." said Sarah, hugging him. "Until we meet again."

Hank nodded, tearing up as Sarah released him and Chris hugged him. "Look us up sometime, okay?" she said.

"I will." promised Hank as Chris released him.

You then took his hand and shook it. "I will miss you, Hank." you said. "Stay out of trouble."

"Back at you." said Hank, tears falling. "See you around."

Chris and Sarah walked up to your side and you activated the return sequence. With a flash, the three of you were gone, back to your present time. Unknown to you, Samantha, who had been silent until then wrapped her arm around Hank, causing him to blush. "You know, you're not so bad, for a boy." he said.

"Oh no you don't!" snapped Natalie, wrapping her arm around Hank from the other side. "He likes me!"

"Not after one date, he won't." countered Samantha.

"His first date will be with me!" yelled Natalie.

The two then flew into a cat fight as the others shook their heads. "Should we warn them about the safeguard we had agreed to for squabbling siblings?" asked Devon.

Elvira smiled, shaking her head. "Let them find out for themselves." she replied.

Moments later, both Natalie and Samantha screamed, finding themselves three year old girls....
1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.title: Behold the power of twins.

1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.content:
Looking around your room, everything seemed as as if you had never left. You looked at your time return device, it was completely drained of power and now fried beyond repair. Looking at your calendar, you were pleased to see that you had arrived the very same day you had left. You were more pleased, seeing it was only a few minutes since you, Chris, Sarah, and Hank had vanished backwards into time.

"We've arrived at the right point in time." you said with a sigh. "Only Hank is an adult now."

"I wonder what changes had occurred from leaving him in the passed." mussed Chris.

You shook your head. "I don't know."

Just then, mom called from downstairs. "Jan, Chris, Sarah, we have company!" she announced. "Our neighbors wish to welcome us to the neighborhood!"

You exchanged a worried look with Chris and Sarah then ran down the stairs to find boxes everywhere as men carried in furniture and sealed metal containers, pieces of your laboratory. Although your bedroom and house looked the same as you remembered, it seemed as if your family was just moving in. You turned to mom who gave you a sad smile. "I know its hard, being the only boy in the family, Jan." she said. "I miss your dad too."

You swallowed hard. "Dad died in this new present?" you thought, feeling sick. "What!? How!?"

Chris began to cry as well, saddened to return to having no father and mom comforted her, pulling Sarah in for the hug as well, confusing her. "It's okay to cry, Sarah." she said, softly. "I know you miss your mom and dad but they will be back when it is safe, I promise you."

Hearing this, Sarah too began to cry as a man approached you. There was no mistaking his face, it was Hank, all grown up. "I don't know if you remember me but I am Hank Harrison." he said, smiling. "This is my wife, Natalie."

"It's a pleasure to meet you, young man." said Natalie with a quick wink. she motioned to four children, behind her. "These are my daughters, Hayley, Melanie, and Hannah." she smiled. "This is my son, John, he is Melanie's twin."

"The- The pleasure is-is mine." you replied, crying. "Sorry... I just miss dad."

Hank gave you a sad look, tears forming. "Your father, Samuel Smith was driving with me the night of the car accident." he said, as if explaining. "He used his mad science to teleport me clear from the car before it was hit by that truck, saving my life." placing a gentle hand onto your shoulder, he added. "Unfortunately, he did not survive."

I completely fell into tears, realizing that going into the past had greatly altered our present time. Natalie took me into her arms and rocked me gently. "I am so sorry things turned out this way." then she whispered, "He's not dead, just in isolation but I can not say anymore than that, sorry."

You nodded, knowing dad had always 'isolated' himself in his lab in your old reality so not much had changed except for Sarah who had taken Hank's role as the lonely one. "Thank you for the welcome." you said, wiping away your tears.

"Why don't your kids show mine around town." suggested mom. "I think they could all use a break from everything that had been going on lately."

"That's a splendid idea." said Natalie, smiling. "I'm sure John and his friend, Hank could use another guy to hang around with and my daughters and their friend would love to take Chris and Sarah shopping."

"Right his way." said John, politely. "I'll introduce you to Harry Rich."

Hayley and Mel grabbed Sarah and Chris. "Come on, you'll love Megan Thompson." they said.
1112312112221111221111111121212111212111.title: Back to a 'normal' future.

1112322.content:
"What shall I transform you into, Jan." she asked, eying you teasingly. "I just can't seem to make up my mind."

Will she transform you into...
1112322.title: Decisions, Decisions.

11123221.content:
You immediately felt yourself shrinking and realized that Chris was regressing you. In a panic, you tried to resist the magic with your science as you began to swim in your own clothes. Only you were too slow to focus your mind as you quickly fell below the age to use your power. You no longer had the ability to block the spell, you were trapped. "What do you have planned for me!?" you asked, frightened.

"Don't worry, little one." giggled Chris. "You'll only be this way for two days."

You winced as you felt your teeth lowering and vanishing into your gums, giving you an idea of what your sister had planned, and you did not like it at all. "Pwease, Cwiss!" you begged, loosing your ability to speak. "Not a baby boy!"

Chris laughed. "Okay, you can be a girl!" she said.

You eyes bugged out as you then felt your hips widen slightly and something tugging on your boyhood before it shriveled up and morphed into girlhood. You glared at her to which she shook her head. "Curious place." you muttered.

"I don't remember a... blast." you said, honestly.

"There is a calming spell around this house, keeping all who enter here clear headed and rational." replied Delora. "It is so no one will panic, under any situation." she urged you to sit, she and mom soon followed. "We have a problem of which only you and your sister can help us with."

These people are quite mad and they are using both dark magic and hellish science to obtain their goal."
