"You will also be given zero gadget privileges for the week." she told you. "You will learn to inform us when you sneak off somewhere."

"Any violation of this punishment and you will be wearing a skirt for a month." warned dad. "Please get ready for dinner."

You nodded then slowly, sadly, walked up the stairs with Chris following you. "Sorry you got in trouble, bro." she said, quietly. "What were you able to find?"

"I'll tell you when we have more privacy." you whispered back.

Once you and Chis were out of sight, both mom and dad sighed. "We can't keep them in the dark forever." said mom, concerned. "They'll find out, sooner or later."

"I have a feeling that they already do, Elvira." said dad. "I just hope I'm wrong."

Minutes later, inside your bedroom, you told Chris what you had learned from Lillie Sweetie. "It's far more than just an out of control feud, sis." you explained. "Fifty years ago, there was an all out war between witches and mad scientists."

"There... was?" asked Chris, stunned. "Is it still going on?"

You shook your head. "Right now, there is an unsteady truce between the two powers." you told her. "Elvira Strange, the head witch, and Devon Bizarre, the collective master, have been working together to keep the peace."

"Collective master?" asked Chris, confused.

"Our version of the head witch." you replied, quickly. "Elena and Zed, although being brother and sister, could not let the war go and had been secretly fighting each other with a growing number of followers, despite orders from both powers to disengage."

"So what do we do?" asked Chris. "Call the head witch and collective master with what we know?"

You sighed. "I'm not sure." you replied. "Zed already knows that I'm against his war and I suspect that Elena will get wind of that soon and try to win one or both of us to her side. With me being banned from the lab..."

Chris sighed herself. "We will have to act, and soon." she said. "Otherwise, this old war is going to rekindle and there will be nothing we can do to stop it."
111232222221111221111212222221.title: More than a feud.

1112322222211112211112122222212.content:
"This is too big for us to handle alone." you said. "We're going to need some outside help."

"Maybe my coven and your collective could join forces." suggested Chris. "Together, we might be able to gather enough information to take to the witch council and the collective high command." (mad scientist equivalent to the witch council.)

Chris' coven was nothing more than a small group of witches she knew from school who hung out together, the same was true with your collective only you and the boys were all mad scientists. Never did the two groups challenge each other, it was kept on an individual basis as both groups respected the other. You considered Chris' words but you were uncertain if even the combined forces of two underage covens and a small collective of inexperienced mad scientists would be enough.

"It's an option." you said finally. "Only, I would be more comfortable if we sought help from someone with some higher experience. I had asked Lilly Sweetie but she had no intention of going that far for a mad scientist or a boy." you sighed. "Honestly, I feel lucky I got anything from her at all."

"Well, we need to call someone." said Chris. "Witch or mad scientist, it doesn't matter."

After a moment of thought, you pulled out your cellphone and called...
1112322222211112211112122222212.title: You need advice but who to call?

11123222222111122111121222222122.content:
"I'm going to call Dr. Tom Vague." you sad, finally, dialing a number. "He will know what to do. While i do, I suggest you call an experienced witch you know and see what she can do or find out."

Chris nodded and stepped away, pulling out her own cellphone to make a call. You were about to ask who she had in mind when someone picked up. "Eligere Sententia boys' boarding school." said a deep voice. "Dr. Vague speaking."

You paused. 'Eligere Sententia' was Latin for 'elite way of thinking', a fitting name for a private school that trained young mad scientists in the art of their science based powers. You had always thought it to be a little egotistical, though, as you had found a witch's way of thinking very stimulating at times.

"Juan Smith." you said in an even tone.

"Juan, it's always a pleasure to hear from you." said Tom, kindly. "Has your father finally decided to send you over for some real training or is this a social call?"

"Neither, I'm afraid." you said. "This is a matter of official business, we have a situation."

There was a pause on Dr. Vague's end. "Please be more specific." he said, softly.

"I have positive confirmation that Zed Brawl is forming a collective against his sister Elena Kruse's growing witch coven." you reported. "I have rescued two underage witches from Zed's control who will verify my statement."

"Where are these two underage witches?" asked Tom.

"Safe with their rightful coven, all underage witches." you replied. "They have expressed great interest in avoiding any conflicts between our two powers."

You heard Tom drumming his fingers on the other line. "Give me the details." he said, finally.

Taking a breath, you explained all you and your sister had discovered and managed to piece together, finishing by saying, "My sister, Chris, is on the telephone with a witch she trusts to assist."

There was a moment of silence before Tom said, "In your school, there is a closed off stairwell that leads to the basement. Inside the basement, you will find a prop telephone booth that belongs to the drama club."

"What will I be doing with this prop?" you asked.

"It is a teleporter." replied Tom. "Go to it after school and dial the Eligere Sententia school. It will bring you to straight to my office. Come alone, we will talk more then."

With that, he hung up. Worried, you relayed your conversation with Tom to Chris.

"I had a similar conversation with Ms Garrison at Witchbloom girls' boarding school." she said. "I don't like this."

You nodded. "Agreed. Any suggestions?"
11123222222111122111121222222122.title: A mad scientist.

111232222221111221111212222221221.content:
"We can't afford to be separated at this time, there is too much at stake." said Chris. "I will go to this Eligere Sententia school with you as an animal or object."

"Going as an animal will only get you locked up in a cage and take a risk of being experimented on." said Jan. "This is a school for mad scientists, remember. Normal rules and laws do not apply."

"An object it is then, perhaps a heavy jacket." suggested Chris.

You shook your head. "Security is everywhere at Eligere Sententia, its just like me trying to sneak into Witchbloom, using the same tactics, you will be found and detained." you paused. "We need to think outside of the box."

After a thought, Chris asked, "What about going with you as living energy?"

You turned to her curious. "Interesting strategy." you said. "Just how would you manifest yourself within me without my body using up your life energy?"

"I would not be inside you but surrounding you like a shield." said Chris. "I would be detected but as a mental shield not a conscious being unless someone used a... what did you call it?"

"A mass energy essence bio-scanner." you replied. "Its a hand held unit that detects living energy, used in cases of suspected magical or technological possession." you smiled. "It's not a bad idea but you will have to attach yourself to me so you will not be absorbed during the teleport."

"I can anchor myself to your very skin." replied Chris. "Just make sure you take a shower before school."

You laughed at that then turned serious. "I can guarantee what they will do with us once we get there." you said. "If you show yourself too soon, they might change your gender and register us as students."

"To keep us out of this." said Chris.

You nodded. "Exactly, stay alert when we arrive."

The following afternoon, as school let out for the day, you and Chris sneaked down the closed off stairwell to the basement where you found the prop telephone booth. Upon reaching it, you turned to Chris. "If we are going to do this, now is the time." you said.

"Just turn around, I'll do the rest." said Chis.

I did so and heard Chris take a deep breath before I felt my entire body start to tingle. Unknown to me, Chris had cast a spell, changing herself into a being of energy and was slowly stepping into my place, surrounding me like a second skin. I felt something driving itself into key spots in my back, legs, and arms and knew that she was locking herself into place. Finally, I heard her voice inside my thoughts. "It is done."

"We're off to Eligere Sententia, then." I thought back. "How are you holding up?"

"It feels weird." replied Chris in your thoughts. "We better get going, Dr Vague is expecting you."

You walked into the telephone booth, closing the door, then picked up the receiver and dialed the number. After three rings, someone answered, "Hang up and you will be teleported."

The instant you placed the receiver onto the hook, there was a bright flash and you found yourself in a large, well decorated office with a tall and powerfully built man sitting behind an great oak desk. "Welcome to Eligere Sententia boys boarding school, Jan." he said. "I'm glad that you could come."

"Thank you, Dr Vague." you replied. then you thought, "You still there, sis?"

"I'm a little nauseous but I'm still here." replied Chris in your head. "That was quite a ride."

You giggled inwardly. "You get used to it." you thought back.

"I'm slightly hurt that you felt the need to shield yourself, Jan." said Vague. "Has news of this conflict shaken you so badly that your trust in everyone has slipped?" he took a step away from his desk. "Your heart rate is rising and I sense a certain amount of concern, care to enlighten me, Jan?"

What do you say?
111232222221111221111212222221221.title: Chris has an idea.

1112322222211112211112122222212211.content:
"I have never met you in person or have been here before." you explained, honestly. "I have seen Zed's growing collective first hand, it is massive, though I had no time to sense who the other mad scientists were." you paused. "For all I knew, you were among those scientists in that collective. The second rule of mad scientists, Vague, trust no one."

Vague nodded, a thin smile forming onto his face. "Factoring that into the equation, I understand your caution, Jan." he said. "I promise you that I am not a member of that collective. I am loyal to only Devon Bizarre, the current collective master of Earth's mad scientists." after a pause, he added, "I wonder what your sister was told when she called her witch friend you had mentioned."

"She was told to report to Witchbloom girls' boarding school for debriefing." you replied. "However, witches have the same rule when it comes to trusting those outside their 'comfort zone'."

"Again, allow me to assure you, Jan." said Vague. "Witchbloom school works hand in hand with Eligere Sententia, we are in the business of maintaining the delicate peace between our powers through our teachings as a second war would certainly lead to nothing less than mutual destruction."

You gasped within at the thought, as did Chris, as your face paled. "Why would Zed and Elena want to restart such a war, its insane!" you whispered. "How did the last war end?"

Vague sighed. "It never ended, this peace we are enjoying is more of a cease fire." he replied, wearily. "Neither side is willing to fire the first shot, continuing the war, but nor is either side willing to stand down to end it."

"I see..." you said.

Vague sighed. "You are safe here, Jan, both this school and the witch school are considered neutral ground as they are both protected by the leaders of each side to maintain the cease fire." he told you. "With that said, please tell your sister she can come out now. I'm sure she is becoming quite bored, being a person of living energy."

Chris gasped within your mind. "He sniffed me out!"

"You have my word, Christina Smith, that you are safe here." said Vague. "Reveal yourself."
1112322222211112211112122222212211.title: Vague senses Chris' presence.

11123222222111122111121222222122111.content:
"Don't." you thought to Chris. "It's likely to be a trap, to make us both students."

"Only one way to find out." Chris thought back.

With that, you felt her essence detaching itself from your body and watched as she slowly rematerialized as flesh and bone before you and Dr. Vague. Seeing how pale she was, you took a defensive stand in front of her, causing Vague to laugh.

"You can relax, both of you." he said. "I have no intention of forcing either of you to attend this school. However, I do welcome you to take a tour."

"To show you are true to your word?" asked Chris.

Vague smiled. "To ease your minds and give you an audience with Devon Bizarre himself." he replied. "He is here today and I am certain that he would be interested to hear what information you two had gathered on your own."

You turned to Chris, who shrugged. "We did come here to tell them what we know." she said.

"We accept your offer." you said.

Vague nodded then walked to the door of his office. "Let us begin then. We will start with the surface school, teaching the basics of mad science." he said. "After, we will move on to the underground facilities...."

"The advanced classes." you said.

"Not all witch boys who come here are destined to become mad scientists." said Vague. "That is why the two schools are kept seperate so not to raise any false hopes." he then chuckled. "Do not be deceived, though, all witch boys carry a certain talent. Just as all witches specialize in certain magics."

You and Chris smiled and the tour began with...
11123222222111122111121222222122111.title: Chris now reveals herself.

111232222221111221111212222221221111.content:
Vague escorted you and Chris into a classroom where a professor was lecturing a class on advanced brain functions and how they worked. "These advanced functions are located in a part of the brain where normal humans do not have access." he said, eying you and Chris with Dr. Vague. "However, certain witch boys, as witches like to call us, will find it surprising easy to access these functions." he smiled. "With the right amount and mixture of concentration, will, and imagination, you will be able to summon a flame to your hand, opening the door to your full potential."

As if on cue, you summoned a flame, catching the attention of the class. "Your lecture is flawed, professor." you said. "Normal humans have full access to their brain, they merely lack the ability to comprehend the complexities of its true nature or the discipline to focus and utilize its true power."

The professor grinned. "Welcome, mad scientist." he said. "You are quite correct however, this was a test to see if my class would catch the error." he paused, turning to Chris. "I see you have your witch sister with you. To what do we owe this pleasurable visit?"

You nodded. "She is my twin sister." you replied. "We are here to..."

"To tour your school." said Chris cutting in, knowing your overly honest nature. "I am curious about this mad science."

The professor chuckled. "By all means then, take a seat." he said. "Feel free to participate, if you wish, just bear in mind that magic and mad science can never mix."

"I understand." replied Chris, taking a seat. "Please continue, professor."

You sat down next to your sister while Dr. Vague remained standing near the door in a passive stance. As the class continued, the professor turned to Chris. "Can you tell us, young lady, the main difference between magical energy and chaotic energy, which makes up a mad scientist's power?"

Chris rose her seat and cleared her throat. "Magical energy comes from two sources. One, the gene pool, thus only certain families have the talent and boys of those families have the potential. Two, the uterus, thus only girls can work it." she said, loud enough to be heard. "Chaotic energy also comes from two sources. The gene pool, thus girls of said families also have the potential, and..."
111232222221111221111212222221221111.title: Sitting through a class.

1112322222211112211112122222212211112.content:
"...sleep walking magical power, an unknown factor as it is yet to be determined exactly where that magical power resides within a witch boy."

The professor smiled. "Very good, young witch." he said. "Yes, that is partially correct." he waved his hand, causing a piece of chalk to write notes on the chalkboard. "Boys do not have magic as they need a uterus to focus the energy properly but they can work chaotic energy which is focused through...."

One boy suddenly rose his hand, was recognized, and rose top his feet as Chris sat down. "If magical and chaotic energies both exist within our genes, would it not be logical to assume that both energies reside within our very DNA? he asked. "Thus, the sleepwalking power is focused from that source?"

"That theory was considered more than once in the past, Mr. Talbot." replied the professor. "However, magical energy is not focused through the DNA but the uterus. Chaotic energy is focused through that sleepwalking magic in an extra bundle of muscles, between the stomach and intestines that only witch boys are born with." he paused, seeing the reactions from his class. "We have come to call this extra bundle of muscle... the phantom uterus."

"That would explain a lot." thought Chris. "The more magic is used against a witch boy, the stronger this phantom uterus becomes to resisting it." she gazed at the notes on the board then thought, "When a boy is transformed into a girl, this phantom uterus becomes a real one and shifts into position, explaining that extra burst of pain, even with his pain being suppressed..."

Chris' words were interrupted by the professor stating. "I hope you are all taking notes, I will be testing you on this before our guests part company with us."

Knowing that you would be tested as well, you and Chris both summoned a notebook and pen before quickly writing down a few notes to help you in the oncoming test. You and Chris, after taking the test, left the room with Dr. Vague and moved on with the tour. "Well done, Jan and Chis." said Vague. "I do believe you have impressed professor Hyde."

Where does the tour take you next?
1112322222211112211112122222212211112.title: Sleepwalking magic, the X factor.

11123222222111122111121222222122111122.content:
Vague took you and Chris down several halls, passed a number of classes to a pair large oak door at the end of one corridor where he suddenly turned to you and Chris. "Beyond these doors is the office of the most powerful man on earth." he said with a hint of pride. "Devon Bizarre."

Just then, the door opened inwardly and a powerful voice called out, "Come forth and know me better."

You and Chis exchanged a curious glance then walked passed the doors, which closed behind you, as Vague walked away to attend other matters. "I hear you two two came to inform me of a plot to rekindle the dark war." said the booming voice from a desk, the chair turned away from you.

"Yes, sir." you replied. "My sister and I have sufficient evidence that shows one mad scientist, Zed Brawl and his witch sister, Elena Kruse are still engaged in this, err, dark war and are gaining a growing number of followers on both sides."

"This is very disturbing to hear." said the booming voice.

Suddenly the chair turned and you and Chris found yourselves facing an aged but massive man in a black business suit with jet black hair and piercing green eyes. "Have you brought this evidence with you?"

You and Chris both quickly nodded, though you felt like fleeing as the very sight of the man caused you both to wince in fear as the power vibrating from the man was overwhelming. Seeing your reactions, Devon smiled kindly. "Relax, children, you have nothing to fear from me." he said. "Please show me your evidence."

Chris summoned all that she and you had gathered then levitated herself up to place it all on the desk in front of Devon who thanked her politely as she returned her feet to the floor. Devon poured over the papers, video disks, and photos, occasionally grunting or nodding his head. Finally he placed the papers aside and eyed you and Chris as a low sigh escaped his lips. "This is most disturbing indeed." he said. "Both Elena and Zed are considered rogues by both sides, they could be promising their followers anything."

Drumming his fingers onto the desk, he looked towards a window and stared out it for what seemed like an eternity before knotting his jaws in decision. "I must call my sister, let her know of this."

He quickly took up a telephone and dialed a number before hitting the speaker phone switch. "Elvira, we need to talk." he said, firmly. "Can you meet me in inside Crystalline cave within an hour?"

"It's very rare that you call me Devon." replied a familiar feminine voice on the other line with some concern. "Why do you want to meet in the neutral regions, is there an emergency?"

"I have just received strong evidence that points to two rogues, one for each side, trying to rekindle the dark war." replied Devon, gravely. "We must act quickly before this gets out of hand."

There was a pause before Elvira replied. "Very well, Devon, I will see you in one hour. Bring those who presented you with the evidence."

With that, the line went dead and Devon turned off the speaker phone and turned back to you. "You must accompany me to the neutral regions of the Crystalline cave system." he said. "My sister is not very trusting of me and I am not trusting of her but... we are still family."

"Who might your sister be?" you asked, curious.

Suddenly, Chris gasped, her face turning an ashen white. "You're sister, she's..."

Devon nodded. "Elvira Strange, the head witch."
11123222222111122111121222222122111122.title: The office of Devon Bizzare.

As Chris spoke those words, the realization hit you: Devon is at war with his sister. You look at Devon with shock.

1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.content:
The Crystal Caverns were located under the Atlantic ocean floor, off the coast of Florida. The trip there only took a few seconds as Devon used a teleportation device to take himself, you, and Chris there. The entrance was an air pocket found deep inside a blue hole. "I will go first, watch what I do carefully then follow after ten seconds, one at a time." said Devon with a firm seriousness. "The crystal caves are guarded by dragons, the last of their kind. they do not like a crowd."

With a hard swallow, you and Chris nodded then watched as Devon dived into the entrance of the cave, which had a strong current of air to keep out the Atlantic waters. You were not certain if it was magic or science that was causing this but it was indeed a powerful source.

After Devon had safely landed on a large stone ledge about a hundred feet down, he looked up at us then entered the cave as you went next. The air held you up but gradually allowed to fall as you positioned your body to fall towards the ledge.Once you landed safely, you looked down and shivered as you saw a collection of human skeletons from those who had either missed or were not invited. "I hope Chis makes it." you thought.

You entered the cave to find Devon waiting for you. Seeing your pale expression, he nodded. "Those remains you saw were of divers who were unfortunate enough to find this place." he explained. "You saw the sheer walls, once you hit the bottom, there is no climbing back up unless you can jump twenty feet to get back into the strong air current."

"Can't the dragons, guarding this place pull them out?" you asked.

"Not without exposing themselves." replied Chis, appearing behind you. "Dragons were nearly hunted to extinction by certain cultures of mankind, thinking they were demons."

"A discussion for another time." said Devon. "I'm certain Elvira is already waiting for us."

You and Chris followed Devon through a number of carved out corridors to a huge chamber where you found Elvira, a tall woman with night black hair and piercing green eyes. Eying her long black dress, you were impressed that she had great curves for her apparent age, though you did not voice this. You might have been a mad scientist but you were far from being suicidal as to risk insulting a witch. Then, your eyes turned to a great white dragon, resting behind her with large red eyes and all canine teeth. He looked down at his four visitors and sighed.

"You know the rule, Elvira Strange and Devon Bizarre, no fights. The crystals absorb all energy that is released into its halls and chambers but it does not absorb dragon's fire." he said with a hiss to his baritone like voice. "If you forget this rule and start fighting inside my home, all of you will receive a deep tan to remind you."

"There will be no fights here, Arragon." promised Elvira.

"We came in peace, we shall leave in peace." promised Devon.

Arragon nodded then turned to you and Chris. Catching his glare, Chris quickly said, "We honor the rules of any home we visit, there will be no fights."

"We are here to prevent a fight." you added, just a quickly. "It would do us no good to start one."

"You may proceed." said Arragon. "I will add my wisdom, when asked."

With that said, he fell silent as Elvira turned to you and Chris and said...
1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.title: You three get to the caves fine.
