1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.content:
To Elvira's request, you summoned a data pad, and handed it to her. "all the data my sister and i had collected is there." you said. "I first heard of the ancient war when I discovered my father's laboratory."

"Ah, so you might have over heard my conversation with your father." she said, scanning through the data. "He was a very curious lad as well." she grunted. "Most of this I already knew, but this last bit of data is most disturbing."

"The recruiting of witches and mad scientists." you said. "Yes, I have sensed the creation of a collective, standing apart from the mainstream, it is growing rather quickly. I can only surmise that this Zed is the lead scientist of that collective"

"I too have sensed the creation of a new coven, madam head witch." added Chris. "Normally, this is nothing to cause alarm, however, this coven is growing as quickly as the separate collective. We must assume that Elena is the lead witch."

"This is bad." said Elvira. "If these two forces start fighting openly, they could rekindle the dark war!"

"What started this dark war?" you asked, concerned.

Elvira sighed and replied....
1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.title: Please show me your evidence.

1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.content:
Elvira sighed and replied, "There are three sides to that story. Our side, their side, and then the truth."

"The witches side of the story is that witch boys became power hungry as they can not work magic and wanted a power of their own to level the field." said Devon, calmly. "Of course, the witches had claimed that they offered any witch boy wanting power to become a witch but certain boys wished to be themselves and turned to science."

"Something tells me it goes deeper than that." said Chris, wincing.

Devon nodded. "According to the written logs of the time, we were dubbed 'mad' scientists as we experimented on witches to find a way to make their power work for us through science." he explained. "Countless of witches became crippled or worse in the development of this power for boys. Through the years, as mad scientist became more powerful, witches claimed our hunger for power became greater. Eventually, a line was drawn and the war began."

"The mad scientists' side of the story is that witch boys were seen as nothing but toys for amusement to their witch sisters, mothers, relatives, and friends." countered Elvira, equally as calm. "So they say, witch boys were constantly humiliated and or tortured through the years until one brave boy decided he had suffered enough."

"He stole a magic book." you said, guessing correctly.

Elvira nodded. "According to legend, this boy used a magical artifact to study the magic book, while not transformed and spent the next twenty years of his life to develop and create what is now called 'mad' science. After the creation of his first laboratory, he teleported copies of his notes in a book entitled, 'The mad science book' into the hands of every witch boy, allowing them to fight back. Thus the war began."

"Both sides have done what each claim but not to such a grad scale." said Arragon, chiming in. "The truth is far more disturbing that anyone may imagine." He took a breath. "Mad Science and witchcraft have existed, hand in hand, since the age of the Pharaohs. There existed an unsteady peace between the two powers until a madness plague ripped across Europe, thus the strange tales that came out of the Dark Ages."

"A madness plague?" asked Chris, startled. "I never heard of such a disease."

"The Bubonic plague was used to cover it up." replied Arragon. "The madness disease effected everyone, including witches and mad scientists only, due to the power and inner jealousy of each other..." he sighed. "It was that madness that ultimately sparked the war and it did not end until the disease finally died out, fourteen years ago."

"That's insane." you whispered. "Why would Zed and Elena want such madness to continue?"

"Some people can not let go of the war, regardless of what truly started it." replied Devon. "The real question is, how to we stop this before its too late?"

"I will hold an emergency meeting with the witch council." said Elvira. "Maybe we can think of something."

Devon nodded. "I will call upon the mainstream collective and search for an answer." he said.

"Would you care to come along, you two?" asked Elvira. "Your insights could be valuable."

"Come gather with the collective, Juan and Christina." suggested Devon. "Your knowledge would be invaluable to finding a swift solution."

Who do you and Chis decide to go with?
1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.title: The tiangle of truths.

1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.content:
"No offense intended, lead scientist." you said with a respectful bow. "My sister must work with her strengths and I must protect my sister."

Devon nodded. "You may then act as a representative for the mad scientists' mainstream." he said, handing you an ear piece communicator. "We will be able to work with the witch council, though you to find a solution."

Elvira nodded in return. "I agree." she said. "This should eliminate most misunderstandings." she then smiled, turning to you and Chris. "Please take my hand then take a breath and hold it."

Upon taking Elvira's hand, you and Chris took a deep breath and held it as Elvira then gave Devon a quick nod. "Until next time, little brother." she said.

Devon nodded back. "Later, sis."

With that, the world suddenly vanished around you and was replaced with a large, richly furnished room somewhere with twelve young women sitting around a long table. They all looked at you and Chris curiously as you appeared. "This is Juan and Christina Smith." said Elvira, introducing you both. "They are here in regards to the latest threat to the unstable peace between us and the mad scientists." she then turned to you. "Jan, this is the witch council."

One woman, in her early twenties, rose from her seat. "I'm afraid that another threat has arisen, madam head witch." she said. "Eva Morgana has resurfaced and is threatening to launch a series of rockets that will send several gallons of a modified girl maker into the jet streams."

You and Chis turned to each other, alarmed but Elvira remained calm. "Has she explained the purpose of her actions, Rachel?" she asked, calmly. "Truly, Eva understands that without witch boys, witches will eventually die out."

"It's a panic call." you said. "This Eva is trying to force the mad scientists into a preemptive strike, rekindling the war.."

"Agreed." came Devon's voice, in your ear. "Only, its a viable threat. Eva is a spiteful witch."

"We agree." said Rachel. "Any suggestions?"

The council turned to you and Chris.
1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.title: Elvira.

choices: an island off the coast of Siberia
an island 500 miles south of Australia
1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.content:
"Wait. You said modified girl maker. How do you know?" Chris demands. The council looks at her slightly awkward, but Elvira says, "Eva sent us a sample. Unusual for her... but it proves her story. However it raises disturbing questions, since she is not acting alone."

"But how do you know?" you press. Elvira gulps, and nods. Two of the other council members head for the door, and pull a guy you guess is around 16 with a bag over his head out into full view. "We tested the potion on him" Elvira says with barely concealed disgust.

"You what!!!!" you rage. You know about girl maker and you're outraged that the witches have done such a thing. Oddly Devon is silent. Elvira looks at you firmly. "This boy was caught attempting to rape a witch. She was in public hence couldn't use her abilities to punish this miscreant..."

"Oh..." you say. "So I gather the potion does nothing to him"

"Yes. However an unfortunate.... incident proved its viable on witch boys" Rachel says. You gulp, not wanting to know.

"Can't someone bomb this place?" Chris asks.

"We could... but such action would be drastic. Both witches and mad scientists alike have never drawn attention to themselves to the greater public, even during the war. This island is in a sensitive area, a strike would certainly be detected, and likely be blamed on the U.S." Elvira says.

"Plus we are not certain a strike will work. The mad scientists might have something that works, but unless they are using nukes, or antimatter or something high temperature, the modified girl maker might be not fully consumed"

"Which is not acceptable" Elvira says.


"Where is this island?" Chris says
1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.title: Chris has an idea.

choices: I've got something that might help, at home
1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.content:
"500 miles south of Australia" sighs. You look at Chris, who already conjured up a globe. She frowns, since you both expected Antartica, inside she says, "Nothing there, madan head witch."

"Oh its there all right. It was a site of a major witch-scienist battle in 1905. It was our HQ, chosen for its remoteness, and the witches at that time sent everything they had to capture it, and end the war" Devon says. "Unfortuanately it nearly ends both of us. Our plan was to lure them in, and once they took the bait... "

"They released the bomb" Elvira frowned. "They were overconfident about their own protection against radiation, and underestimated our resilience. Yes, a witch fighting under those conditions tires easily, but we had a few tricks of our own. The reminants of both forces fled."

"So you want us to head into a radioactive hellhole?" Chris demanded.

"Another war will result in destruction of both orders as a collective group" Elvira says. "Sure, there will be isolated witches and scientists, but no longer a body supervising them..."

You look at Elvira and her council
1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.title: A hidden island, at the gates of hell

1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.content:
"I have a few things at home that might help in our mission." you said, after a thought. "I built them when I realized that a rogue from either side might try to attack Chris, I, or our parents."

"We don't have much time." warned Elvira. "Eva could launch those rockets at any moment."

You summoned a computer pad and brought up and image before handing it to Elvira. "Behold, the Scilock!" you said, with a hint of pride. "I modeled it after the Blackbird SR-7."

"It's a fine looking aircraft." said Elvira. "Only, we can teleport there almost instantly."

"Eva will know we had arrived before we even get close if we do that." you argued. "Flying in with the Scilock, under the radar, is our best bet of catching her by surprise."

"What does your aircraft have that will help us disarm this threat?" asked Devon.

You smiled. "It has a bio-mechanical reactor that magically draws in hydrogen from the air, water, space, where ever we decide to fly her." you said. "Chris helped me with the reactor design."

One member of the council stood up. she was tall and attractive with long light brown hair and green eyes. "Rachel, speaker of the council." she said, introducing herself. "Are you telling me that this... Scilock plane is made from both mad science and witchcraft?"

"Correct, it has all the latest technological defenses as well as several magical defenses as well." you replied, nodding. "This bird is a marriage between the two powers with anti-gravity shields, a magical cloaking device, science and magic energy detectors..." you shrugged. "I also have a number of hand held devices Chris and I had put together."

"How long can you gather this equipment with your plane?" asked Rachel.

"It's already here." you replied. "We can leave as soon as we assemble a team."

Elvira turned to each other then turned back to you and Chris. Finally, Elvira spoke up. "Jan, Chris...
1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.title: Never go unprepared.

choices: you decide to call in help mid flight
1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.content:
You're stunned to hear the witch council wants to send you and Chris to this island, but Elvira is refusing to back down. "Three reasons Mr Smith. One, send in too many, they'll be detected, then slaughtered. There is still things on that place left over from the battle a century ago, and these people are insane. This leads to reasons two and three. If there is mass loss of life on that..... place, it could call for vengance, never mind who started it. Unacceptable. And the third is that these guys are mad. It is possible they will launch anyway."

"And if this looks likely, any nearby chaotic scienist will wipe the island and everything on it off the map. again" Devon says. "I have some serious convining to do" he says, cutting his link.

"What does that mean?" Chris demands.

"The mad scientists may want to deal with this themselves, and they're more reckless than us. There is a reason why they're called mad" Racel says. You bit your tongue. Elvira smiles. "I need you to indicate when you've about 100 miles from the target. Then I'll teleport a strike team into Sydney."

"To help?" Chris asks.

"In a way. It is the closest major witch population center in the region to that island. They would detect the teleports there and hopefully not focus on you" Elvira says.

A few minutes later, as you're about to board your plane, Elvira runs up to you, giving you a needle. "One more thing. Eva is truely is spiteful and insane. If you disable her rockets, she might release the modified girl maker thought the island compound just to spite those who stopped her. We have this counteragent. If you come into contact this the agent, use the needle and inject yourself into the heart..."

Nice. Realy nice...
1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.title: You must go alone.

1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.content:
Thanks to the teleportation system on your Scilock plane, you and Chris are within visual rang of what Elvira and Devon had dubbed Hell's Gate Island. "Stay sharp, Chris." you called back to your sister. "We're nearing the target."

"Rodger that, Jan." replied Chris, sitting at a station behind you.

"Max, do you detect any movement on the island?" you asked, telepathically to your lab computer.

"Negative." replied the IA computer, Max, also telepathically. "Satellite scans show zero movement on the island surface."

"Madeline, do you sense any magical activity on the island?" thought Chris to a black cat, lying by her legs.

Madeline was Chris' familiar, a cat with magical powers of her own, including an uncanny sense of Clairvoyance. The two were more partners than pet and master. Like you and 'Max', they spoke to each other telepathically. "No, Christina, I can't sense anything through that radiation." the cat gave an apologetic meow. "Sorry."

"Your familiar will have to remain on the plane, Chris." you said, hearing the cat. "I don't have a shield geared for her."

"No, it was easier to put a shield on a pet carrier." thought Madeline, sarcastically.

"Maddie, behave!" whispered Chris. "This is a dangerous mission, I don't want you to get hurt."

"Focus, you two!" you snapped. "We're within striking range of target, keep an eye out for traps!"

Just as you said that, two poles shot out of the water and an energy shield appeared between them. It was part of a massive 'wall' to stop ships and low flying planes. The shield could come up all at once or in sections to save power and was triggered automatically by underwater motion detectors.

"Woah!" you yelled, seeing the energy wall. "We triggered a barrier trap!"

You roughly turned the stick, sending the plane spinning out of the way and around the section and through before the next section could be triggered. As you passed, the two poles sank back down into the water. "Max, any signs we've been detected?" you thought.

"Negative, all is still silent." replied Max.

"Madeline, anything?" asked Chris.

Madeline meowed urgently. "Hard right, magic trap!"

Then, Chris sensed it and roughly turned a stick of her own, turning the plane hard to the right as a large hand, made of water, rose up and slammed down, just missing the plane. "Shit!" you exclaimed. "Eva set a few magical traps, she has to know we're here!"

"That trap is a century old." said Madeline's voice in your head. "It's powered by an enchanted chest, used ages ago to cover the escape of a witch ship."

"Let's not take any chances." you said. "Power up your shields and check your gear, I'm bringing the plane in cold."

With that, you powered down all of the mechanical systems and hit the bio-cool down switch, instantly making the plane cold enough to seem it has not run in years. The rest was a simple matter of gliding the plan in for a landing with Chris using the magical systems to erase the fresh landing tracks in the soft sand. "What's the plan, bro?" asked Chris.

"We must split up to make this mission work." you said. "I will go after the rockets with Max augmenting my power in case of any left over traps or automated defense systems."

"What will I be doing?" asked Chris.

"You will have to keep Eva and any cronies she has occupied, without directly confronting them." you replied. "Madeline can augment your power, if necessary, through the plane's magical systems."

Chris nodded then turned to Madeline. "Do you remember how to do all of this?" she asked.

Madeline looked up at Chris as if to smile. "I remember, just don't make me come to your rescue."

Chris smiled, remembering that Madeline could become any cat, including a tigress. "We'll be back." she said.

Madeline watched, meowing worriedly, as you and Chris departed the plane then jumped up onto a cushioned stand near come controls. "Return safely." she thought.
1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.title: You and Chris are never alone.

choices: you order the missile to be shot down
you allow it to leave the island
1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.content:
You look around cautiously, even though the beach is deserted. From what you could gather the rockets are located deep inside the island. Unfortunately, that is where Eva and anyone with her is likely to be. Plus the fact that there is no defense on the beach tells you one thing; the defenses are all inside complex, turning it into a potential killing zone. According to Devon, something like that happened the last time someone fought on this accursed rock.

As you about to look for a vent of something, you get two warnings from Max. The first is bad. Analysis of vents indicate radioactive waste. Exposure limited to thirty minutes before negative symptoms occur You groan, since you don't even want to know what 'negative symptoms' mean, though you guess it is tiredness first. You know you can't afford to be tired here; Eva would do worse than leave you for a day as some sort of catgirl-mermaid hybrid as Chris did the last time you lost a fight against her. The second message is worse. Missile launch sequence detected. Five minutes to launch.

You feel like you're failed, before you have even begun. Would Eva launch way before her own deadline? You grimace, not much relieved when Max informs you that the target is Elvira's distaction. You know that the scilock can shoot the missile down, but that would make Chris's mission harder, as well as your own, since Eva would be alerted to your presense. However you also know even if the missile is shot down by Elvira before it can reach Sydney, it would be detected. While a normal military might be able do, the science collective would for sure. And you know, within a few hours, they're certainly burn this place down.....
1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.title: Your mission.

choices: Eva paces in the command center.
1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.content:
Suddenly, you remembered the magic trap you had just averted before landing and smiled as you saw the rocket flying off in that exact direction. "The trap is designed to protect a fleeing witch ship." you whispered.

As you had guessed, a large hand of water shot up and slammed the rocket down into the water. The rocket exploded, sending shock waves that shook the sandy beach. Only your smile faded as the shock waves also triggered the island's automatic defenses. The barrier shield went up all around the island with sirens going off everywhere and you turned to see numerous robot crabs, the size of small dogs coming out of the sand. You knew the crabs were 'old tech' but they were still lethal with their poisoned pincers and telescoped laser eyes. One shot at you, forcing the creation of a telekinetic shield, which took the risk of Eva detecting it.

"Blast it all!" you whispered. "So much for sneaking in!"

Annoyed that your mission had become more complicated, you decided to deal with the crabs quickly and fired off a localized EM pulse, an option on your shielding. The move fried the circuitry of the crabs but it reduced your shield's power by 10%, due to the heavy drain. "I had better be more careful." you scolded yourself. "I'm more vulnerable now."

You then hurried across the sand to find a vet and, as Max had warned, it was lined with a thick gel like form of radioactive waste that caused the walls to glow slightly. Gulping, you saw no other choice and moved to enter the vent, only to jump aside as a flame shot out of it. Approaching more cautiously, you found a number of miniature flame throwers, all activated by motion detectors. "The mad scientists of old truly went to extreme measures to keep out any uninvited guests." you stated to yourself. "I don't have time to deactivate all of the defenses, Chris can't keep those rogues busy forever."

After a moment of thought, you took a deep breath and took a flying leap into the vent, sliding down the slick radioactive walls with the flames reacting a second after you pass the sensors. By the time you reached the underground base to begin your mission, the shield had dropped another 10%.

"Proceed with extreme caution, Jan." came Max's digitized voice. "You know have precisely twenty minutes of protection remaining in your shielding before you will be forced to draw upon your own power."

"Tell me something I don't know." you thought back.

"The activated barrier can be seen from satellite imagery." replied Max. "Approximately ten minutes before it is detected by a military power."

"Perfect!" you whispered, annoyed. "Just perfect!"

Knowing that time was not your ally, you hurried down the hall, using decade old schematics from Devon to find the rockets while, elsewhere....
1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.title: you allow it to leave the island

1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.content:
Inside a dusty but preserved high tech command center, Eva paced the floor, fuming. She had planned for the rocket to force the witches there to defend themselves, giving away their location to the already panicked mad scientist collective. Only, an old witch trap stopped the rocket before it could go anywhere. Annoyed, she looked at the command center, shaking her head at the technology the room offered.

"It's hard to believe that, even after a decade, all of this is still beyond normal human comprehension." she whispered to herself, ruefully. "Yet, no matter how advanced both sides have become, we are yet to determine who is stronger."

"Regardless, there can only be one power in this world... Evana." came a raspy voice.

Eva turned sharply, hating to hear her full name being spoken, and gasped. "Phobos!"

Phobos was a mad scientist so obsessed with power that he molded his laboratory into the form of a robot and literally fused it to his own body, making him a living machine. During the Dark War, he was a vicious leader and a merciless enemy who caused both witches and mad scientists alike to shudder in fear before him. As he stood in the entrace to the command center, Phobos gave a low chuckle. "The years have been good to you, sis." he said.

"How dare you use my full name!" said Eva, a twinge of fear in her voice. "If I had my full power..."

"I could have used your birthname... Evon." said Phobos, emphesising his sister's male name.

Eva sighed, wanting to scream but she knew that she would not stand a chance against her older brother. "I thought you had died in the last great conflict." she said, eying him. "Where have you been hiding?"

"I never left the island." replied Phobos. "I remained here, honing my skills, waiting for the war to erupt anew." he paused, looking at Eva with his dead robot eyes. "It surprises me to see you here, Evana. I give you one last chance to reclaim your manhood and stand by my side, brothers reunited."

Eva shook her head. "You psychotic mad scientist!" she screamed. "I remember how you treated my sister with your 'noble' intentions. I was the one who defended her, even after she discovered magic. When it came time for us to chose a side in the war, I begged my mother to make me a witch!" she sighed, keeping her distance. "I knew, even then, the path your were going down would lead to this."

"Reconsider, my brother." said Phobos, ice in his tone. "I would prefer to claim you as an ally than a trophy."

Eva summoned a flame to her hand then...
1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.title: An enemy returns from the dead.

1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.content:
Phobos frowned. "You think a pathetic thing like you can stand against the might of Phobos?" he said, as he distastefully looked at Eva's flame. "You couldn't even stand against that useless coven you called 'friends' You was a failure of a man, and now your failure is complete..."

"Enough with the talk, Tincan" Eva snarled, knowing the name 'timcan' would enrage Phobos more than his real name. It worked; Phobos instantly clunched his fist and opened it again. Before she knew it, Eva flew into Phobos's steel hand; his hands around her neck.

"Intesting plan you had, sis" Phobos sneered. "Using science to augment your insignificant powers. You always knew witches are inferior" He tightened his grip. "It takes a true scienist to make things right...."

"You're going to wipe out your own kind?" Eva gasped, as Phobos' grip tightened.

"They're renounced that, when they made peace. No, they'll see the true power..." he said, thinking of retargeting the rockets for his own purposes. He smiled at the gasping Eva who was are the verge of blacking out. "Pity you decided to fight me. Even you could have been of some use.... , Sadly, our time together has come to an end....."
1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.title: A very one sided fight

1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.content:
It was not long after Eva lost consciousness and Phobos carried her, by the throat, down a long hall. There was no concern in his mind what the lack of oxygen would do to her as he entered a room marked 'surgery'. He placed her onto the table like a piece of meat, slamming her back onto the lightly padded steel table. Upon releasing her throat, Eva gasped and coughed, even though she was still out cold.

"You should have taken my offer, dear sister." said Phobos, strapping Eva down to the table. "Now I have no choice but to treat you as an enemy. The question is... what to do with you?"

A hard slap on the face awakened Eva and she immediately struggled against her bonds to no avail. "I should have killed you when I had the chance... Francis!"

Phobos grunted. "You still spite me with my true name." he said, working some controls. "That will end once I claim my trophy and reprogram your mind." he looked directly into Eva's eyes. "I have decided, despite your arrogance, to bless you with immortality. I will fuse you inside a machine I had constructed just for you... Miseria."

Eva turned pale. "M-Miseria!?"

"It's Latin, meaning suffering." explained Phobos. "It's your new name, once I install your brain into the laboratory robot."
he gave a deep, evil chuckle. "I chose the name as you seem to enjoy being female. Of course, to earn your name, you will have to know what true suffering is."

Panic set into Eva's mind as she could only imagine what Phobos had in mind for her. She watched in horror as he then held his hand over her. "I now claim my trophy, your skeleton!"

Eva screamed in a pitch beyond her normal rage as she felt her bones being ripped out of her body in a slow, meticulous way in order to increase her suffering. Her screams echoed throughout every hall of the command center for several seconds before they suddenly ceased and an unnerving silence took its place....
1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.title: Phobos begins experiements on Eva

1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.content:
Several hundred feet away from the surgery room, Chris was searching for Eva so to know where to start her diversionary tactics when she heard her screams. Thinking that Eva had found you, she ran down the hall to where the screams were coming from and entered the room. There she found Phobos, who she knew nothing about, using telekinesis to rip the bones from Eva's body. She gasped, hearing Eva's tortured screams, then turned red with anger. In her mind, no one deserved such a fate, action was called for and she knew it would take more power than she could summon alone.

Throwing her mind out, she screamed, "Jan!" before summoning all she dared to throw at the robot. You heard Chris' scream echoing in your mind and sent her all the energy you dared to release, reaching her immediately. Phobos looked up to Chris' scream just in time to see her throw a very powerful energy blast that threw him clear off his feet. He landed with a metallic crash on the other side of the room as Chris then quickly took a vial from her jacket pocket and gulped down its contents, making a face at the taste. "How can he stand drinking this stuff!? she asked herself, feeling her strength and energy return. "It's disgusting!"

"G-Get me up!!" screamed Eva in a blind panic. "He'll kill us both if you don't hurry!"

Chris waved her hand, releasing Eva's bonds, then gave Eva one of the restoring serums. "It tastes horrible but it'll quickly restore your energy and strength." she said.

Eva drank down the serum, making a similar face, then pushed Chris out of the way as she ran out. "Remind me to thank you later, if you live!" she yelled, running out. "I have some rockets to launch!"

"Bitch!" screamed Chris, now regretting freeing her. "Come back here!"

"I would worry more about yourself, little lady." said Phobos, now standing again. "No one attacks me and lives!"

Chris turned to Phobos, knowing that she could not rely on another boast from you so she called to her familiar, Madeline, giving her a look through her eyes. "Who or what is it?" asked Chris. "How do I fight it?"

The response chilled her to the bone. "He is Phobos, the living machine. You do not fight him alone, you run or die."

Chris, hearing this, ran for the door only to find it slam shut and seal as she felt something pulling on her body. It was to her good fortune that she was able to resist it, otherwise, she's be in a choke hold by Phobos' hand. "You are Phobos, the living machine." said Chis, circling him. "I need Eva alive, for now, to carry out my mission."

"What, pray tell is your mission?" asked Phobos. "You have nothing to lose, save your own life."

"My mission is to re-secure the peace between witches and mad scientists." replied Chis. "Eva is one of few trying to rekindle the Dark War... I need to stop her and to get her to tell me where her sister is."

Phobos grunted. "You are too young to truly understand beauty the horror of war." he said. "However, I shall give you a piece to take with you to the other side."

With that, he began his attack, using techniques that Chris never saw you ever use, slamming her against the wall or surgery table before she could offer any defense. He had slammed her around, cutting her, bruising her, burning her to the point that her magic became nearly exhausted.

"Please... no more." begged Chris, barely standing. "Please..."

Phobos laughed. "How easy it is to make a witch beg for mercy!" he said, amused. "Now that you understand a little more about the beauty of war, I shall show you the horror." Chris' eyes widened to the size of saucers, seeing Phobos motion to the table. "Get on unless you want me to place you there myself."

Chris' lips trembled, fearing a slow and horrible death at the hands of this powerful enemy when a loud crunch reached her ears and she saw the door to the room being literally torn away by a giant metallic hand. Taking advantage of the distraction, Chris ran to the door as fast as her injured body would allow her as a giant robot came into view It looked like an old school diving suit but the left hand was replaced with a giant drill and the helmet was completely sealed with cameras instead of windows. As she took a stand near it, holing a magical artifact, Phobos turned to the new visitor.

"You look like shit, sis." You said through the robot. "The rockets are all junk, thanks to this old battle suit I found."

"J-Jan, this is..." began Chris.

"Phobos, the living machine." you said, interrupting. "Yes, I read about him." he then turned to Phobos. "You have a lot of balls, daring to hurt my sister, you tincan! Let's see how well you fair when the odds are more even!"

With that, you charged Phobos, knocking him to the metal floor. Phobos, completely enraged, fights back physically and the two of you began to roll around on the floor, exchanging blows. Chris, caught in the middle, managed to gulp down another restoring serum before running from the room at full speed. She had no time to pick a direction as you and Phobos crashed through the wall in an all out death match. Unknown to Chris, you had summoned the power of your lab to increase your power, knowing full well it could trigger your gender to forever change....
1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.title: Chris rescues Eva.

1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.content:
"Feeble little boy!" Phobos hisses as you grapple with him. It been decades since anyone (apart for the unfortunate Eva) had fought against him, and it infuriated him. "You obviously didn't have enough information about the might of Phobos!"

"You're right" you say, struggling. "it didn't say that you're a self obsessed, egotistical lunatic. Its over, Tincan. Your missiles are grounded."

"Poor little fool" Phobos mocks, as he tried to get free. You just delayed the ineviable. I'll launch soon enough. Surrender now, and I might leave you alive to witness it."

"You're the one that should surrender" you hissed, knowing even with your lab augmentation, it isn't enough. You're on the verge of collapse.

"Weakling! Maybe I should test exactly what my useless excuse of a sister had made" he said, tightening his grip on your arm, despite you gripping his other arm. You pull, but even with one arm, he is too strong for you, and he pulls you away towards one of the rockets you destroyed. "Stupid fool. You should have distroyed the chemical" Phobos says, as he pulls out the intact vial of chemical. Seeing the girl maker, your eyes go wide. "Its over Phobos. Changing me won't achieve anything. My sister will have alerted anyone to your presence. They'll bomb you and your island into rubble."

"Like I'm afraid of that airheaded bimbo" Phobos said, dismissing Elvira. "They try to burn this place down, they'll be digging their own grave."

"What about Devon?" you smiled.

"Yes. The traitor. Yes, he could use antimatter explosives, but he won't. He can't. And his so called 'Plan B' is not ready. And by the time it is, he will be learning about makeup and miniskirts" Phobos smiled. "Enough talk. Time to say goodbye" He ripped off your helmet, but to his anger, he saw you was gone...

On the other side of the island. you mutter to yourself. "That was too close. Chris, you still alive?"

"Yeah... Jan, get to the beach...."
1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.title: Death match.

choices: a cursing fifty year old man.
1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.content:
You gave Chris a sad look, sending her into tears. "Jan, you can't!" she screamed. "That... thing will kill you!"

"Not if we merge." you replied, to her silence. "Your magic will be dominant as my laboratory will be fueling the link."

"Jan... you could become my sister forever." warned Chris, gravely. "Worse, it could destroy us both."

"We'll both die anyway if the war is rekindled." you said, tears forming. "And, if I become your twin sister, I'm sure you'll help me learn magic and make up."

Chris hugged you, crying. "I love you, bro." she sobbed.

"I love you, sis." you replied.

With that said, you and Chris both recited your end of the incantation/laboratory command. "Born under the union of moon and sun (full eclipse) grant these two souls the power of one!"

Both yours and Chris' body began to glow, growing in brightness until neither one could be distinguished from the other as a brilliant flash occurred before the glowing stopped, revealing a powerful looking girl in a simple dress. In a strange voice, she said, "I am Christaun."

Christaun ran back into the command center, through its halls at incredible speed to find Phobos, preparing an escape ship he had built in the decade he was living on the island. "I will miss this island, many memories lie here." he said to himself, opening the hatch to the small submarine. "No matter, I still have my mansion in the south Pacific."

"You will forever remain here, Phobos." said Chistaun, appearing. "This war will not continue."

Phobos laughed. "So, the legend behind twin witches is true." he said. "Even as one being, you can not stop me!"

Christaun did not respond, she merely waved her hand, causing the submarine to completely dismantle on its own, leaving Phobos no means of escape. "I will not be stopping you, the 11.0 earthquake will."

Phobos, though it could not be seen, turned pale. "That high of a magnitude could crack the very Earth!"

"The beauty and horror of war." said Christaun with a rueful smile. "The earthquake will sink the island but no tidal waves will come of it as the shield around the island will prevent it.... ironic, don't you think?"

Phobos growled, sending forth a powerful lightning blast only Christaun knocked it away, sending it into a control panel, destroying it completely. "You're science is powerful, Phobos." she said, calmly. "So is magic but the union of the two is stronger still, you can not win."

With a scream of rage, Phobos began to fire everything he had at Christaun as she, in turn, fought back. The entire compound shook with their duel while, inside a mansion on the Australian shore, Elvira frowned, sensing the massive power levels coming from the island. Standing by her side was mom and dad who stood with worried looks dominating their expressions. "Phobos is on that island." said Elvira to mom, who began to cry. "It's forced the merger." she shook her head and sighed. "We have no choice, I will tell Devon to begin the countdown. Hell's Gate Island must be sent to bottom of the ocean."

"What of Juan and Christina!?" asked mom, distraught. "You sent them there!"

"They volunteered." Elvira fired back. "They knew the risks from, the beginning." she then sighed. "Had I known Phobos was still alive, I would have gone myself but it's too late for regrets."

She then walked away as mom fell into dad's arms, crying...

Back on the island, Phobos pushed Christaun into a shattered electrical panel, causing her to scream as her body shook with convolutions. "Die, abomination!" screamed Phobos.

As Christaun's body took the electrocution, Jan laboratory at home took the damage. Sparks flew from every machine as alarms sounded and robots scrambled to put out the small fires that were sparking everywhere. Jan knew that if he took too much damage, he would become a witch. He dared not think of the reverse and took all the pain.

Inside the Scilock jet, Madeline sensed Jan's move and shook her head. "Typical boy." she thought. "Always playing the macho hero." she sighed. "I'd better boost Chris's share of the power or I'll never hear the end of it."

With that, she glowed, changing shape, becoming a a full grown tigress. Madeline roared, her power reaching Christaun immediately, giving her the power to throw Phobos off of her. She walked away from the panel then waved her hand, taking away a section of Phobos' armor. There, inside the heart of the living machine, resting in a sealed transparent chamber was....
1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.title: The secret of Phobos.

1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.content:
It was ironic to Christaun to find a small 13 year old boy, sleeping inside the chamber as it explained the name of the feared and dreaded living machine. Phobos, Greek for fear, as its creator feared it. "You poor, unfortunate fool." thought Christaun, shaking her head. "You gave the AI of your laboratory too much freedom. It became corrupt and your slave quickly became your master."

"You are not the first to discover my secret, abomination." said Phobos, his body already repairing itself. "My creator had wished to see the end of the war with his own eyes. I am granting him his wish, even if it takes an eternity."

"The Dark War is over, Phobos!" said Christaun, charging him. "Your services are not longer required!"

"The war is never over!" raged Phobos, fighting back. "Not so long as one power stands!"

The struggle renewed only this time, Phobos was forced to be on the defensive as Christaun gave him not time to focus on repairs as she pounded away on the lines that were holding the sleep chamber to his massive frame. energy blasts, flame attacks, lasers, and shields were thrown everywhere as the two struggled in this one on one duel to the death. "I will not be defeated by two children!" screamed Phobos, lashing out with an energy sword.

The blade sliced deep into Christaun's arm, drawing blood from Madeline's right front leg as she roared in pain. Your laboratory responded by increasing power output, allowing Christaun to fire back with sword of flame, slicing away one of the four power lines to the sleep chamber. As this was done, the boy inside began to stir. "I do not believe your creator will be pleased with you once he awakens, Phobos." said Christaun, slashing the second power line.

Phobos did not answer as he roared with rage, lashing out with all he had with Christaun countering, doing all she could to disconnect the last two power lines. It was a duel unlike any either you or Chris ever faced. A power blast from Phobos sent Christaun flying off her feet, into a wall of twisted and jagged metal, forcing an explosion at your laboratory, taking out a third of its power to keep Christaun intact for as long as possible. Inside the Scilock jet, Madeline laid down, no longer able to stand as all of her legs suffered damage. "This death duel will end soon." she thought. "I only pray Chris and Jan come out victorious."

On the mainland of Australia, mom and dad were still looking out in the direction of Hell's ate Island. "They are strong, Elvira, we raised them that way." said dad, trying to be of comfort. "They will come home alive."

"I pray you're right, Simon." said mom, tears falling. "I had hoped to keep them out of this war but it came to them."

Mom then began to wail again with Simon doing all he can to keep himself together. Withing them Elvira Strange sighed. "I should gone myself." she whispered. "Forgive me, children."

Back on the island, Christaun had managed to tear out the third power line and had her hand on the fourth. "This ends now, Phobos!" she screamed. "Awaken, Francis Kruse!"

She ripped the line out with a satisfying spark of electricity and the chamber opened, sending the boy, Francis, falling out of Phobos and rolling away on the metal floor. He immediately awakened and rubbed his eyes before turning to his robot creation with fear and hatred in his eyes. "You... You... abomination!" he screamed.

"Return to where you belong!" demanded Phobos, moving towards Francis. "The war still rages on!"

"The war is over!" screamed Francis, angrily. "Strangely Bizarre!"

Phobos halted, inches from taking the boy into his arms, all of its systems shut down and unmoving. Francis then rose, unsteadily, to his feet and walked over to Christaun. "The attack on this island will come very soon." he said, shaking. "We must leave."

"Then we must move quickly." replied Christaun. "You are unable to run in your condition, I will carry you."

"As you wish it." said Francis.

It took Christaun five minutes to leave the compound and return to the Scilock jet. By then, the ground had already begun to shake violently. She found no sign of Eva, though she did scream her name. She boarded the jet and strapped Francis in before returning to two individuals. Only there was no time for you to worry about which gender you were at the time.

"We have to get out of here, now!" you yelled, ignoring your voice. "Chris activate only the magical systems, we have to get passed that water trap!"

"Rodger that!" replied Chis.

The jet was soon airborne and was flying away from the rapidly sinking island. In his seat, Francis stared out the window, crying for his sister as he had originally created his robot to bring a peaceful end to the war. He found it disturbing that his good intentions had created a monster. "I'm through with science." he whispered. "Good bye sis."
1112322222211112211112122222212211112211.title: Strangely Bizarre!

choices: Continue with Jan and the witches in his lab.
Follow Chris's meeting with her coven to arrange the transfer.
111232222221111221112.content:
Jan realized that he was still in the physical form of his sister when he appeared in the lab. Unfortunately, he was not an exact match of her DNA, or his either. If either of those were true, then the defensive isolation neutralizer would have had a positive green match from the personal characteristics authorization database and not have initiated level five containment around him.

Taking a deep breath to relax, Jan projected his personal power into the lab's energy-matter modifier to transform himself back, but nothing happened. Figuring it was also confused by his mixed molecular state, Jan sent a mental signal to the security verification designation module to disengage and stop this nonsense. Immediately, the lab responded with a mild shock to Jan and upped containment to level seven. Jan then began to fume at his sister knowing she must have known this would happen.

The main computer quickly asked Jan, "Miss Christina ?? Why have you materialized in your brothers lab? You know he has instructed me never to allow even you to be released. Only he has the technical ..."

"I'm not Chris. It's me. Turn this thing off!" Jan interrupted the synthetic patter although only the two of them could understand over the screaming alarms, the containment field not even allowing sound to escape.

"Nice try Miss Christina, but just because you have no clothing doesn't mean I can't see you. Juan's advanced physical definition restorer has clearly unmasked your frail magic so that my sensors have visual ..."

"Cut this now or when I get out of this, your hyper-auto determination neurological converter amplifier will be taken and shoved into your anterior positronic output collator so that your seismetric gyroscopic pressures increase until you ..."

By then the computer realized only Juan knew those technical details, and was relieved when the lights and sound effects went off. It didn't want any rearrangement of any of its mechanical or electronic mechanisms, especially those being described by Juan.

Jan closed his eyes to calm himself while he counted to ten. He was glad Chris wasn’t there or she’d be laughing at his predicament (actually she was using her crystal ball and enjoying this immensely). Once he was relaxed, he stepped forward right into the containment beam.

"DAMNIT !!!"

"Remember that it can't be turned completely off without dual control input authentication per Juan's failsafe instructions; but at level two, intercommunication with the lab can be recognized."

Jan was so exasperated, that all he did was exactly that - free himself and add his current PMD (physical-mental DNA) to the PCAD (see above). He thought about modifying the whole reactive defense system so his mad scientist power could be transmitted through any electronic containment wall and be a positive identification factor recognizer, but that would take time.

Time was short now, and he needed to get the rescued witches ready to be put under the protection of Chris's coven. "Where were they, anyway?" he wondered as he strode forward still naked looking like his sister but forgetting that fact. "I hope all this scientific warning protection alarms didn't scare the poor things further."

'Wow! That was close." one of the young witches said as she came walking over to Jan. Neither of the witches had seen Chris before, and they actually thought Jan was an agent of their coven who somehow broke in.

"We weren't sure it could be turned off at first. This lab is more complex and sophisticated than Zed's. If he ever got his hands on this, ..." the other informed Jan with some concern.

The first quickly added, "Are you alright? I think I can still do a healing spell. This place let's me do some minor magic that I've recovered since we escaped Zed's."

The fact that Jan had turned off the anti-magic diffuser shield when he had first teleported the witches seemed to be a good thing now to let these, what Jan thought as broken and harmless, witches recover without his lab zapping them. Jan now remembered how his sister had snuck in once and he had to install this after she "played" with him. He began to be distracted by other modifications and "playing" with his sister when he was brought back to the present when the other little witch spoke.

"This is much more sophisticated and not like Zed's that manipulated anything we tried so he could break us."

Their constant mention of Zed had Jan very intrigued to find out more about Zed's lab and capabilities. His logical scientific right-sided mind, as well as compassion, instantly narrowed his focus on what Zed did to them so he could help them recover plus know how it works to combat it. Jan continued to dismiss his current physical state of Chris's form which he found very comfortable and ignored the subtle changes in the lab as well. There were some runes on equipment as well as small things here and there that looked like little creatures hanging onto the sides of some equipment.

"Tell me about Zed's and what he did so that I can better protect us all and modify the lab as necessary."
111232222221111221112.title: Distractions keep you a girl.

1112322222211112211121.content:
Jan could tell that the mention of Zed's torture was traumatic, but they very readily explained in clear, almost scientific terms.

The first one began, "His whole process was one of humiliation versus reward that would cause magic to seem disgusting while science to be fascinating and beneficial."

The other added, "It eventually became painful to even think of magic, but that loss was replaced with the utmost respect for science, Mistress."

"Mistress?" Jan thought. "Why did she ..." then he realized that he still looked like his sister.

"Oh, please I must apologize for looking like this." Jan told them as he stood up and connected with the computer ordering that the molecular mass-energy sequencing converter be initiated to revert him back to his stored DNA physical structure.

As a cylindrical beam formed around his body again and the lab’s equipment began to buzz, several of the laser cannons turned and focused on Jan. The two witches eyes went wide, and they backed off. Suddenly the lasers fired several short bursts and Jan felt for a moment like her body turned to jelly. There was a flash, and he had a nanosecond blackout before the sound and lights dissipated leaving him standing once again fully himself, a male, naked.

The witches gasped and seemed to be holding themselves back from bowing down as they whispered to each other.

"I thought she was from the coven getting an interim report."

“Her, ah ... his science is powerful, and he used it as a woman, but he is quite a man. He will definitely be a great asset to us, er ... our cause."

Jan had turned to grab a nearby lab coat (since he still had no clothes on) and didn't see them talk. When he came back around, he explained, "My sister had put a little spell on me and, a ... forgot to remove it when I teleported. We sort of play with each other this way." he added a bit embarrassed at having been tricked by his sister.

Seeing their expressions and now remembering what they said that Zed had done, Jan kicked himself knowing he probably just scared them by the powerful bio-electronic techno-physic demonstration of science over magic.

"Oh, I'm so sorry. I shouldn't have done that without explaining first. I didn't mean to frighten or offend you.” Jan rattled off until he needed a breath, then continued, “Is there anything I can do for you?"

The two looked at each other. Their eyes met and sparkled as just a hint of a smirk pulled at their mouths. When they turned back, they asked if Jan could help them reverse the treatment Zed had done on them. Perhaps allow them to work with Jan's computer to develop a process to break the science and let them regain respect for magic.

This struck Jan as not unlike what he would have proposed to do especially if no one had come up with a plan to return them to the coven. His natural good-heartedness would always be his greatest asset, and he instantly agreed to help just as realized he hadn't told them of the plan.

“Oh, I completely forgot. My sister is arranging for her coven to take you under their protection and to set a place and time where we will meet them. They will protect you until you can be reunited with yours." Jan blurted out before he again forgot to tell them. "Until then, anything you can tell the computer about specifics of Zed's techniques would help us battle him, and there's no reason that it can't be used to help you recover as well.”

The two thanked Jan profusely to the point at almost groveling at his feet. It made Jan feel very good that he could help, although their overreaction embarrassed him.

"Dinner call. Your mom is searching the house for you." the computer announced before Jan could initiate a proper planning methodology.

"I have go but will be back later when I find out where the transfer is to take place. Computer, work with these two to set a way to break them of science and institute pride for magic." Then turning back to warn them, "Be careful and don't overdo it. The lab has a self protection program and might react unintentionally if magic starts making things fly around the room." Jan smiled and winked at them, then rushed back out the secret door and headed to his room to get dressed before his mom got upset.

The two witches looked at each other amazed for a several seconds as smiles crept across their faces. Then they said simultaneously, "He will definitely make an excellent witch."

The first one then added, "Once we break and control him."

The other chimed in with, "And his lab will give us cover to subdue then rule all mad scientists."
1112322222211112211121.title: Reintroduction and helping the witches

choices: sitting in a bare room, pouting.
11123222222111122111211.content:
"Not advisable." replied the mechanical voice of the computer. "I am Max, built and programed to protect Juan Smith from any and all harm."

"Party popper!" said Luna, the first witch.

"Maybe we can reprogram the computer." suggested Vista.

In response to the suggestion, all of the equipment rose, lowered, and moved back into the walls, floors, and ceiling of the room, leaving an empty chamber. "You are welcome to try." replied the voice of Max.

Inside the house above, you entered the house via a secret door in the back of your walk in closet and walked out of your room, down the stairs, to the dinning room. There, Chris was already seated with the family, waiting for you.

"I'm pleased that you are dedicated to your studies, Jan." said dad, seriously. "However, it is also important to participate in family unit social gatherings. By maintaining contact with your parental units, you gain the benefit of your predecessors' triumphs and failures, not to mention..."

"Enough with the tech-talk, boys!." scolded mom, irritated. "Dinner conversation is to limited to terms and topics we can all follow and discuss, understand!?"

"Emotional, isn't she?" you asked.

"Since the day I first met her." replied dad, smiling.

"Intriguing. Did she think you'd make a better witch?"

Dad chuckled. "Her mother did. My father thought she would make a fine mad scientist."

"A perfect compatibility ." you said, now smiling yourself. "Perhaps that is why my sister and I get along so well."

Chris stuck her tongue out at you, winking as she did. You winked stuck your tongue out in return, causing mom to giggle slightly as she brought a large pot of soup to the table. "Careful, you two." she said. "If you act like toddlers too much, I just might make your bodies match your behavior."

"On a personal note, kids." said dad, looking at mom. "Your mother had, and still does have some great 'software'." he chuckled. "I know my 'hardware' reacts, every time."

Chris blushed brightly but dared not giggle, as you reacted in a similar manner. Mom merely shook her head, grinning. She knew why dad was talking the way he was and sighed. "Here we go again." she thought. then she said, "I just finished telling the kids to behave themselves and you start acting like a child, making a mockery of our usually very productive dinner conversation!" she sighed. "What ever am I to do with you!?"

Dad frowned. "I was not my intention to instigate inappropriate social behavior." he said, simply. "I was merely attempting to convey your unrivaled beauty in terms that..."

"In terms that would embarrass me." said mom with a sigh. "I believe you need to learn a lesson... young man."

With that, she waved her hand and dad transformed before yours and Chris' eyes. You watched in a mixture of horror and fascination as dad regressed back several years. "Honey, no!" cried dad in protest, his voice becoming very child like.

"You will be my husband again after a good nights rest in a crib." said mom, sternly.

Seconds later, dad had been reduced to a mere infant. Mom walked over and picked him up, shaking off his old clothing, before taking him to the counter where she conjured up a number of baby items. Concerned, Chris and you walked over.

"You really turned dad into an infant?" asked Chris.

Mom giggled. "Your father burned himself out a little due to over work." explained mom. "When he does that, he tends to get a little strange minded. When that happens, I return him to an age where he will be guaranteed a full stomach and a good nights rest." she grinned at you and Chris. "It's better than listening to his rambling all night."

You and Chris laughed.

After you were excused from the dinner table, you returned to your lab to find that your two guests were...
11123222222111122111211.title: Follow Jan to dinner.

Show them what Max knows about sorcery

111232222221111221112111.content:
While Juan and Christina were having a dinner discussion, Max, Luna and Vista were having their own talk on how to help the witches regain proper attitude respecting sorcery rather than science. When we left them, all the mad science equipment had taken protective cover by withdrawing into the walls behind shields.

"OK." "OK." said Luna then Vista.

"We were just joking like scientists do."

"But he did say for you to help us."

"Maybe we can help in how to do things."

"We just want to have a way to make ..."

"Science less important than magic."

"Oh, well," came Max's voice as the equipment retook its place in the lab. "We're programmed to be especially on guard for witch tricks. Not all witches are as friendly as his sister. Still she's always testing his science just like he tests her magic."

"And that's good for both of them."

"That's correct isn't it?" Vista added with a wink to Luna who hid her own smirk realizing that science can always be tricked using logic.

"That is correct." There's several seconds pause before Max adds, "I will help you create a system to break the hold mad science has on you - even though it pains me very much - and also instill great respect for sorcery although ..." There's a sound like a micro-earthquake has rattled all the equipment but it's just the equipment itself shuttering at the thought it just said.

Luna and Vista dance for glee. Immediately, the defense systems kick in and the laser guns swing around to aim at the two small witches.

"NO WITCH RITUALS!" Max booms, and the two girls run into each others arms.

"W-w-we're not d-doing anything l-like that."

"W-we are just h-happy."

"C-celebrating science's great ability to help."

"W-we still are limited until you help us."

"Oh." All defenses then stand down. "OK. Just normal reaction."

"Can you, maybe, ease the sensitivity a bit?"

"It makes science scary."

"Isn't that what's needed to help you get your respect for magic back?" Max asks with an electronic smirk of his own.

"I don't think that was Juan's plan."

"To make us fear science."

"We just need to not fear magic."

"And that means we have to do some and get use to it again."

"Very logical," Max offers. "I will do as Juan said."

There's several seconds of quiet, and the girls relax a bit unsure of what is happening.

"There. I have set the systems to allow you to practice limited magic. What would be a simple test to start your reintroduction?"

Luna and Vista turn to each other and smile. They then ask Max to ...
