choices: What were you doing in my room!?
I sensed a duel, who's here!?!
1113.content:
Now, on to your mischief. You entered the room, surprised to find it was ransacked and angered to find the person responsible was still there! It was a young woman, you estimated to be in her early twenties, with shoulder length light brown hair and piercing green eyes. The woman was frantically searching your sisters bedroom for something, pulling out drawers and dumping their contents onto the floor, before quickly and carefully going through the pile. Obviously, it had to have been very important for her to tear apart a little girl's room. Your mind set switched from a bratty sibling to a protective brother.

"Who does that woman think she is!?!" you thought, becoming enraged. "She's wrecking my sister's room!"

You immediately, silently returned yourself to normal, with your normal clothing, and summoned your tech wand to your hand so to face her. "Identify yourself immediately!" you declared.

The woman spun around, surprised, to find you with your wand ready. "Well, well, well." she said, placing her hands onto her hips. "The teenage witch has a mad scientist brother." she smiled. "A twin brother, no less, interesting."

"Identify or defend yourself!" you said, growing impatient. "You have no business inside my sister's bedroom!"

"Nor do you." countered the woman, smugly.

"I live here, you don't." you replied, calmly. "Last chance..."

You then quickly hit a small code of buttons on your wand without looking, showing the woman, if she knew about mad science, that you were not a novice at the dueling game. The woman saw the movement of your thumb and grinned.

"I am Helena Young." she said, finally, giving a slight bow. "I am searching for a certain 'artifact' that I need to save my sister, Eva Morgana, from an unjust imprisonment."

Unknown to you, Helena Young and Eva Morgana were rogues, or evil witches, stripped of their power and wanted by their fellow witches for crimes of cruelty. Of course, if you did know, you might not have cared, you were defending your sister's room and her honor.

"You could have asked her in private." you said, coolly. "Then again, I doubt she would not give it to the likes of you!"

Motioning with your wand, you said, "Get out!"

Helena eyed you coldly as she took a step towards the door, then suddenly threw an energy blast at you! Having faced such attacks from Chris, you saw it coming and dodged the attack. The blast kept going and reduced Chris' dresser to splinters, startling you. "This woman ain't kidding!" you thought.

Now knowing you were in a serious duel, you caused your wand to vanish and fired a heavy energy blast of your own, which Helena dodged, and your attack set fire to your sister's new wardrobe instead. "Your powers are surprisingly strong for someone your age!" hissed Helena, circling you. "You would make a fine witch."

"I'm comfortable being a boy, thank you." you said, circling her. "I repeat my demand, Get out!"

Helena sighed. "I tried to give you a chance." she said. "But now, I'm afraid that I will have to destroy you."

With that said, she fired a bolt of lighting in your direction. There was no time for you defect or dodge but, thanks to remote command to your lab, (the buttons you pushed on your wand) a shield was already in place to save you from harm but not from being thrown from Chris' room. You hit the wall hard, in the all, and slid to the floor, stunned, just as Chris rounded the corner.

"Jan!" she gasped....
1113.title: Your first real duel.

choices: She is gone (she failed to find the artifact)
11131.content:
Chris was shocked. She know what a magic energy blast would do, and from the way you're lying down, she knew that you was thrown from her room, and that she didn't have such protection in her room right now.

"There is a witch in there. I confronted her" you hiss in pain as you inject yourself with some painkillers. Slowly, you stagger to your feet, now free of the pain and fully mobile. "The witch said her name is Helena Young, and was looking for an artifact. Does that mean anything?"

Chris shakes her head. "No, but I'm glad you confronted her, Jan. I'll overlook you going into my room."

Smiling, you say, "You won't be too happy sis, your room is trashed. Helena is still inside, and she is a serious witch. It isn't like our fun"

Now angry, Chris wand in hand, heads into her room, wanting to get this woman out. You follow her, ready to help her.
11131.title: A you okay?

111311.content:
Now angry, Chris wand in hand, heads into her room, wanting to get this woman out. You follow her, ready to help her with your tech wand at hand. Helena was still there, tearing the bedroom apart, searching for the artifact she had mentioned. You could feel Chris' anger rising and you were happy it was not towards you.

"I don't 'care' who you are or 'what' you're looking for!" raged Chris, startling Helena. "Get out of our house!!"

Helena saw Chris, standing strongly near the door with her wand at the ready. She then saw you beside her with your tech wand in hand. Only you were approaching more cautiously, due to your first encounter with her. "You must be Chris." said Helena, smiling. "I'm looking for..."

"GET OUT!!" shouted Chris.

She then moved her wand in a quick circle before pushing it forward, sending an energy blast the size of a basket ball flying at the intruder. Helena let out a low scream of surprise before raising her hand, the energy blast struck a shield, sending her back a step. Chris was not holding back, as you did, which surprised you. Then, you saw the hand Helena raised, it had a familiar ring on each finger. Seeing the rings, Chris let out a low gasp as she recognized them.

"The Pharaoh's rings!" she whispered, fearfully. "You... You're a 'rogue' witch!"

Helena giggled. "Very clever, girl." she said. "Now you have a better idea of what I want." she rose her hand. "I know you have the last ring, GIVE IT TO ME!!"

Chris took a single step back, gripping something under her blouse, whispering, "Never!"

You remembered Chris was given a special gift on her thirteenth birthday from an old friend of the family. You and Chris only new her as Ms H. The present was a ring on a necklace, the very ring Helena was after.

Helena began to turn red with impatience. "Give me the ring or..."

That was when you had heard enough and caused your own wand to vanish again and hit Helena with an energy blast, throwing her off her feet. She was too preoccupied with your sister to sense it coming but she was up in the next breath, clearly angry with you and her both.

"Have it your way!" she hissed.

She fired a second round of lighting at you only, this time, you were ready for it and defected the blast with a wave of your hand before firing in return. Chris joined in the fight immediately after, firing energy blasts and spells. You then threw in a few 'events', or technological spells into the fight to force Helena to leave. Only she was determined and difficult to keep up with. Unknown to you, she was having a difficult time, fighting against you and your sister as well. Meanwhile, Chris' room was getting completely destroyed.

"I'll have to get my robots to rebuild her room as soon as this is over." you thought. "Mom and dad will freak if they see it like it is now and our secret will be exposed." you paused, then thought, "Or are we just kidding ourselves?"

Both you and Chris were quickly becoming exhausted, neither of you had fought so intensely for so long and you began to worry. Then, for some unknown reason, Helena broke off her attack and vanished from the room.

"This is far from over, brats!" her voice screamed. then, she was gone.

Breathing heavily from the fight, you and Chris slumped against one wall and slid to the floor, happy that you had managed to fight her off, at least for now. "She'll be back, Jan." said Chris, panting. "There are ten of those rings in all, any woman who can assemble them all will be granted incredible magic power."

"It doesn't work on guys?" you asked, curious.

"They will grant a man protection from magic but not the use of it." replied Chris. "The point is, that Helena is a rogue or criminal witch. Rogues are stripped of all their power so not to cause evil again, the Pharaoh's rings will not increase a witch's power but they will restore power to a witch who had lost it."

"So, this Helena and her sister Eva are after to regain their full magical strength." you mused. "Once they achieve that, they will have the power to seek revenge upon those who had incarcerated them."

Chris nodded. "Ms H made me promise to always keep this necklace with me." she said. "I have kept that promise." she then began to tear up. "But if I keep it around my neck with that Helena after it..."

"You'll become a target." you said.

"I'm scared, Jan." said Chris, honestly. "Any suggestions?"
111311.title: The Pharaoh's Rings.

1113111.content:
After sending your robots into Chris' room to restore it to its original state, you returned to your laboratory and set up a secure line to your mom's friend, you only knew as Ms H. Only, you decided to be extra cautious as you did not know how much power this 'rogue' witch, Helena Young had. You sent your call through fifteen different satellites and four ground relay stations before allowing it to reach Ms H's home to make it near impossible to trace or listen in. Eight rings later, Ms H answered the telephone. Unknown to you, her son, John, was a chaotic scientist, an evolved form of your mad science, and had gotten into an argument with her eldest daughter, Hayley over a magical prank. It was not a good time for you to call.

"Hello." said Ms H, sounding drained.

You winced, hearing Jon and Hayley arguing in the background. "What happened to your sense of humor!?!" asked Hayley, sounding upset. "You will return to normal when its over!"

"I don't remember you seeing a period as funny!" John fired back. "I have half a mind to make you a boy until this is over!"

"How was I supposed to know it was your time of the month!" yelled Hayley. "Boys go though a similar cycle you know!"

"That's enough!" yelled Ms H, away from the phone. "Don't get me involved, you won't like it!" her voice then returned to the phone. "Please make this brief." she said. "I'm having a bad day."

You cleared your throat, quickly organizing your thoughts. "This is Juan Smith." you said, introducing yourself. "Son of Elvira Smith, my sister, Chris is in trouble, I need your advice."

There was a slight pause before Ms H spoke. "How is your sister in trouble?" she asked, carefully. "Did you have anything to do with it?"

"No, nothing of my doing." you replied, honestly. "A woman, a rogue witch, calling herself Helena Young, appeared in our house a few minutes ago, Chris and I managed to fight her off."

"I see." replied Ms H, quietly. "Do you know why she invaded your home?"

"Helena is after an artifact Chris called the Pharaoh's Rings." you replied. "She claimed to have them all but one, the one you gave her on a necklace as a thirteenth birthday present."

There was another, slightly longer pause. you guessed she was looking out a window as your mom did when she was thinking hard. Finally, Ms H spoke. "Jan, I need you to listen to me very carefully." she said, seriously. "Helena must 'never' be allowed to obtain that ring! She will be back to try again."

"Please, Ms H." you begged. "I don't know this witch. Is there anything you can tell me about her? If I am going to protect my sister, I 'need' to know exactly who I am up against."

You did not mean to press Ms H, who you guessed was a powerful witch, but you knew nothing of other witches and this Helena was serious business. You had an idea of her fighting style, after fighting her twice, but she nearly defeated you and your sister combined. You needed to find an edge.

Finally, Ms H sighed.

What did she say?
1113111.title: You call Ms H.

choices: Its time mom and dad know about you
11131112.content:
The woman who you know as Mrs H, sighs again. "Listen to me very carefully. Helena is bad news. She is extremely spiteful, and single minded to whatever task she has put her mind to. It means little to her that she is targeted by all other witches"

"A nasty, vengeful witch hunted by other witches? Great" you think to yourself.

"My sister and I was nearly defeated by her. I need to know a weakness" you say, worried.

"Helena's pride and determination is her waekness. From what you tell me, she will have two objectives. The first is to gain control of the Pharaoh's ring not in her posession"

"What is her second object?" you say, fearing that you and Chris is it.

"I'm afraid a witch being defeated by any sort of boy is a major source of embrassment for a witch. She's certain to come after you"

"Kill me?" you say, gulping.

"Unlikely. Helena's crimes are mostly cruelity based. True, she could torture you to death, but I don't think its her style. Did she offer you witch training?"

"Yes. I refused. I like my life as it is."

"She will probably defend her 'honor' by going after you, or getting someone to do her dirty work" Mrs H warns.

"Nice" you mutter, as the conversation ends. Thinking qiick, you decide you need help from your family now
11131112.title: Listen to me very carefully.

111311122.content:
"Confession is good for the soul, so I've heard." thought Jan, walking towards the living room. "Still, after a year of keeping our powers secret from mom and dad, I'm sure they will freak." you swallowed hard. "Especially when they find out my sister and I pissed of a rogue witch."

You stepped into the living room with your heart in your throat and turned off the television that mom and dad were watching together and stood before them with your hands behind your back. "I am truly sorry for the intrusion, mom and dad." you said, politely. "I must have a serious talk with you about a secret Chris and I have been guarding for the past year."

Mom and Dad turned to each other, worried, then turned back to you. "What is this secret, Jan?" asked dad, concerned.

"How am I going to tell them?" you thought. "If I just blurt out the truth, they might not believe me without seeing a demonstration of my power."

"Jan?" asked mom, turning serious. "Your father asked you a question."

"Chris and I developed... certain powers on our thirteenth birthday." you said. "We had been training each other in private, through friendly duels and reasonably harmless pranks."

"You're not making much sense, son." said dad, looking confused. "What is this power you and your sister claim to have developed and are training in?"

"I'm a mad scientist." you replied, becoming annoyed. "My sister, Chris is a witch. Want proof?... Here!"

You then hit the television behind you with an 'event' and it immediately transformed into a robot. "And now the news!" it said in a robotic voice. "Helena Young has attacked the home of Jan and Chris Smith, searching for the last piece of the powerful Pharaoh's rings! She was successfully fought off by the children's brave efforts but she had promised to return."

The robot then transformed back into a television set as mom and dad gaped at you in complete shock. Finally, mom rose to her feet and began to look you over carefully, as if she was looking for something.

"What are you doing, mom?" you asked. "This is not a joke!"

Mom hushed you quiet and continued, checking every scratch and bruise you had, causing you to blush. Once she was done, she turned to dad and nodded. "He's fine." she said.

Dad nodded back and slowly rose to his feet. "Son, we knew of yours and Chris' powers from the day you were born." he told you. "I am a mad scientist as well, your mother is a witch. We merely allowed you two to train each other as you are so competitive."

You opened your mouth to say something but dad silenced you with a wave of his hand. "We will explain everything to you and Chris as you need to know." he promised. "Right now, we need you to place your games aside for the time being and focus on protecting each other. Helena Young is a stubborn woman, she will not give up easily."

"I expect you and your sister to stay alert, young man." said mom. "I have tangled with Helena before, she likes to use friends and loved ones to get what she wants."

You gaped, thinking of your best friends, Hank and Sarah, and quickly ran from the room to warn them. Your friends knew about yours and Chris' powers and they were okay with them but neither of them had any power of their own. What was worse, was that Hank often spent much time at home alone.

"If that Helena discovers that Hank and Sarah are close to us..."

You dared not think of the consequences as you rushed into your laboratory and quickly set up your secure line. "Who do I call first?" you thought. "Both will certainly freak but..."

Who do you decide to call first?
111311122.title: Confessions

1113111222.content:
You decided to call Sarah first as Hank usually lived with her when his parents were away, traveling. Two rings later, Sarah answered. "Hello?"

"Sarah, this is Jan." you said. "Please tell me that Hank is there with you."

There was a short pause. "He's here." replied Sarah. "You sound upset, did something happen?"

"It will be easier if I talk to you two at the same time." you told her. "Can you come over, like now?"

"Sure." said Sarah, sounding concerned. "Is it bad?"

You gulped, the sound reached her and you could hear her breath quickening. "It's bad." you told her. "I'm hoping to prevent it from becoming worse."

"We're on our way over." said Sarah. "Did... Did your mom and dad find out?"

You paused. "Chris and I will tell you everything when you arrive."you then hung up and whispered. "Please hurry."

Then, one of your robots approached you with a strange item in his metallic hand. "Master Jan, this was found on the floor in Chris' bedroom during reconstruction." it reported, flatly. "It does not carry the energy signature of any family member or friend."

You thanked the robot and it walked away as you studied the strange artifact. Obviously, it belonged to Helena Young and was dropped in the fight you and Chris had with her. It was small, a clear crystal, secured in a three wooden prong on a short staff, about six inches long.

"Curious." you said. "It looks like one of those magic wands I have seen in many a fantasy movie Chris loves to watch." you paused, looking at its seemingly simple form. "I wonder what this artifact does."

Knowing that Chris would better be able to determine what its function was, you moved to carefully place the artifact onto the desk. Only, in doing so, you must have accidentally triggered it and there was a bright flash emitted from the crystal, blinding you. When your eyesight returned to you found yourself...
1113111222.title: Sarah

11131112221.content:
Chris let out a short scream of surprise as you suddenly appeared inside her bedroom but before she could get annoyed with you for not knocking, you showed her the obviously magical item.

"One of my robots found this while reconstructing your room." you said, quickly. "I accidentally triggered it." you paused. "I guess we now know how Helena got inside the house without anyone seeing her."

Chris examined the artifact carefully before letting out a low sigh. "You're very lucky you did not end up inside 'her' home." she scolded. "How many times did I tell you to be careful when handling magical artifacts?"

"All I did was set it down." you fired back. "I was careful about too."

Chris sighed, calming down. "I'm just worried, that's all." she said. "I consulted with a fellow witch and good friend of mine at school, Amy Holloway, she told me that Helena Young is...."

"An extremely spiteful and single minded witch." you finished. "I just got off the telephone with Ms H, she advised that i reveal our 'secret' to mom and dad."

"Did you?" asked Chris.

You nodded, blushing. "It turns out our secret was not so secret, mom is a witch and dad is a mad scientist." you replied ruefully. "They have been watching us 'play' as it allowed us to train without feeling pressured."

"Only the game is over." said Chris. "This is as real as it gets."

Then, you heard the door bell sound. "That must be Sarah and Hank." you said. "I called them over."

Chris nodded. "Amy told me that Helena likes to use friends and loved ones to get to her target." she said.

You and Chris ran for the door and were relieved to find Sarah and Hank had arrived without incident. "Hey, guys?" said Hank, concerned. "Sarah said you sounded upset over the phone."

You swallowed. "We were attacked by a criminal witch." you replied. "She's after Chris' ring."

Hank and Sarah turned pale. "Are you alright, Chris?" asked Hank. "Did this criminal witch hurt you?"

"Did you fight her off, Jan?" asked Sarah. "Was she tough to beat?"

You and Chris told Sarah and Hank what had happened and what you had discovered before telling them to be alert for anything out of the ordinary. "You both have the ability to detect magic, having magic used against you." said Chris, seriously. "If you detect magic in anyone near you, stay on your guard., witches can make themselves look like anyone of any age."

"I'll cook up some gadgets to help you two defend yourselves, if necessary." you added.

"Do you think this Helena will really target us or our family?" asked Sarah, worried.

"We would be arrogant to think that she won't." you replied. "We can't take anything for granted."

Seeing that both Hank and Sarah were rattled, Chris suggested, "Why don't we all go the mall to unwind."

"I'm not sure." said Sarah, shivering.

"Look, I doubt that this Helena would attack anyone in a public place." said Hank, hiding his own fear. "We should be fine as long as we are not separated at any given time."

Sarah, although still shaken, turned to Chris, who smiled. You caught on to her smile and moaned. "Did you have to give them ideas, Hank?" you asked, irritated.

Hank looked at you, confused, then caught Sarah and Chris' grins and turned pale. "Oh, no!, No way!" he said, backing away in protest. "I will not get roped up in a 'girls only' outing! Not this time!"

Chris giggled. "What do you say about this, Jan?" she asked, playfully. "So far, its a two to one vote."

You sighed, then turned to Hank. "I can't let you take him alone." you said, ruefully. "I'll play along, for now."

"Jan, are you nuts!?" asked Hank, feeling his body changing. "You know we'll end up getting make overs and a new wardrobe and..."

"You really should stop giving them ideas, Hank." you said, annoyed, changing yourself into a girl. "I can change myself back, when I get sick of this, you can't."

Hank, realizing that you were right, snapped his mouth shut as Chris then changed his clothes to a skirt and tube top as Sarah giggled at 'her' new look. "You make a cute girl,... Hannah." she said, smiling. she turned to you. "So do you, Jane, thanks for playing along."

You managed a weak smile. "We're all rattled over this rogue witch being after us." you said. "A little down time will help us all to think clearly and formulate a plan to deal with her."

Twenty minutes later, you were all dropped off at the mall by mom who showed you her cellphone. "Call me the instant you sense that Helena is around and I will come get you." she said. "Do not try to take her on, understand?"

With that, she left and you entered the mall with Chris, Sarah, and 'Hannah'.
11131112221.title: In Chris' bedroom.

111311122211.content:
Walking into the mall, Hannah saw two teenage boys playing the air hockey table at the arcade. She smiled and began to walk over to them but Sarah and Chris caught her before she got too far and dragged her away, towards the dress shop.

"You can play with the boys later... Hannah." giggled Chris. "Right now, we are going to show you a girls' world."

"Oh, lucky me." said Hannah, sarcastically.

"It was your suggestion." said Chris and Sarah in unison.

"I tried to warn you." you said, grinning. "We are about to face a new experience."

Chris and Sarah giggled as they dragged Hannah into the dress shop with you following. Inside, a friendly young sales clerk with long, honey blond hair approached them. Her name tag stated, 'Lucy'. "May I help you, ladies?" she asked.

"These are my cousins from out of town, Jane and Hannah." said Chris, smiling. "Their luggage was lost and they need a small wardrobe to get them through the week."

"In that case, we had better get to work." said Lucy. "Do you girls know your sizes?"

To Chris' surprise, you rambled off what she had guessed were yours and Hannah's clothing measurements to which Lucy gave a curious grin. "That saves a lot of time." she said. "This way, please."

The four of you followed Lucy through the store as she pointed out the many different styles of clothing, starting with the undergarments to which Hannah blushed brightly seeing. You, however, were a trained scientist, such things did not cause you to blush unless a girl was actually modeling them in front of you.

"Which do you think will suit you and Hannah best?" asked Sarah, smiling. "The tomboy look or the girly girl way?"

You turned to Hannah and smiled, seeing her cringe slightly. "Hannah has always been a tomboy." you said to her relief. only that relief died when you added, "She really needs to loosen up though, I'll let you two decide."

"Jane...!" hissed Hannah, quietly.

Lucy giggled. "I take it that Hannah is not used to dresses or skirts either." she said, eying her.

Hannah blushed more brightly. "I'm used to jeans and shorts." she said, honestly. "I'm a country kind of gal."

Sarah and Chris laughed as Lucy placed a hand onto her shoulder. "Even country girls let their hair down once and a while, Hannah." she said. "Why don't you try a dress on, just to see how it looks on you. If you like it, the cost of the dress is on me, if you don't like it, I won't pressure you any further."

What does Hannah say?...
111311122211.title: Shopping fun.

1113111222111.content:
Feeling trapped, Hannah reluctantly agreed and was given a pink strapless party dress with a peach sash that Lucy said would accent her features. "Try it on." she said. "You have nothing to lose."

"Fine." said Hannah, rolling her eyes. "I'll try it on."

Lucy then turned to you, holding up a peach strapless dress with a pink sash. "This dress would look stunning on you." she said, grinning. "Care to try it on?"

You smiled at her, politely. "Why not?" you asked, accepting the dress. "I'll be back in a few minutes."

As you walked into the changing room, Lucy quickly closed the shop as there were no other customers, then turned to Chris and Sarah. "I thought you'd never convince your brother and his friend to try the girl experience in the open, Chris." she whispered, smiling. "What did you do to make them agree to this?"

Chris giggled. "I wish I could take credit for it, Lucy." she replied. "Actually Jan and I had a bad encounter with a rogue witch named Helena Young." she frowned. "She's after the ring Ms H gave me for my birthday last year."

Lucy paled slightly. "I see..." she said. "So Hank and Jan are girls because..."

"We needed to get Hank out of the house as we were warned that Helena may target him to get us to surrender the ring." explained Chris. "Only we had to be fair and Jan agreed to the change to comfort 'Hannah'."

Lucy nodded. "Changing Hank's identity will buy you some time." she told her. "Jan can protect himself with his science but I suggest you relocate 'Hannah' and Sarah as soon as possible."

"But where?" asked Chris.

The three girls stopped talking as Hannah stepped out of the changing room, wearing the dress. She blushed brightly as Sarah and Chris giggled. "You look amazing, Hannah." said Chris, smiling.

"What do you think about the dress?" asked Lucy.

Hannah sighed, still blushing, "I like it, I guess." she said to the girls' giggles. "It's cute."

Just then, you stepped out of the changing room, modeling the dress Lucy gave you to try on. "How do I look, sis?" you asked Chris. "Do you think mom will recognize me?"

Chris giggled. "She would but I doubt you'd be back into jeans any time soon if she saw you." she replied. "You know how she would love for us to be true twins for a while."

You giggled at that but it died in your throat as you looked out the store window....

Who did you see?
1113111222111.title: She reluctantly agrees.

choices: Good. They came to protect the group from the rouge witches and evil scientists.
Bad. They came to either recruit the group or defeat them without mercy.
111311122212.content: You, Sarah, Chris, and Hank all enter the mall. "Okay "girls" lets go shopping! But before we do that, lets get a bite to eat. Pizza sound good everyone, its on me." Chris offers. You all agree and head to the food court. You, Hank, and Sarah find a table while Chris orders and buys the food and drinks. However, you feel a strange sensation. The next instant, you and Hank are reverted back to your male forms. "What the! Jan, what's going on?" Sarah exclaims. "I don't know. Something must be interfering with the gender manipulation beam. All of a sudden, the large glass awning above you shatters, and three figures land on the ground. When the smoke clears, you instantly recognize them. "Amazing! It's the Three Greats, a famous group of mad scientists that are know for their unique abilities and traits." You say in awe. Chris, who just got back with lunch had no idea what was going on and thus asked you this question, " Who is whom?" "That teenager is Thornton Escher, the direct descendant of the famous surrealism artist, M. C. Escher, who happened to be a innovator in the arts of mad science. Thornton can alter reality and move freely between parallel universes. Although he is young, he has developed a way to revert any being or object back to their original form. He is also know to love shape shifting into a fox, as well as using his ancestors paintings as inspiration for his inventions and traps. That tall, thin man with the electrified tubes attached to those gauntlets he wears is Donald Tesla. He has battled a coven of 20 witches at once with nothing but his wit and his lightning based weapons. He was the one who perfected free wireless transmission, the same goal his ancestor Nikolai Tesla tried to achieve. The third and final one is Fibonacci Da Vinci, the blood relative of Leonardo Da Vinci. He has engineered countless devices of all kinds, including a bat wing based flying pack, a gun that can fire any kind of ammunition, and has created perpetual energy as a back-up supply for all mad scientists. They each are genius in there own respective ways. But what are they doing here?" You wonder out loud. What are their intentions?
111311122212.title: Escher, Tesla, Vinci, oh my!

11131112222.content:
You blinked, looking around, to find yourself in a large Victorian style living room with a number of statues standing against the walls. What chilled you was that they were all young girls. not daring to make a sound, you looked at the statues and found that they all carried a fearful expression. "They're still alive!" you thought, horrified. "This Helena is a monster!"

You lightly placed your hand onto the head of one statue and stared into her dead eyes, using your own powers to find a way to free her. Fortunately, the girl was not turned to stone, merely surrounded by it as her body was held in a magically induced waking coma. She was aware of everything around her, just unable to move or respond in any way.

"Hang on." you whispered. "I'll have you free in a minute."

"That would not be wise." replied a feminine voice.

You spun around, startled, to find a tall and slender woman in a long black dress. She had red hair and fiery hazel eyes, which were glaring at you with impatience. "You are not Helena Young." you said. "Who are you!?"

The woman's eyes widened slightly. "How do you know that woman?" she demanded. "Also, how and why have you trespassed into my home!?"

You held your ground. "I am Juan Smith, mad scientist." you replied. "Helena Young trespassed and attacked my home, my sister and I managed to fight her off." you then showed the woman the artifact your robots had found in Chris' room. "My intention was follow her with this artifact she left behind and return the favor.... your turn."

For a moment, the woman did not answer but, slowly, a smile formed on her face as she let out a low and evil giggle that sent a chill down your spine. "I am Lilly Sweetie." she said, finally. "That artifact is called a travel wand, it belongs to me, Helena stole it."

"So you 'programed' this device to teleport the person to you when it was used next." you guessed correctly.

Lilly nodded."Only I was expecting it to bring me Helena." she said. "Instead, it brings you, a boy who defeated a witch." she giggled again. "This is truly amusing."

"What of these children you have imprisoned in stone?" you demanded. "Why have you done this to them?"

Lilly smiled. "Some of them were would be robbers or rapists." she replied. "A few of them are boys and girls who have arrogantly entered, unannounced. They'll be restored and released after a while to teach them to knock before wandering into someone's home. Lastly, a handful are boys or girls who have been injured, the surrounding stone is slowly healing them." she paused. "I wonder which category you fit in."

"Neither, my appearance here was not intentional or malicious." you replied, flatly. "To prove my sincerity, I offer the artifact that was stolen from you as a gesture of good will."

Lilly accepted the wand then replied....
11131112222.title: Home of Lilly Sweetie.

choices: Very well, then fires a spell at you
What will get you to trust me?
111311122222.content:
"What was Helena after?" Lilly asks.

You don't answer. The 'stone' girls completely freak you out, and while you'd heard that a 'stone epoxy' can have healing powers, you doubt it really exists. Plus you notice the girls are arranged more by what they're wearing. Some have big poofy dresses, almost Victorian in style, to others dressed in school uniforms of various styles, to a couple wearing bikinis. Most look horrified, telling you that most of Lilly's visitors are guys.

"Why should I trust you?" you say evenly.

Lilly's eyes not leave you. Sighing evenly, she says
111311122222.title: Trust issues

1113111222221.content:
You saw Lilly raise her hand and quickly threw up your defenses. Only, as you understood you were the intruder, you kept only on the defensive and canceled what ever spell she had thrown at you, or so you thought.

"Now, tell me." demanded Lilly. "What was Helena Young after."

"The last piece of the Pharaoh's Rings." you replied before slapping your hand over your mouth.

Lilly frowned. "That's not good." she said. "If Helena regains her power and frees her sister, Eva..." she turned to you. "Who has the last ring?"

"My sister." you replied, still under some spell. "Christina Smith."

After saying that, you shivered slightly then threw your fists to the side as the room shook slightly as you finally countered the spell, freeing yourself from its effects. "What did you do to me!?" you demanded, more embarrassed than frightened or angry. "My sister might try that!"

Lilly laughed. "Your defenses against aggressive magic is impressive, young man." she said. "However, like science, magic takes on many forms. I used a passive spell of which you had no defense. My spell forced you to tell the truth so to get the answer I wanted." she then shook her head, sighing. "I could have done far worse."

You sighed, eying the statues. "So what now?" you asked, wondering how to defend yourself. "Are you going to try to add me to your collection?"

Lilly grinned. "I had considered it, you would make fine bait for Helena." she replied. "However, she is after that ring your sister holds in her possession. You'd serve better to keep her away from that."

You again eyed the statues, causing Lilly to sigh. "Your concern for them is admirable." she told you. "However, you know nothing of the circumstances that surround each person. I assure you I am carefully watched, I do not need nor want another pair of eyes on me."

"What are my chances if I take on Helena Young alone?" you asked.

"Not good, child." replied Lilly. "She may be at a great disadvantage, having to rely on magical rings to regain her power, but she is a combat veteran from the dark war." she sighed. "She and Eva never could let a grudge down and they have a depressingly long list."

"The dark war?" you asked, slowly.

Lilly nodded. "The name we gave the war between Mad Scientists and Witches." she said, patiently. "Now then, I am giving you one and only one chance to leave here, still a boy. I suggest you take it and remove all thoughts of engaging Helena Young on your own!" she turned, walking away as she added, "There are worse things magic can do than 'turn you to stone'."

Not wasting a second, you took up your communicator. "Lab, emergency beam back!"

Lilly turned back, just as you vanished, then picked up a telephone and dialed a number. "Samantha, this is Lilly." she said into the phone. "We have a problem..."

Seconds later, you were back inside your laboratory, wondering what to do.

The following morning, you are called down to greet a visitor. Curious and on guard, you came down the stairs to face a rather unhappy looking person. It was....
1113111222221.title: Many forms of magic.

choices: what Helena can do to you.
11131112222211.content:
You walked down the stairs to meet a tall, slightly elderly woman in a long black dress. She had long black hair and deep, piercing green eyes that seemed to see into my very being. From the looks I was getting from mom and dad, this was a very powerful witch.

"Jan, this is Elvira Strange, the head witch." said mom, introducing your visitor. "What have you done to warrant her visit to our home, young man!?"

"Easy, El." said Elvira, calmly. "I am here, not to serve a punishment, but to issue a friendly warning."

Dad turned to me, annoyed. "You went after her, didn't you?" he asked. "We warned you not to!"

"Enough!" barked Elvira, sternly. "The only crime young Juan is guilty of is untrained use of a magical artifact." she then turned her sharp eyes onto you. "You were very fortunate that Lilly had placed a return spell on that travel wand."

"Lilly has a number of transformed boys in her home." you fired back. "They are being held in stone epoxy."

"I am well aware of Lilly Sweetie's actions, young man." replied Elvira. "Please do not change the subject, you're very smart and destined to be a powerful scientist." she paused, sighing. "However, you are not yet strong enough to combat Helena alone."

"I have to try!" you said, protesting. "She is threating my sister!"

Without warning, Elvira sent a energy blast in your direction. you were able to put up your shield but the blast threw you off your feet and into a chair several feet behind you. Elvira then waved a single finger, causing the arms of the chair to come to life and hold you in place. You struggled but in vain as Elvira then came up to you, frowning.

"If you can not defend yourself from that simple attack and bondage spell before the next attack comes, you have no chance of winning." she said, gravely. "Helena is as evil as they come, she will resort to any means to permanently seal your fate as a girl or worse if you go after her as weak as you are."

That angered you and you began to furiously fight against the chair. When you found that was useless, you glared at Elvira, breathing heavily. "What do you expect me to do, witch!?" you asked, angrily. "Roll over and let her take what she wants!?" you shook your head. "I think not!"

Elvira sighed, hiding her impatience as, behind her mom and dad both turned slightly pale. You turned slightly pale yourself, realizing your mistake of acting out of anger but it was too late to take your words back. Elvira shook her head.

"Young man, I think you need to see first hand..."
11131112222211.title: Elvira Strange, head witch.

choices: Elvira decides that you've got the message

12123121.content: Chris used an event to make herself old enough to be Jan's mother. You diapered your new daughter, gave her a kiss, and said "How long does this potion last anyway?" "Janet" replied "Thwe pwotion woks fwor won week." "Well than I hope you like being a little baby girl for a while then." Christy started undoing her bra and said "It's time for your first feeding." Janet knew this was coming because when she was a baby she was still nursing until she was 2 and 1/2. "Ywes momma." She started sucking on her "mothers" breasts for feeding.
12123121.title: Such a little baby

choices: Hide and wait for your bother
Find your brother waiting for you.
122.content:
You are in a secret room, tucked away behind a false wall in the attic of your house. You are giggling to yourself as you prepare a magic brew. You throw a number of strange items into a small cauldron and mumble a few magic words. A cloud of pink smoke shoots up from it and the dark water turns a pretty pink color. You then giggle again as you take a small amount of the magic brew and carefully pour it into a vial you had stolen from your brother's 'secret' laboratory.

You intend to use the magic brew to turn yourself into a small white rat and wreck havoc in his lab, just to drive him crazy. You make the magic brew so you will have your original strength and speed, just in a much smaller package.

"There will be risks, of course." you say to yourself. "He is a mad scientist. He could, in theory, somehow catch me and run a number of cruel or unusual experiments on me while I am his prisoner."

You smile to yourself. "But without risk, there is no fun!"

You take the magic brew then vanish from your secret room and reappear inside the basement where you use your magic to make the hidden door open ajar. You then drink the potion and watch the changes occur.

Your body becomes very furry as your human ears vanish and are replaced with mouse ears on your head. Then, a long pink tail grows outward from your tail bone and your hand and feet morph into padded mouse feet. Your face changes, becoming mouse like with whiskers growing out from your now elongated nose as your eyes turn from blue to pink. Finally, your clothing vanishes and you shrink down to the size of a small mouse, finishing the transformation.

"It worked!" you squeak to yourself. "Now, to pay my brother a friendly visit."
122.title: Witchcraft.

choices: He becomes a 14 year old cheer leader.
He becomes a 3 year old girl.
1221.content:
Jan's laboratory was extensive, as was her lair, only most of you lair existed in a much different place than home. The hidden room in the attic was but a magical entrance to that lair and only you knew where it was located.

You scurried passed the countless of stations, housing high tech gadgets and machines. There was a weight sensor alarm on the entire floor, which the light weight of a lab rat would not trigger. He had set it up to prevent you from wrecking havoc in his precious 'inner sanctum'.

"I guess Jan never expected me to change myself into something like this." you thought. you giggled to herself. "The look on his face is going to be priceless!"

You soon reached a small work bench station roughly ten meters in, where you knew Jan was working on something new, then climbed your way up, onto the work bench and found yourself a place to hide and wait. You did not have long to wait as Jan soon entered his laboratory and came to the work station to go over his notes.

"This is perfect!" you thought, trying not to laugh. "He doesn't have a clue!"

You then quickly revealed herself, yelling, "SURPRISE, BRO!" then cast a spell onto your startled brother.

How does Jan change?
1221.title: Ambush!

12211.content:
"You are going to be the newest cheerleader on the squad!" you said with a gin.

"What!?!" asked Jan, feeling the need to vomit. "Mom and dad will find out if you do that!"

"Not if I magically change reality so they think you were always my twin sister...., Janet." you replied, giggling. "It will only be for two or three days and I'm sure you'll get me back somehow, but seeing you squirm for a while will make it well worth it!" you giggled again as Jan tried, unsuccessfully, to break free from your immobilization spell. "I wonder, should I make your transformation fast and get it over with or make it real slow, so you can beg for mercy?"

What did you decide?
12211.title: Change his clothing first

122111.content:
Suddenly his sneakers started to change, becoming a pair of pink trainers made for a female cheerleader. You saw Jan wince in distaste and giggled, knowing that he hated the color pink with a passion.

"What the hell are you doing to my clothes!?!" Juan shouted towards you.

''I already told you." you said. "I am going to transform you into a girly little cheer leader, bro. I am starting by changing your clothing, your sneakers are first." you then laughed as he moaned. "I told you I'd make you pay for what you did to me last week with your mad experiments!''

"Hey, your hair grew back in less than a day!" protested Jan, annoyed. "why are you making me be a cheer leader for two or three days!?!"

Jan's sneakers started to change more, flowers and your school logo appeared on it as a finishing touch as you turned to him, angrily.

"It was picture day, Jan!" you shouted. "I got scolded by just about every teacher for not being there!" you started to tear up as you saw, from Jan's expression, he was realizing his mistake. "You humiliated me and now, it's my turn!"

"Everybody will laugh at me when they see me like this!'' protested Jan, desperately. "Can't we cut a deal?"

"That is your own problem, brother!'' you raged. "If you want to make a deal, make it a good one, otherwise... go team!"

Then, Jan felt another article of clothing changing, his time was quickly running out.

What was changing?
122111.title: slow

1221112.content:
"I want to enjoy this, Jan." you said, grinning. "You can start offering me a deal or beg me to spare your manhood any time you like!"

Jan began to stammer off a number of ideas but none of them came close to the degree of punishment you wanted to dish out and you refused them all. "Come now, brother, dear." you told him, smiling wickedly. "You have such a brilliant mind, surely you can come up with something worthy of my attention."

Of course, you had every intention of having him cheer on the football team at your school tomorrow but that was as far as you were willing to take it, in case your mother or father were a witch or mad scientist. You did not want to be accused of starting a magical/technological war inside the house. However, if Jan managed to come up with a better punishment for your humiliation, you would give it some thought. Only, to your delight, Jan was unable to come up with anything you found interesting that he was willing to endure.

"Your time is up, Jan." you said. "It's time for you to continue your journey to womanhood."

"No!" yelled Jan, desperately. "Just give me a minute to think!"

You smiled. "Think all you want, Jan." you replied. "You have until I change your gender to come up with something worthy of my attention. For now, let's change your socks next."

Will Jan's socks be the knee highs or the simple ankle socks?
1221112.title: You move on to his socks.

choices: No, I have a better idea.
12211121.content:
"I'll go with the ankle socks." you said, grinning. "So the boys can see more of your 'sexy' legs!"

You waved your hand again and Jan's socks reduced to ankle highs and turned pink, matching his new shoes, which you were certain were already hurting his feet.

"Wait a minute!" said Jan, becoming panicked. "I have a suggestion!"

"Go on." you said, tapping your foot. "I'm listening but it had better be good or I'll move on to your panties!"

Jan took a deep breath. "I will agree to go to the cheer leading tryouts as a cousin, visiting for the school year." he said, desperate. "Jan will be off, visiting our 'cousins' family out west. I give my word to do my best to earn a spot on the squad."

"What will you do if you make the cut?" you asked.

Jan gulped. "If I make the squad, I'll stay on for the remainder of the school year, one month." he said. "that will make us even, considering the social image damage you faced on top of the humiliation." he paused. "But if I do not make it, the matter will be closed and I remain my original gender."

You thought about it for a moment then smiled before you said.
12211121.title: Jan offers a deal.

122111212.content:
You thought about it for a moment then smiled before you said, "Nah, I have a better idea!"

With that said, you waved your hand and quickly completed his clothing transformation. He was now wearing a full cheer leader uniform, complete with panties and training bra. Jan tried to pull it off but you had magically locked it onto him for the moment and then changed his gender.

"This is going to be fun!" you thought. "Plus, Jan will learn what humiliation is all about!"

You made the transformation so sudden that Jan did not feel it, thus had no idea he was now a girl until he started to move. "Ga!" he screamed. "This isn't funny, Chris! Change me back!"

You shook your head. "Sorry, Jan." you said. "I have already cast a reality spell on the entire school, making them all think you were always my twin sister, Janet."

Jan sighed. "So, what's the deal?" he, now she, asked.

You smiled evilly. "You will go to practice and you will make the squad." she said. "You will then do exactly as I say for the next seven days or I will remove the reality spell and return you to your original gender but still in the uniform!"

Jan, now Janet, screamed. "But... But, everyone will see me as a cross dressing pervert if you do that!" he wailed.

"All the more reason for you to do as you are told!" you replied, coldly.

Of course, you had no intention of doing such a thing to your brother as it would spark a war in the house, exposing him and yourself to mom and dad. You just wanted to scare him into submission and have a little fun before getting him off the hook. The last detail to worry about it weather Jan will accept his fate for the week or resist, in which case, you would have to adapt your strategy.

How does Jan respond?
122111212.title: No, I have a better idea.

1221112121.content:
"This is cruel and unusual, sis!" yelled Jan, furious. "At worst, you received a few days of embarrassing questions of which you could have brushed off with a bad case of the flu."

"There's more to this than you think, Jan." you thought.

Humiliating Jan was just part of your plan. You were on the cheer leading squad as well and you wanted a few of them to meet your bother as they were young witches as well. You were not sure why they voted for this strategy to get him into the group for seven days but they promised no mischief . It was common knowledge to a witch never to anger a mad scientist unless you know the exact location of their laboratory as it was the source of their powers.

"I promise I won't make you do anything dangerous." you said, rolling your eyes. "I'm not evil." then you giggled. "But, you 'will' be doing a number of cheers in that cute uniform with the boys drooling over your great body!"

Jan glared at you. "If you keep me in that ridiculous outfit one second more than seven days..." he threatened.

"Easy!" you said, sternly. "There's a little more to this than revenge, use your head!"

Jan looked at you for a moment then nodded. "There was other witches on the cheer leading squad." he said. "I take it that they want to meet me and see how I react to group magic."

You paused, the thought of 'group magic' had not dawned upon you until then. Group magic was the combined effort of several witches to test the magical resistance of a boy without him detecting it as they would all use low levels at the same time. It was a common practice, so she read, to test a witch boy who had a number of sisters."

"It's possible." you replied, honestly. "They may also be trying to get you to open up about other young mad scientists at the school."

"There are a few." admitted Jan. he sighed. "Alright, I'll go meet your friends as long as you create a believable cover story, like the one you 'should' have used when I took away your hair for the day."

You blushed, not wanting to admit that you did not find Jan's note on your desk until after you returned to school and had already created a story of your own. "Alright, you are down with a bad case of the flu for the week." you said. "May I assume you still have the 'sick leave' android in working condition?"

Jan nodded then grabbed the pink book bag you had materialized for him. "Let's get this over with." he said.

Twenty minutes later, you and 'Janet' arrived at school where you meet up with the four of your witch friends, all in cheer leader uniforms.
1221112121.title: He freaks but agrees.

12211121211.content:
You smiled as three girls, all in cheerleader uniforms, approached as you dragged Janet along. "Hey girls, this is my 'brother' Jan" you said, grinning "He's going to be joining the cheer squad today"

The three girls looked at each other then turned to you and Janet, grinning themselves. "That's great, we'll have some fun with him." said one of your friends, Abigael.

Abigael was your classic stereotypical witch. She had black hair and piercing green eyes, wearing all black. She was descended from the 'father' of all magic, the gnome family of Gorg. You had only defeated Abigael in a magic duel once, and that time you cheated. She didn't know this but suspected it. Her powers were without equal, next to the head witch who was the direct descendant of Dr. Morgana Strange. Known only as Morgana during the Dark Ages, she was wrongly accused to witchcraft, thus the need to keep magic a secret study.

"Yeah, lots of fun (cackles) when does 'she' start?" said Jodie, another friend.

Janet gave a nervous laugh, wanting to use his science to escape but you were not about to allow 'her' to do that. "Tryouts are today, right?" you asked.

Smiling, Abigael discretely waved her wand. "They are now" she said. "It should be fun to see your sibling tryout." she giggled. "Let's see if she has what it takes."

Jan(et) groaned and Christine, one of your nicer friends, placed a hand on her shoulder. "It's not so bad" she said, gently with a giggle. "Once you get into it it's kinda fun."
12211121211.title: You introduce them to 'Janet'.

choices: I want proof of this war.
1223.content:
Upon entering your brother's 'secret' laboratory, you find a strange man casually walking around, occasionally playing with the nearly countless pieces of equipment. You had never seen him before but you knew that he did not belong, especially not inside his laboratory. You had trespassed on numerous occasions but only to play pranks, you never fiddled around with his equipment as he never played with your potions. It was an unspoken rule of respect.

"How did he get inside here!?!" you thought, frightened and angry at the same time. "How did he even know Jan's laboratory was here to begin with!?!"

Then the man spoke to himself and you paused to listen. "This boy has powers that would make an adult scientist envious." he said, with an impressed look. "He would make a fine soldier in the war."

"War?" you thought, shivering. "What war!?!"

Then the man continued to talk and you were chilled to the bone by his words. "Those witches will soon learn that we 'mad' scientists are the superior and we WILL rule over everything!"

"He 'is' a mad scientist." you thought. "He's crazy if he thinks Jan will ever agree to joining up with him!"

Just then, Jan's voice rang out in the room. "Identify yourself!" he demanded.

The man froze as a number of laser cannons emerged from the floor and ceiling, aiming themselves at him. "I am Zed." replied the man, with a slight bow. "Zed Brawl. I am a 'mad' scientist, much like yourself, it is a pleasure to..."

"Cut the pleasantries, Zed!" said Jan, clearly annoyed. "State your business!"

Zed smiled. "I am here, looking for recruits to help us in a war." he replied. "A war that is raging all around you, without your or anyone else's notice."

Jan lifted a single eyebrow. "A secret war... in my backyard?" he asked. he grew red with impatience. "Just how naive do believe me to be!?!"

"This war is real, Juan." insisted Zed. "It has been going on for centuries now. In the beginning, there were only witches."

Jan's eyes widened in surprise, which Zed noticed, but he continued. "We were their sons, their brothers, and their male neighbors, all perfectly happy and feeling safe." he then frowned. "That was until the witches decided we boys, who had no magical power, were best suited as toys for their private amusement!"

"Science has been around since the age of the Pharaohs." countered Jan, unconvinced.

"Science, yes." replied Zed. "But not 'mad' science." he then continued his story. "For several years, we witch boys lived in fear of our witch relatives, doing their bidding. We did so in fear of becoming a doll for their youngest daughter, or a six year old girl with the mind of a teenage boy, or worse."

Jan took a step closer, keeping a mental hold on the lab's defensive cannons. "How did this all explode into the war you speak of?" he asked with you still listening, close by.

"One brave boy decided that he had enough." said Zed. "As a little girl, he stole a magic book and began to study it. Only, he was not studying the book to learn magic, he was searching for ways to make it work through science."

Jan and you continued to listen to the man, Zed with a certain morbid curiosity. "I take it that this one boy succeeded in his mission?" you asked.

Zed nodded. "Yes, but it was not for another twenty years of torment before he managed to create the first chaotic science laboratory." he said, with a hint of pride. "From there, he sent countless of copies of his mad science book to every witch boy in the world, giving them not only the power to fight back but to take over!"

"Thus the war between witches and mad scientists began." said Jan, following Zed's story.

"Exactly." said Zed. "As I had said, this war had raged on for centuries. However, I sense that you have a power that may tip the odds in our favor and end this war with us mad scientists reigning supreme."

For a moment, Jan is silent and you were hoping that he was thinking of a way to get rid of the madman. Then, Jan finally spoke, he said...
1223.title: You learn of a war.

choices: Perhaps if won't join me, you will. You have the same potential
12233.content:
"I'm not here to doing anything other than to make my sister's life, um interesting. Pranking her is one thing, fighting her is another" Jan says to your immense relief. You feel the same way, and although you've both done things that make each other's lives uncomfortable (especiall trying to conceal any changes from mom and dad) neither of you have done anything desinged to hurt the other

Zed looks at Jan, pleading, hoping to find a weakness "You're a twin, and twins have great power. With you on our side, the witches will never be able to recover. You can then 'prank' them without fear of retaliation! You can do anything!"

Jan looks at Zed, but you know him too well. He is going to toy with this guy. Jan slowly grins, then says "I'm not going to be one of your soldiers for your war! They haven't done anything to me"

Zed looks at Jan, then you, with growing fury. unaware that Jan's computer has started up the automatic defences, and slowly, they are targeting Zed. Also, Jan's reactor is going to self destruct mode, to prevent the intruder from stealling any tech. Both you and Jan notice, and you're quietly impressed Jan is willing to destroy his lab, letting him be vunerable to you for a week will it is rebuilt. Zed rages, seeing Jan now as an enemy, rather that a potential ally. His cold eyes fall on you. He screams...
12233.title: Computer, Intruder Alert!!

122331.content:
"Perhaps if he won't join me, you will! You have the same potential!" screamed Zed. "It's not uncommon for a witch to turn away from witchcraft and embrace super science. It is constantly advancing, increasing our knowledge of the universe around us." he grinned. "Where magic is old school, yesterday's knowledge."

"How little you understand." you thought, eying Zed. "My brother and I may have our... err... disagreements, but I stand by him in this matter!" you replied. "I will not join your psychotic crusade!"

"You have your answer, Zed Brawl!" declared Jan, strongly. "Leave in peace or be carried out in pieces!"

"This war will find you both eventually!" raged Zed, giving one last try. "Witch recruiters will approach you as well!"

"We will deny the as well!" you said, sharply. "We have no interest in this war!"

"Ask your parents what role they had in the war." said Zed. "You might be surprised."

With a mental command from Jan, which you have learned to sense, a single laser fired, making a hole in the floor inches from his feet. "Last chance, Zed." he said coldly. "Leave now or forever stay."

Zed sighed. "Very well." he said, equally as coldly. "You leave me no choice but to...."
122331.title: Are you a good witch or a bad witch?

122332.content:
As the intruder, Zed, talked to Jan, you returned to your normal human form just in case your brother needs your help. "That Zed character looks fairly strong." you thought, trying not to be seen. "Still, he can't possible beat Jan and I with his laboratory defenses backing us up."

Suddenly, Zed, spotted you and screamed, "Witch!"

He angrily threw an energy blast your way, causing you to scream, as you dove out of its path, behind another station, looking for cover. The man moved to fire again, only to get blasted by Jan. Zed stumbled for a moment but manged to keep his balance as he glared at Jan, he seemed to feel betrayed.

"Leave my sister alone!" yelled Jan. "Your fight is with me!"

Zed glared at Jan and moved to attack him. Returning the favor, you then sent an energy blast of your own, sending him back a few steps more. "We are the best of two worlds, Zed!" you screamed. "Your war is not welcome here!"

Jan's laboratory defenses then turned upon Zed and began to fire, forcing him to put up an energy field to protect himself from serious injury. "Leave now while you still can!" you ordered. "My brother's defenses are relentless!"

You and Jan then began to work together, throwing energy blasts at Zed, both hoping that he would get the hint and teleport out, just as you guessed he had got in. Only, to your surprise, Zed suddenly let out a loud grunt, sending his force field outward at high speeds. You and Jan were thrown off your feet as the the energy field overloaded the laser cannons, completely destroying them. The laboratory, although filled with smoke from the cannons, again became silent as Zed then walked up to you and Jan, lying stunned on the floor.

"My force field can be used as a weapon." he explained, smiling. "It will destroy any nonliving object by sending a high voltage charge through it at the molecular level." he then raised his hand at the two of you. "I gave you the chance to join me Jan but if you refuse to be a part of the solution, I have no choice but to treat you as part of the problem."

Still to stunned to do anything, you prayed the Jan could. Zed laughed as a large energy ball appeared in his hand and you closed your eyes, bracing yourself for pain. Then, you heard something like the rapid movement of machinery as rd a computerized voice cried out, "PROTECT THE CHILDREN!"

You opened your eyes in time to see a massive robot, that was once one of the mad science stations, strike Zed with its metallic fist, throwing him across the room. The other stations around you transformed into robots as well, declaring the same statement, "PROTECT THE CHILDREN!"

You were both impressed and terrified that Jan had such extreme defenses guarding his laboratory. Then, you saw a look of complete shock on Jan's face and realized that he too knew nothing of the robot defenders. "This is insane!" you thought. "If Jan didn't build those robots, who did?" then the answer came as you gasped, whispering, "Dad!"

You turned back to Zed and watched as he desperately fired his energy field weapon at the robots, only to find that they had energy fields of their own, protecting their metal bodies. The robots continued their assault upon the intruder until he had no choice but to retreat or be destroyed. He glared at you and Jan, saying, "This is not over!" before teleporting out to an unknown location. After he was gone, the robots returned to their original positions and transformed back into the laboratory stations they once were.

"He will be back, and soon." said Jan, breathing heavily. "I have to get to work and set up a force field to keep him from teleporting in again."

"Wait a minute, Jan!" you said. "Aren't you curious who built those robots who just saved our lives!?!"

"It was clearly one of our parents." replied Jan, flatly. "However, time is against us, we can not allow that madman to get back into this house!" he sighed. "I'm just as curious as you are, sis, but we have to set priorities. First, we will strengthen our defenses, then we can talk to mom or dad."

You nodded, knowing that he was right, and helped him the best you could. Within an hour, a low level forcefield was placed around the house to prevent anyone from teleporting directly in. you and Jan then quickly cleaned yourselves off and moved to the kitchen to find your mom and dad. Only, they seemed very worried. What worried you was that they also seemed to have been waiting for you.

"Please sit down, kids." said mom, softly. "We need to have a discussion."
122332.title: "Witch" and he attacks you

1223321.content:
"What's this all about, mom." you asked, concerned.

"Have we done something to upset you?" asked Jan.

Mom sighed. "Fifteen years ago, your father and I met on the field of battle in a secret war that still rages between witches and mad scientists." she said. "We were both healers, neither one really interested in fighting so we worked together, as a team, trying to keep our growing friendship a secret."

"So there is a war." you thought, startled. "But that would mean..." "No!" you said, out loud, alarmed.

"Your perception is correct, Chis." said dad, calmly. "Your mother is a witch and I am a quote, unquote, 'mad' scientist. Your mother and I became very close or the next several months, helping to heal the wounded on both sides, earning us a many friends... and a few enemies."

"We both ran away from the war shortly after falling in love and had a private wedding with only a handful of our closest friends to participate." said mom, continuing. "To this day, we are both considered rogues by some of own people because we did the unthinkable, we married the enemy."

"Less than a year later, you two were born and we knew you each had great power." added dad. "We both decided to train you as best as we could, without ever mentioning the war, hoping you would never learn of it." he sighed. "We were both naive to think that we could keep the war out forever. My laboratory gave warning that Lieutenant Zed was inside the house, your mother and I witnessed the entire encounter."

"You 'saw' that?" you asked, nervous.

"We did and we are very proud of you both for defending each other." said mom. "However, Zed now knows that you two have sided with each other and will treat you, Jan, as one of the enemy witches."

Jan swallowed down a hard lump then steeled himself. "Let him believe what he wants!" he said. "I am protecting my family, I have no interest in any war!"

"I feel the same way." you said, quickly. "Jan and I may fight but don't get the wrong idea, it's for training only."

"That is why we have decided to give you each a few lessons in the other's power." said dad. "I will teach you, Chris, some of the basics of mad science while mom will teach your bother, Jan, some of the basics of magic."

"This will allow you both to defend yourselves more quickly in case someone tries to get you involved in this war." said mom. "The only issue is that only girls can work magic and only boys can work mad science..."

"So we'll have to switch genders for a while." you said with a sigh. "For how long?"

"Just for the weekend, no longer." said mom. "What do you say?"
1223321.title: A tale of forbidden love.

12233211.content:
"I'll do it, if you tell me what we're up against. This Zed, is he alone? How many others are there? Just him? Dozens. Hundreds?" you demand.

Dad sighs, "I don't know. Before your mother and I got out of the mayhem, there was about two hundred scientists, worldwide, almost all fighting their secret war. Probably the same number of witches."

Mom nods, "Yes, that is about right. From what I heard, in the year 1995, there was 206 witches, including myself. Some of us saw what was going to happen, and got out."

"What was going to happen?" Jan asks. The anwser chills you to the bone. "Mutual destruction. Neither side wanted to give in and recognize the good points of the other. From what I heard, most of the survivors renounced the war. There is probably about 15 survivors from the conflict, though the numbers are starting to increase due to the children gaining their powers. Obviously, Zed survived, and wants to continue the war."

Both you and Jan look at each other, thinking the same thought, that this news is something you prefered not to know. "Okay, I'm ready, but I don't want you to change us. Jan, want to have a duel against me? Loser gets transformed by the other, to which ever form he or she wants, while winner choses his or her own form" you offer.

Jan smiles, "Bring it on"
12233211.title: You and Jan agree.

choices: Hank and Sarah came to visit.
122332111.content:
You started first with a gender spell, which Jan easily dodged by teleporting out of the line of fire. He reappeared behind you and fired an 'event', as he called it, the technological version of a spell or curse. It was basically an energy blast containing millions of nanites, or single celled machines, mentally programed to do whatever he wished done. They all grew inside of him and your dad, the secret behind the power of true mad science.

"I can see your spells as well as you can see my events, Chris." said Jan, firing his attack. "We could be at this all day."

"Then it's a simple matter of one out lasting the other." you replied, dodging the attack and sending another of your own. "We both know that working magic and mad science is like heavy exercise."

Then, Jan reached into a pocket and threw a handful of dust in your direction. You screamed, jumping out of the way, holding a hand over your mouth and nose. "Event dust!" you thought. "If I breath in even a little, I'll lose!" you sighed, mentally kicking yourself. "I forgot to set any rules, which means anything goes and Jan knows it!"

You continued to hold your breath, firing back an occasional spell, until the dust had fully settled before breathing again. Fortunately, event dust was fairly heavy and settled in a matter of seconds, becoming harmless upon hitting the floor to prevent accidents. You could have tossed a potion at Jan but he had serums, the technological equivalent, and you did not want to escalate the duel any further unless he did so first.

"You've gotten better at this, Jan." you said, smiling. "You might actually be a challenge to me."

You were trying to throw Jan off guard, hoping he would give you an opening to strike and end the duel. Only, to your dismay, Jan was not fooled. "Nice try, sis." he told you. "I rarely fall for a trick twice."

Jan fired off another event, which you dodged but gasped, surprised, as it suddenly turned, following you! Seeing your expression, Jan laughed. "Like my new tactic?" he asked as you dodged it a second time. "I programed the nanites to 'pilot' the energy blast to its target, no matter where it goes!"

Hank, a well built boy with jet black hair and green eyes, walked in through the kitchen door with Sarah. She was a very petite young girl with waist length sun blond hair and bright hazel, almost yellow eyes. As you saw then enter, both wearing their school uniforms, your face turned pale, knowing that your body switch spell would hit them.

"Hey, guys." said Hank, concerned. "What's up, we..."

He never finished his sentence as your spell it them both, throwing them to the floor, causing you to wince. "Sorry, guys!" you said, seeing then slowly get back up. "You really should learn to knock."

"What hit me?" asked 'Sarah', moaning. "I feel so weird." then she noticed her change in voice and screamed, discovering whose body 'she' was in. "What happened!?! Why am I suddenly Sarah!?!"

Then a manly scream echoed from 'Hank's' lips. "Why am I Hank now!?!" he asked, alarmed. "I don't want to be a boy!"

"You think I like being a girl!?" asked 'Sarah'. then she paused. "Wait a minute, what's wrong with being a boy?"

You smiled, as did Jan. "We like to challenge each other every now and then." you replied. "It keeps things interesting." then, you wondered if you should tell them about the war.

"Can you two change us back?" asked 'Sarah', begging. "I'm feeling a draft in this skirt!"

"Wait a minute!" protested 'Sarah' "A boy's life is not all fun and games, you know."

'Harry' giggled. "It's all a part of being a girl... Sarah."

"Well, now that we have that all settled." said dad. "How about I order out some pizza?"

Everyone approved then idea and headed out, into the living room while dad pulled a cell phone from his chest pocket as he walked out himself. You were about to follow when 'Hank' quickly grabbed you arm. "What do you say we play a litle prank on the 'girls' tonight?" he asked, quietly.

Inside your laboratory, deep below the house, you laughed maniacally as you pressed a number of buttons on a machine you had just finished constructing. You turned to her grinning. "Don't tease." you said, jokingly.

Elvira smiled. "Unless you want to find yourself a three year old girl, get yourself to bed, mister." she told you. "Magic, like mad science is exhausting to use, you need your rest before you burn yourself out!"

You conceded her point. "You are right, dear." you said. "I'll get back to the machine after a good nights rest. The twins don't expect me back home for another day so I should be able to finish my project in time."
